I love everything about Eat. from the restaurants decor and location. Both suggest an approachability and made me feel that this was somewhere where I can be myself. 
The menu, as many have stated before, is not that big but I'd rather have a small menu of amazing choices than a huge encyclopedia of a menu with minimal choices. The menu were pages attached to a clipboard, another show on how unpretentious but subtly creative this restaurant is, and cater majority to Brunch items. All menu items, I was happy to read on the bottom of the menu, are bought locally and I could tell by how fresh everything was. 
I ordered the Truffled Egg Sandwich which was suggested on Eater Vegas and the portion was bigger than I expected. It's eggs, bacon, mushrooms and feta cheese on ciabatta bread and it had a side of chive potatoes and a strawberry.  Everything was cooked to perfection! 
Overall, food was phenomenal and staff was friendly and efficient. The decor was nature meets industrial meets modern. There's a food counter available if you're alone and prefer to eat quickly while on a lunch break. Check out the art at the entrance of the restaurant which feature aspiring young artists which I thought was a great move on Chef Natalie Youngs part because she knows personally how great a helping hand is so that you can fully realize your dream and with this restaurant I can say without a doubt her dream has came into fruition. I'll be back again.

Amazing! The best breakfast I had EVER!!! For those OC peeps, the potatoes remind me of The Omelette Parlor, which is no longer around.  I had the egg breakfast with potatoes, bacon and toast.  Orgasmic food. I would go back a million times over!!! Great food, great people...just great!!!

Cute place and great service. Loved the cinnamon biscuits! I also had the breakfast sandwich, but it was a bit too greasy for my liking. The food is fresh and high quality and the vibe is great. Looking forward to going back.

The pancakes are AMAZING....crunchy of the edges and so damn fluffy.  The best pancakes I ever had...granted I don't eat much pancakes but these were the bomb.  

The waitstaff was awesomely amazing as well.  We ordered the eggs Benedict and the pancakes to share.  The Benedict was fresh and the potatoes was yummy.  The plates came to our table hot, so you know if was not just sitting back there for awhile.  I love my food hot.  

The waitstaff was awesome because they brought us an extra plate without us asking and they replaced my plate when he saw we were going to share the pancakes and wanted me to have a clean plate.  Love it.  Great experience here with great food.

This place is such a hipster place...u could not tell from the outside or where it is located.

This a great place to eat. Food is prepared with quality ingredients and good size portions. There is usually a line but worth the wait. Service was great. We had some special dietary needs and the waiter and cook staff were very accommodating.

Love, love, love little places like this! Eclectic d√©cor with the popular industrial feel. 

The cinnamon biscuits and fresh strawberry sauce were sweet and delicious.

My husband had the two eggs with bacon, potatoes and toast that were done perfectly. Holy moly the toast was huge! Chewy and fresh too. Just yum.

I had the truffled egg breakfast sandwich with potatoes-  simply AMAZING!

Coffee was hot and fresh. Waitstaff were friendly and appeared to help each other out. Like every table was "their" table also. 

It felt very comfortable in the restaurant. I could've stayed all day and sipped coffee.

The location left a little to be desired but it wasn't like we were going to camp out overnight.
Best shrimp and grits I've had on the west coast by far! Super excited about this place.
Great breakfast spot in downtown with decent prices. Shrimp and grits we're awesome, egg sandwich was just as good. The fresh squeezed OJ was spectacular. Would definitely go back!

I have been here twice and I want to love it, super nice place but the service I have gotten was just blahhh and snooty.  I don't even remember the food just that the menu was totally truncated for Brunch on Sunday.

I was looking forward to taking some out-of-town guests here but after having a couple bites of the food I was completely embarrassed. We could have went to a dive coffee shop and had better food. I actually apologized to my guests because it was that horrible. Stop trying to hide bad reviews and improve your damn food instead.

I've heard great things about this place and yes it was packed with a line.  I may have just got the wrong plate and will give them one more try.

I had the Country Fried steak.  It looked great but the meat was thin, dry and chewy like trying to chew and eat down ROADKILL.  I should have said something and sent it back.  I kept thinking maybe I got the end.  Nope it was bad.

Eggs, Bread and potatoes where done nicely but very disappointed.

This place was OK. I agree with most comments about it being overpriced and overhyped. My husband had the pancakes which he said were too doughy. I had the huevos motulenos, which was pretty good though I don't really feel  the bananas added anything to the dish. It was very very busy when we went -- service was so so and it very noisy. Not inclined to go back.

Great food, fast kitchen, friendly server. I got the worst seat in the house though basically AT a computer terminal. Employees literally hit my silverware as they swiveled the terminal around. It definitely takes away from the experience.

If you have ever had a good chicken fried steak then run to 'eat.' for breakfast.  It is  stunning.  All the dishes the table ordered were full flavored and wonderful.  Lisa was taken aback when the waiter said, "she's not going to do that" to a light preparation request for her dish.

Our server was earnest but not professional.  Not a complaint or disappointment but I mention it only because it slows down the meal which increases your chances of  standing in line waiting for a table.

So to recap,  if you like your food full flavored search out 'eat' and that would be 4 stars.  If you're a "gravy on the side with dry toast" sort of person don't waist* your time and that would be 1 star.  I'm a lard ass and will be back soon.

Mike

*It is a pun.

Ate here on a Sunday morning during brunch time, when everyone is out and about. They had a wait (10-20 minutes). We were sat within 10 minutes. Excellent service, our food arrived faster than we expected. We ordered the shrimp and grits\/sausage and pancakes. Wow awesome food! The pancakes were so fresh and fluffy. Next time we're in Vegas we'll be sure to stop again for brunch. Not to mention how cute the place was.

Breakfast before Life is Beautiful Festival....

We knew we were up against a crowd but honestly, we only waited around 20 minutes.  EAT came highly recommended so we had to try it.  It's located in the downtown Las Vegas neighborhood on a corner right behind the festival, so it was easy walking distance for everything.

The pancakes!  Yes...These were the best pancakes I've ever ate.  The were Golden brown with a perfect crisp to the top.  Full of flavor and not dry at all and it was served with a chicken sausage. Now the Huevos Motulenos, another great choice.  The menu is not huge my any chance, but they definitely have some really good options.  Next time we will try some of those biscuits and fried deviled eggs that I saw everyone having.

Prices are very affordable.  Don't miss out...

Don't come here if you have more than 3 people in your party.  I can't comment on the food because we never got seated.  The girl told us our party of 6 would be seated in 30 minutes...over an hour later as every single person with a party of 3 or less came in after us was seated, we were still just sitting, waiting.  The helpless girls at the front were not apologetic at all, saying there was nothing they can do because they can't move tables together, we'd just have to wait until a larger party got up.  Could be 10 minutes, could be another 50 minutes.  We left and they did not give 2 shits.  Will never go back just for the lack of customer care alone
Excellent food and service.  Pancakes were the best I ever had.  Prices are very reasonable for the exceptional quality of the food.

I love eat.!  It's my favorite brunch place in town.  Everything I've had there has been absolutely to die for.  Upon my first visit, I had a waitress recommend the pancake - she said it would change my life.  She was right.  It's a sweet (but not too sweet), fluffy pancake with a nice buttery crisp to the outside.  I'm not sure what they put in it to give it a creamy flavor but omg I wake up thinking about going to get one often.  The potatoes (so yummy), eggs, bacon, toast & everything else I've ordered is always fresh & cooked correctly.  I've also tried their cinnamon biscuits with the berry compote - freaking brilliant.  The waiters\/waitresses are always so nice & accommodating.  Do yourself a favor & get yourself over there for breakfast\/brunch\/lunch soon!
Eggs Benedict is delicious served automatically with turkey bacon, poached egg was by far the fluffiest I have had. Highly suggest stopping by.

So many choices downtown these days... 3 1\/2 stars

We were looking for lunch around 11:30 on a Friday afternoon. We ran into a wait time at a few places, then sought out eat. We had to wait 20 minutes here too. Apparently unavoidable. It was bustling inside and noisy. It's a cute place with an industrial vibe. 

The service lacked any sincerity. We got everything we needed but there was no explanation of the menu of suggestions or conversation at all. 

The menu had a grilled cheese with tomato soup. I asked to substitute the green chicken chile pozole instead.   She said that would be A-OK for a $1 up charge. She also offered avocado and bacon on my sandwich. Of course! By no means did I expect this to be a free addition; however, it turned out to be a $6 charge which made my grilled cheese and soup somewhere in the neighborhood of $16. Yowsa. It was delightful. The sourdough bread was giant, no less than 1" thick for each slice. It was soaked 3\/4 of the way through with butter. The sandwich was crispy, chewy, yummy and decadent. The pozole was spicy, and very flavorful. Loads of veggies and shredded chicken. Very good. I shared it with my little guy and still had leftovers to take home. It was a generous portion. 

My compadres enjoyed their arugula salad and chicken sandwich very much. We all drank water. The bill was $45 for 2 sandwiches and a salad. So $18 each for lunch. I guess not bad. Gotta pay the price to hang with the in crowd! 

I would certainly return for more delicious food. Many of the brunch menu items sounded intriguing. Expect busy, noisy and delicious!

Without question,
Seriously,
Hands-down,
It's the best breakfast spot in Vegas.

Let me first say, I can't cook but I can make a few breakfast dishes.  Now, I'm no chef, but what they do here at eat is culinary excellence.  How they pack layers of flavor from the first bite to the last makes me want to quit cooking and just come here every morning.

Tip: Eggs Benedict is not on the menu but if you go on the weekend like I did they can make it special for you.
Great little spot downtown next to the Container Park to grab a tasty, warm and friendly breakfast and lunch.

Maybe I waited too long to try this place? Maybe it was great when they first opened? Pretty solid 5 star rating on here, something is awry. 

Came in on a Saturday morning, we had expected to wait so that was no big deal, gave us a chance to look over the menu and yelp pics. 

After seeing all the reviews and praise for the Huevos Montulenos, I decided to give it a go, even tho on paper it sounded horrid. I like weird combinations, so I was willing to give it a shot. My friend got the Eggs Benedict. 

Food arrives. A few bites into our food, both of look at each other, and I know exactly what she is thinking. I told her mine was really gross and she agreed. I like peas, I like bananas and I love feta. But the combination of them with black beans and eggs and sauce didn't work for me. I made her give it a try and she was mad at me once she put it in her mouth (hey, sharing is caring). I tried her Benny's and I agreed they were underwhelming. Turkey bacon had no flavor, and the addition of spinach and tomatoes really overpowered the Hollandaise. 

In addition to two terrible entrees, this place is ridiculously loud. I had to raise my voice a couple octaves to talk to my friend who was sitting 2 feet in front of me. 

Overpriced 
Loud 
Gross food
Parking sucks
Best brunch in town! Super friendly staff and the food was delicious, served within 15 minute of ordering. It's a must try!

If your server utters anything with the words "deviled eggs" in it, say "yes" and start throwing money at them. Their deep-fried deviled eggs with liquid Schwartz on them are amazing. I don't remember what they were specifically called (they were an orally-described special) because I pretty much blanked out from eating them because they were so good. 
I also had the prime rib hash with jalape√±o and salsa. It was good, but I was surprised by the cilantro (I'm a cilantro-tastes-soapy genetic type dude). 
This place is super popular. It's one of the businesses backed by Tony Hsieh's Downtown Project. So it's bringing new business to a neighborhood that needs some love.

Pretty decent place for breakfast.   Wifey and I were downtown a week or so ago and decided to have a late breakfast \/ early lunch.   After paying for parking, we got in line there.   It appears we hit the lunch crowd, but hey that happens.  We opted to share a high top with another group, not a big deal.   

We both ordered coffee which was good, but not life changing.   I had the truffled egg sandwich and wifey got the hash.   Mine was good, but as other have mentioned, it was heavy on the truffle oil.   The potatoes and toast was good.   Wifey enjoyed her hash which is always a good thing.  

Overall, it's a solid place.   I think it's a little over-hyped at the  moment.   I'd like to see if this place can find it's groove.   I have high hopes for EAT.   Yeah, I'll be back.

Beautiful Food.  Beautiful Service.  Simply Amazing.  Even the presentation was really phenomenal.......And "GARY", our waiter was SOOOOOOO AWESOME!!!!  He literally gave us the best customer service! 

Thanks Again Gary and well see you when we're back in Vegas! 


HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

I really enjoy the brunch here. It's good though it has a bit too much of a hipster vibe. The food is not amazingly stand out, though the beignets I recently had were pretty amazing.

It's a nice place for a casual lunch as well if you have the time. During the week it can be a bit busy for lunch though so be warned.
very good food, easy comfortable atmosphere. tends to be crowded and a bit loud.

By far the best breakfast place I have ever been to. There is no need to even review any BS that some other ass clown wanted to complain about. If you don't try this place out, your a fool. Try their pancakes...

I have been told many times to get here! I finally made it! Me and wife for breakfast! Simple! Refreshing for the food scene and we will be back! Had the truffled egg sandwich, very clean and good, wife had killer grilled cheese that was crazy good! Very inspiring atmosphere!

Good service, clean atmosphere, and interesting concept.  I liked that a counter was available with a great view of the kitchen action.

Great pancakes! Some of the best in Las Vegas (stiff completion with DuPar's and Babystacks).  Pancakes are as good as advertised.  Golden brown, crispy edges, well cooked middle, fresh-tasting batter.  Nice touch serving real maple syrup and a seasonal fruit garnish.

Unfortunately, the chicken fried steak I had didn't live up to expectations.  The meat had tough spots that made it hard to cut and eat.  The gravy is not the classic white gravy I like, but a brown gravy with a green herb and scallions (?).  The gravy had plenty of sausage, but the green herbs\/scallions dominated the flavor...which I disliked.  I think it was fried in a fryer, while I prefer my chicken-fried steak be pan fried.  I would stick with the pancakes or try one of their unique breakfast dishes on my next visit.

The place is somewhat pricey ($9 for three pancakes and a sausage).

I love the small local businesses downtown and farm to table food. Eat has a great menu for lunch and breakfast. The only thing that kills me is I always manage to arrive at 11 am, just missing breakfast. The turnover from breakfast to lunch can take up to half an hour. The wait is too long if you only have a short lunch break. Just serve the entire menu all the way through. Then again the kitchen may not be appropriate to accomadate that many options. 

Anyways aside from that, pleasant staff and great food. Cool vibe too.
Eat at Eat!!

Hip. Downtown. And Hip. This was one of the first places to put downtown on the map. eat. is always crowded and the food is very good (alas not great). Nothing I hate more than to hear someone who hasnt been to Vegas in years start dogging downtown. 

Past tense my friend.--- eat. has a very cosmopolitan crowd and should be the first step in enjoying the downtown experience. And besides I think Natalie smiled at me- who could want anything more.
In a word...or two...Yum Yum!!  Very good service and the food was amazing.  I'm Vegan and the options rocked...Left full and fully satisfied!

Very impressed with this place! In Vegas on vacation and found this place on Yelp. Even though it was a busy weekend morning, the wait was only 20 minutes. Service was excellent, and attentive. The food spoke for itself. We got the biscuits with the fruit compote (biscuits were made in house), not too sweet which we loved. My husband got the chicken fried steak. The batter was delicious, very crispy...gravy was kind of sweet and also had some spice, delicious! I got the shrimp and grits. Came with over easy egg and pico de gallo on top. So fresh, so good! Food came so quick which was awesome because we were starving. The decor was clean and had an eclectic feel, which I loved. Honestly, I have no complaints! Recommend to anyone.

On what planet is it currently okay to have a BREAKFAST joint that is catering to the young and hip, and NOT have soy milk? I was grumpy from the start when I was told at the beginning of my breakfast that it was cows milk or nothing. Seriously, even effing Starbucks has soy milk....  That alone is nothing short of appalling.

But it's okay, because then they served me a tofu scramble that was so boring that I almost dozed off while writing this.

The mediocrity of this place is staggering.

The owner Natalie is really cool! The food is absolutely delicious. Depending on who is cooking it can come out a little greasy so just ask for light oil and it's perfect!!! Love this place. Grilled cheese sandwich is awesome

By far my favorite place to eat in Vegas after living here for 8 months and trying so many new places. The vibe is cozy like a Seattle coffee shop, the food is divine, and the owner walks through the small dining area talking with guests. I love everything about this place. 5 stars all the way.

Loved it. Ive always had problems finding breakfast to my liking in Las Vegas. Until today. I had the eggs, shrimp and grits and it was so perfect. I look forward to visiting again some day. Great vibe, great food, great service.

great place for breakfast. Hipster-ish atmosphere, great coffee (medium roast, no acidity), amazing food.
I had the shrimp and grits (amazing), hubby had the country fried steak, and his brother had the tomato soup (wow, delicious) with grilled cheese (Texas toast, extra bacon). We were so full, I can't believe I didn't finish everything off the plate.
Owner was present, which always makes a good impression. They seem to have bussers (clean tables, clear tables, bring drinks), and servers (take food orders); food was brought out by kitchen personnel. 
Do yourself a favor and experience their food, I promise you won't be disappointed!!

Overhyped!  We ordered the passion fruit tea, truffle egg sandwich and the grilled cheese\/tomato soup combos. Wasn't horrible, but not "all that and a bag of chips."

 Passion tea was fragrant and unsweetened. Truffle egg sandwich was okay. Eggs were fluffy. Some of the potatoes and onion slices were nice and brown. Griled cheese was big (thick bread). the tomato soup reminded me of the tomato sauce on pizza.

Nothing to write home about. Tried it, not worth coming back for. 

Service was decent. Had to pay for street parking ($1\/hr), then we walked to the Container Park.
This place was one of the highlights of our recent trip to Las Vegas! The food was amazing and I would recommend anyone staying close by to check it out!

When I check out a new spot twice in one week, you know something is up!  Love everything about this place.

Location -
eat. is located on the corner of Carson and 7th street.  There's plenty of meter parking and it is tucked just far enough away from LV Blvd to be easy access.  It wouldn't be downtown if there weren't a few questionable characters hanging around, but this place is an oasis.  

Food -
First time I split the DWBLT with homemade chips (and the really good pickle is aptly named) and the Argula Salad with added chicken breast.  Although the upcharge for the chicken was a little $$, I can assure you it is worth your money.  This salad was very nicely done.  Fresh argula, asparagus, roast almonds and roasted tomatoes.  Definitely unique. Loved both, but I prefer a lighter lunch (although judging by some of my frequent lunch hangouts, you may be calling me a liar) so may not order the DWBLT again.  That sourdough bread is seriously delicious and seriously heavy.   

Second trip, I had the Banh Mi Chicken sandwich.  This thing was freaking awesome!  I just love jalapeno coleslaw especially when you throw some radishes in the mix!  Chips again because they are just that good.  I also stole a bite of the grilled cheese sandwich dipped in tomato soup.  Yum!

Service -
Both trips, service has been great.  The servers are hipster enough to prove you are downtown, but not so hipster they forget how to smile.  Love the open kitchen, the entire decor and just the vibe of this place.  It really is something special and further proof that downtown is worth revitalizing and worth a visit for lunch.

I love Eat. Been there 3 times and it never disappoints. I'm a big fan of breakfast and am very picky about where I go. Eat is at the top of my list (along with Bagel Cafe) in Vegas. Chef Nat is terrific: welcoming and hands on when she needs to be.

My new favorite breakfast restaurant of all time! Everything tasted amazing and was well priced. Two complaints:
1. My stomach wasn't big enough
2. It's going to be a LONG drive from CA when I crave their food 

Do yourself and your taste buds a favor and go "eat." here! See what I did there?!

Best Breakfast\/Food\/Atmosphere in downtown Vegas!  Menu is different with a great selection of things you would not imagine... Short walk from Freemont St with a vibe any local would enjoy. Very clean, excellent service and friendly staff ready to help you enjoy some good eat... Worth it!

While here for a friend's wedding, I chose to stay downtown rather than the Strip. I thought I'd miss out on some good meals, but I was wrong. My hotel's concierge recommended "eat" so I looked online and found great reviews. From the time I was greeted by the hostess, to when I was served by Ali, my waitress, to when I shook the hand of the manager as I walked out, I felt as if I were the only patron in the place. Clearly, I am no VIP yet I was treated like an important customer. Yes, the food was great (loved the Eggs Benedict!) but the service was fantastic. Thanks to the hard working cooks and staff for a marvelous Sunday brunch!

Not ringing in as the last expensive breakfast but I'll give it to them, they have some great food! I had the huevos man..something. It was bomb! The banana was something out of left field but a great addition to the dish. The wife had the Fremont Benedict. It was really tasty too. We sat outside because we could bring our pups. Our service was perfect. They didn't bother us every two seconds but didn't leave us forever before checking on us. They were very friendly and pleasant to order from. I got the large o.j. which was freshly squeezed and a good thing since it was $6. The wife got coffee for $3. I thought it was cool they offered her another cup to go when we got our check. Like I said, great service. Well be back. Wonder if they have French toast?

This is definitely a good eat!!! I went here 2 days ago and what a surprise...the service was fast and the food not only taste good butlooked good too...I already know what I will order on my future visit (s)...when guests come to town this is on the top of the list...they need to expand because people are literally walking in constantly...what a great business and we'll organized. Thank god I don't live close by to that place. ..lol

Great pancake, egg is egg bacon is bacon. Great vibe good location.
Originally I ordered shrimp ok boy sandwich, asked if they put any Cilantro, waitress told me there will not be any cilantro, but napa slaw came with cilantro, they were nice enough to take the food away, still it made me feel sorry for them. But still I will come back and try other items on the menu
Their costumer service sucks!!! Our waiter (his name was Gary) treated us like trash. He was extremely rude. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Their food was decent though.

There's a lot of good here.  Here's the short list of amazing things, in order of awesomeness.

Green Chile Pozole:  It's cold.  You need soup.  This is some of the best soup you'll ever eat.

Anything with Bacon:  Their Bacon is KILLER.  Super meaty, cooked just right.  You aren't going wrong with this side.

Chicken Sandwich:  Sounds simple.  And it is, but it's PERFECT.

Pastrami Reuben:  Ok, not the most traditional Reuben you'll ever eat, but it's delicious.

Deviled Eggs:  You have NEVER had a deviled egg like this.  It's amazeballs

Grilled Cheese:  The way this is served, with the GIANT pieces of toast, is totally ridiculous.  But don't let that stop you. It's delicious.

Skip:

Cinnamon Biscuits with fruit: this is the only dish I have had here that I was uninspired by.  It just didn't work for me.

Potatoes as a side:  They're fine, just boring.

Ate here once about a month ago. I thought the food was great so I decided to return for lunch with friends. Arrived and the wait was 1 hour. That's fine no problem. Waited 1.5 hours then the hostess told me the chef said not to seat us. Don't you think they should have told us that before we waited over an hour. This place is very popular but it won't be for long if they do this to people.

I was excited to eat here because of all the Yelp raves about it. It's about 10 minutes from the strip and parking was easy (meter parking). Also the name of the restaurant is in a cool stylized font with the whole period thing at the end of the word eat--just makes you want to eat, right?

I went with the Huevos Motulenos which I honestly didn't like--I'm not sure why so many people are nuts over this dish. I feel like the salsa just doesn't go well in a main course. It was an interesting concoction of food items I've never really had together but I wish I had gotten something else. I wanted to try the Truffled Egg Sandwich but they only serve it Monday through Friday. Their pancakes are huge.

I want to give this place 4 stars, but I can't because were somewhat duped into buying an appetizer. So, you know how lots of restaurants give you free bread before your meal? Our waitress asked us, after serving us water, "would you like some biscuits?" Well, to us this sounded like pre-meal free bread so we said yes. What she really meant to say is, "would you like to start with an appetizer called the 'cinnamon biscuits, warm strawberry compote'?" The money wasn't the issue, but the trickery into ordering more on the menu. She might as well have started by saying, "would you like to start with the Dom Perignon?"

The staff was very nice\/efficient. I recommend checking this joint out if you want some breakfast off the strip. Is it worth taking a taxi here? No. I really only went because I had my car. Albeit, this is a decent breakfast eatery.

We stumbled upon Eat while waiting for our Neon Museum tour and took a chance with its very nondescript exterior.  The decor and ambience inside were a pleasant surprise.  The food was very good.  We had the herbed eggs benedict, the eggs, bacon and grits and the waffles.  I would definitely order the benedict again.

The only negative thing was that our waiter was not so friendly or even prompt.  The hostess ended up rescuing us with taking our drink order before he even stopped by.  Someone else brought our food and I cannot recall him ever speaking to us.  

I realize anyone can have a bad day and overall it was a good experience.  We will be back.

Food was homemade and amazing!  I got the Huverovos --it was an odd combo I would never normally think of--from black beans, eggs, to bananas, and feta and home fries. It was delicious and very filing.  My boyfriend got the fried steak and was very happy.

The food was fantastic.  I came in for breakfast and got the Chicken Fried Steak with eggs over easy.  I have read some reviews before hand that were kind of bagging on the service.  That was not my experience.  The server I got was attentive and friendly.  Definitely going back.

Short:
Food: pretty good
Ambiance: cute
Service: really good - lots of people working

Long:

Food: I got the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup, and my boyfriend had the - prime rib? roast beef? can't remember - special hash. The grilled cheese and soup were good, but I was disappointed by how high the bread:cheese ratio was. 2" of bread for a very thin layer of cheese. The hash was also good, but I wish the potatoes had a little more bite to them, rather than just being mushy. The COFFEE, however, is fantastic and delicious

Ambiance: I really liked the way the place was done. Felt like a casual, industrial cafe. It's not easy to pull off the steel & concrete look without looking cheap, but they nailed it. The inside of the door says "ate" (as you are exiting), which I thought was super cute

Service: There were a TON of people working. They were all friendly and responsive without being intrusive. 

If I'm in downtown, I'd definitely come here again, but not sure I'd make the trek all the way from Henderson *just* to eat here, if you know what I mean.
What a great breakfast we had at Eat !  The potatoes were the best ever and amazingly restaurant coffee that tastes good!  What a find!

Really good place to eat. No pun intended lol

 When I got off work I was really hungry. So. I decided to go eat at eat. The service was amazing but I will have to get my own silverware. Not meaning to sound like a prude. Plus the end of my toast was too hard.

On the bright side it wasn't that much for all that I got. Side of eggs. Side of bacon. Side of toast. Plus an entr√©e salad. (Of which I forgot the name but it was their special.) Goat cheese, almonds, greens, strawberries, buleberries, and their housemade special vinaigrette which I also forgot the name. Oh, plus water and an Arnold Palmer.

I also wanted to add, every server came up and asked if I was okay at least once. *thumbs up* That's good service.

I'm pretty sure it was a simple error to have forgotten the silverware. I mean, I did get there 30 min before closing. 

All in all, delicious. :) second time here and I'm digging it. Definitely will be coming a third time.

I really like this place for a downtown dining option. My parents love the place as well. The truffled egg sandwich is so decadent and full of flavor. The country fried steak and eggs were spot on perfection. Add this to the super friendly service and you have a 5 star review! This is located right next to the container park so parking may be scarce at times, but with Carson kitchen and o-faced doughnuts right down the street it's a new hip locals scene.

EAT. serves delicious, healthy-ish food in a small cafe in Old Vegas; don't expect EAT. to be Applebee's or a buffet.

I went to EAT. quite some time ago. It was the best food I had eaten while I was in Vegas for a business trip (week-long). I wish I had been there sooner. I heard about it from Anthony Bourdain's show and how he raved about Natalie Young's talents as a young up-and-coming chef. 

The menu is smallish, but what EAT. does make is delicious, quality food (over quantity). Anyone who has been to an upscale restaurant or a specialty restaurant recognizes right away a smaller menu means the chef has chosen meals with the finer ingredients and has a technique that surpasses that of a larger menu.  Their portion-size actually is quite large. But...this is the U.S. and Vegas (if you're a mainstream tourist you expect a certain variety and type of food).  Also, it's a small cafe and not a huge banquet room restaurant. Complaining about a party of 11-people is ridiculous.  I was actually at the end of a vicious cold when I was in Vegas, and the food there was healthy-ish and also delicious. (Take note of the veggie burger but also the gourmet meat selection.)

I even took a meal with me for the plane because it was that good. 

Also, a side note is the area around EAT. should be explored. It's in OLD VEGAS meaning it's the historical sites for the BRAT PACK (original one with Sinatra Sammy D. Jr.) and many films classic film fans might recognize! I enjoyed being away from the crowd, and being able to walk without smoke being blown in my face. There are also many grassroots efforts in the area as art galleries. I even walked by the PAWN STARS pawn shop on my way back to my hotel (that is in the main "new" strip of Vegas). 

ENJOY!!! Also, I highly doubt there was a hair on the plate and the waitress ignored that one writer. More likely the writer was disgruntled from something about the food\/restaurant and then plucked out the hair and wrote a crappy review. 

 Most Americans consume food seasoned with salt (in many cases MSG for pre-made sauces and fast food), and sugar. EAT. makes their food fresh and from scratch which also makes some of these comments moot points for me. For example, see the review on a critique of a Hollandaise sauce and bacon. Likely these "bold flavors" she describes comes out of a package not fresh cream or real bacon (that hasn't been treated with a ton of nitrates). And also, the comment about the "banana" on the bottom of "Mexican food goodness"--likely this writer mistook a different Latin-American inspired dish (perhaps from El Salvador where the cuisine uses plantains) for Mexican food. Because, duh, all Americans know Mexican food, but not much else in terms of different Latin-American national foods.  If she would have tasted the said "banana" she might have discovered it was delicious! (And discovered a new national cuisine). Many of these bad reviews are proof there's not a lot of food in our food anymore. I suspect, some of these readers don't recognize (or don't have a palate for) real food anymore. In short, take some of these reviews with a grain of salt and look at their website or listen to Bourdain's review.

Just to save all of you from the hassle of this garbage pile and the lack of decent breakfast in this area I have our breakfast answer The GRIDDLE IN THE sls,  you want to talk about a breakfast joint then the Griddle is the place to go,  great quality food amazing service and they don't rape you on price at all heed my warning the sls serves their pancakes the size of small children.  Save yourself the hassle gtfo out of eat and head to The griddle

We came here for lunch since we missed breakfast :\/ The food and service was pretty good! We ordered the grilled cheese and the free range pot pie - both were excellent! I would give this place a 5 stars if there was more variety on the menu and it was so loud inside that it was hard to carry a conversation. Other than that, great spot! Definitely give it a try - I would like to come back for breakfast!
The country fried steak was so small they need to rename it the county fried steak. They would have gotten 5 stars if my waiter had been a waitress.
The staff was awesome and friendly. The food was beyond amazing . Definitely be coming back here. The ambiance is hipster cool type of vibe. Not too loud. Service was impeccable . Also is very clean

Simply Fantastic! We asked our waiter to recommend two dishes for us to share, he suggested the Beignets and the Huevos Motulenos. The Biegnets was amazing, they came with a Mascarpon spread that put them over the top. The Huevos Motulenos, was something I did not want to order as it combined bananas and peas, really. However, I must say it was probably one of the best things I ate all weekend. The red sauce was super spicy, the green sauce was not and the random bite of banana provide the perfect touch of sweet. We will eat at EAT every time we are in Vegas.

Expensive with subpar service and a hard- to-read menu are just some of the problems with Eat.

This unnecessarily loud (due to the not-so-background music) is overwhelmingly disappointing.  For what you get, the prices are some $2-$5 more than they really should be.  $13 for a nearly flavorless Reuben sandwich that was more bread than anything else is such a rip off that it's insulting.  I mentioned it to my waiter and a lady came by the table and took it away, leaving me nothing to eat.  That really made me angry.  I'd rather eat a bad sandwich than nothing at all.

My wife's corned beef hash (which is grossly overpriced at somewhere around $12-$14) wasn't anything special at all, though she did like the green onions that were in it.

With how empty this restaurant is at lunch time it's no surprise they have to charge so much.  Any less and they'd probably go out of business.

Then again, were that to happen I wouldn't miss them.  Not coming back.  Ever.  It's a horrible restaurant with some bad people working there.
Really great service and delicious food! My only complaint would be the meals were too big to eat! Not quite a complaint for some!

Great place great vibe great local Vegas coffee such a great place. Great service. The chicken Fried steak with pork gravy the best over easy eggs incredible ..potatoes were some of the best in brunch scene. 

Have had CFS many states citiez,and places this is some of the best. 

The toast is,off the chart so good thick wonderful heavenly bread toasted just perfect.

Great seeing energy great vibe great service. Good $

Don't waste your time coming here. We came here for brunch hoping to have a great experience but unfortunately I was disappointed with the customer service. Our drink server was very nice and professional. The waiter Gary was very rude. He approached the table annoyed and unfriendly. He made my experience at EAT very unpleasant and uncomfortable. Then he approached me on my phone and said, Don't put any negative reviews!" Who does that? The owner needs to replace him because he is ruining this establishment. Yummy food but I will never return.
Yummy food. Got the organic oatmeal.   Delicious crusted nuts and apples on top.  Best oatmeal I have ever had! Seriousl

Food was tasty and the service was friendly and quick. The interior is nicely decorated and spacious. Cool spot!

We got the truffled egg sandwich and golden-brown pancakes. Portion size was more than enough for two people. Downsides were: potatoes were undercooked and the egg to bread ratio was a little off (could've used more egg).

I'm actually being quite nice for giving them 4\/5 because of the mediocre service.

Came here on a Saturday morning , so there was a bit of a wait (around 25-30 min.) but I didn't mind.

Atmosphere-wise , I love the charm this place has , just exactly what downtown needs :) It's located across Container Park so it's a pretty popular spot.

Food-wise , I already had my heart set on the cinnamon biscuits (w\/ strawberry compote and powdered sugar) 8$. I don't think I ever had biscuits in my life but this is probably my new favorite breakfast food. The strawberry compote wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. DEFINITELY ORDER THIS. My friend who recommended this place to me also told me to order the truffled egg sandwich 12$. It was super good , everything was put together well. The scrambled eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly , and the mushrooms and feta cheese complimented the sandwich well. The chive potatoes were great , but taste better with the hot sauces provided on the side. If you don't like breakfast foods , they have soups , salads, and sandwiches available.

Service-wise , hostess was very kind and she reminded us of the breakfast specials today. Our server Roberto on the other hand , not so much. I don't like bagging on servers but we just got the vibe from him that he felt disinterested the whole time. Right after we were seated , he jotted down our orders and that was the last time we saw him. At least our food came out quick but he never checked up on us , asked how was our food , or any refills. Literally three different people asked me in less than a span of 5 min just to ask if I was done with my potatoes although I was still eating them and even had a fork in my hand. Three people can ask me if I'm done with my plate , but not notice my glass is empty. 

If you're looking for a breakfast place , I recommend this place because the food was excellent. Best breakfast I had in a long time. Just don't have high expectations about service. Also note , when it's busy they will only accept one credit card. Hostess offered to split the bill in half for two cards though.

Came here a few days ago for lunch. I had literally just bought an extra large ice tea at a local coffee shop before we walked in. When I put our name on the list, the hostess said "I'm going to need you to finish that ice tea before you get seated" there is no way I could finish it that fast. I found this completely ludicrous. I only drink a certain kind of tea that most restaurants don't serve. If they don't have it, I always order water, so it's not like they were missing out on a huge beverage sale by letting me bring my tea in. I completely understand if I came in with an alcoholic drink but that wasn't the case. I was so annoyed by this that we decided to leave and went to another nearby restaurant instead, one that could've cared less about my tea. So they lost out on much more money by us leaving than they would've by just allowing me to have my tea. I go out to eat several times a week. I have never, ever been told I cannot bring my tea in. Very disappointed
Breakfast was great. Food was delicious and the staff was very nice. My husband had the Easter ham special and I had oatmeal. The only thing I didn't care for was the $6 glass of oj.

This is a really cool place. The food was fantastic and the service was great . I had a breakfast sandwich which was DELIGHTFUL! It felt like I was in a Manhattan restaurant. Nice little outside patio as well. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!
The breakfast was delicious. I recommend the corn beef hash and pancakes. I'll definitely be coming back!

Situated in the revitalized (in progress) Fremont area of Downtown Vegas, eat. is a gem that I recently discovered despite its 3-year existence.  The decor is reminds me of kitschy Auntie Em's in Los Angeles, retro chic.  The service TEAM was friendly from the host to the servers to the foodrunners.  We arrived less than an hour before closing and didn't sense any disappointment from the staff.  And the best part is that the food was even better than the ambiance.  We had the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote and a truffle egg sandwich with mushrooms, feta, chives.  I highly recommend eat. !!

Right in so many ways. I was hoping for good eats, but wasn't 100% sure what to expect. What I got was a complete treat for all my senses. 

We went for Sunday brunch, and when I walked in, I did think, "Man, this place is loud," but when I saw a live DJ in the corner, I couldn't help but smile. The entire vibe makes you feel like ish is happening here every day. The interior is just perfect with concrete floors, spring-like colors and an open kitchen for you to witness the creation of your eats. We ate at the counter and loved it. 

Service was a little aloof, but I was too distracted by all the tattoos to really care. I think they just really mean business. 

The menu itself is a work of art worth reading down to every last bite. The dishes are creative and well-thought out. You know there is a real love of food just by reading the possibilities. We ordered the Huevos Motulenos, Turkey Benedict (only available during weekend brunch) and a short stack of pancakes ($5!!). The Motulenos features a mind-dizzying array of ingredients, including sauteed bananas! Mixed in with two chilis and a variety of beans, it turned out to be a delicious dish of sweet and spicy. And, the breakfast potatoes were legit. Basically, chop up a potato and make it sizzle. A true tater. The Benedict with turkey bacon and spinach was also a winning combination of flavors. I swear I tasted basil, but whatever I tasted, I approve. The only slight complaint there was that it came out lukewarm. 

Now, the pancakes deserve their own paragraph, but can be best summarized with one word: perfect! They managed to have crispy, but not burnt, edges and a soft, milky center. They were the perfect thinness, making it all too easy to devour a short stack all by your lonesome. 

Worth noting: While the weekday menu includes tofu scramble and a tofu banh mi, I didn't notice any vegan options on the brunch menu. Might be worth calling if you're a vegan headed there for a weekend brunch.  

My only other minor complaint is that I thought the coffee was a little weak. However, that in no way prevents me from respecting this culinary gem. It's just so cool, a true Vegas original.

EAT.   
yup that's what my fianc√© and I did as soon as we got our food.  Truffled egg sandwich was amazing ... nothing to complain about here, perfect portion for the price and very flavorful.  My fianc√© ordered shrimp and grits I wished it had a little more seasoning to it which I just added cholula to it to kick it up a bit.  It was a little too "tomatoey" to me like a ceviche salsa, but maybe that's what they're going for ... if so you guys did ... nailed it.  The pancakes were a perfect blend of fluffy and crispy ... not burnt.   We enjoyed the food and no complaints about the service.  

The only thing I dislike is you have to pay to park.  Being spoiled in Las Vegas usually you can find free parking somewhere, but for this location it would be quite a walk to find that.  So be aware, since this restaurant isn't too large you might need to put a few more quarters or dollars in your meter when they get packed.

Eat was truly delicious. 
 
From the moment we entered we loved it. It has a very hip ambience and it is very modern. We got seated and my husband ordered the pomegranate tea which he tells me was wonderful, but I can't be sure because all tea tastes like mud water to me. Bleh. 

We ordered the cinnamon biscuits which came drizzled in their homemade jam and fruit. We weren't actually too impressed with this dish, the biscuits were a little dry but the sauce made up for it. What was amazing was our main entree. We ordered two eggs, toast, potatoes and bacon. Perfection. The potatoes were amazing. I can only dream of a way to recreate their parsley potatoes. Even the toast was way more delicious than regular toast and I can't discover why. The bacon was also delicious. Something else amazing was their specialty honey. I could drink it for days. 

Our waiter however was a bit rude, he made rude comments to a friend of ours for ordering two appetizers in lieu of an entree. Taking off one star for that and the dry biscuits. Other than that, magnifique!

Cute little place across the street from The Downtown Container Park in Downtown LV. I feel like it's soul-food in a hip atmosphere. 

The food was good, but I'm convinced I didn't probably order the best thing on the menu. I went the route of a veggie burger (which I was told they don't make themselves, but they are shipped in, deconstructed, and then more ingredients are added. Probably not my favorite selling point!) but it was delicious and I topped it off with a cup of chicken posole soup. 

I did get a little food envy over the grilled cheese at times!!!! HUGE Texas toast with a nice gooey cheesy filling? Yes, please!

Best breakfast off the beaten path in Vegas! Delicious real food made from scratch. Best corn beef hash I've ever had. Not greasy. Eggs perfectly poached. My daughter had the mist amazing cinnamon biscuits with berries!!!! It was a little pricey for breakfast but with it, you get what you pay for. Very attentive service too. 9:45 Sunday morning they got us right in.
First time here, service was great, food was indescribably  good...my compliments to the chef (if he ever reads this).
Terrible. Waited over an hour and service was extremely bad. Not worth the wait. Go to MTO!!!

This place was such a great find!!  No wait due to weekday, and we arrived early, around 9am or so.  Even with it not being busy, they put 6 of us at a small table, that was irritating. They did get busy later, but I felt they didn't care much about our comfort since they knew the rush was coming.  Ehh.  Back to the food.  It was really delicious!!  My son's pancakes were SLAMMIN and I had chilaquiles.  Red sauce was different, but still good.  No espresso, but had coffee instead and it was ok (not my style but the waitress said it was good and strong).  We all loved our meals.  Our meal was pricey so heads up!  My son's apple juice was $4!  If you're prepared with the cost, the wait or small table, then you'll be able to better enjoy the service and great food.    Great find in downtown vegas, I'll be back!!

Eat every time I'm in town and love the egg truffle sandwich, never go wrong with this entree or this place to have lunch. Service is usually great, but last visit our waiter (usually it's always female wait staff) wasn't that great or attentive to our table. 
Very hip location and feeling and always popular. I like the location with Container park across the street

Here's the deal: I want this place to do well. I thought it was in the plus side of mediocre but I saw so much potential in it. And I LOVE Las Vegas is starting to offer unique, local, off-Strip places like this that try hard and do a good job. 

I had the chilaquiles and they weren't spectacular, but they were good.  My friend's daughter's biscuits looked fantastic with the strawberry jam on top, but I wish there was more fruit and less jam.  Service was very attentive and sweet.  I liked the place a lot, I just wish the food were a little bit better.
Chef Nat is amazing, and her food combinations are new and delicious! I love this place!

We found this place via four-square & Yelp this past weekend. Its a great restaurant off the strip, definitely a hidden gem to out-of-towners.

We stopped for breakfast before heading back to LA with friends. Everyone was extremely happy with their food. I had the truffle egg sandwich, which they happily substituted avocado for turkey bacon. The pancakes and egg benedict special were also hits at my table. 

The portions are on the larger side, which is the perfect cure for those Vegas hangovers.

This place is an awesome little hidden gem back at the east end of Fremont and behind the new downtown container park. Food was amazing and service was awesome! We will definitely make this a regular stop to eat when we visit Vegas.
Went here this weekend. Had the chicken fried steak and strawberry lemonade and shirt stack of pancakes. Everything was great. Free parking on Sundays.

Showed up at 2:30 on a Thursday. Right before the kitchen closed. The server was friendly and recommended the truffle egg sandwich. The food took not even 10 minutes. It was fantastic. The egg was fluffy, the bread was light and buttery oooo. One star less because parking sucks.

I was very impressed by this restaurant. The food was delicious and moderately priced. The coffee was great! The service was friendly and efficient! I had the corned beef hash and my sister had the eggs Benedict and both were tasty. I'll definitely be back. 

I have noticed that this restaurant has a long wait on the weekend. We were sat right away, but we were also there pretty early (8:30 am).

First time here. From out of town. Just drove by and looked online to see what food they had. Saw the deep fried deviled eggs. Had to park far away. Got seated right away. Ordered strawberry lemonade. Disappointed there were not refills on the lemonade. They put too much ice in the glass for no refills. It was like three sips of lemonade. And she didn't tell me when I ordered that there were no refills. Had to keep asking server for straws. (She brought me water after I found out no more lemonade)
Also ordered to eat ...the pancakes with the sausage on top and the deep-fried deviled eggs. The deep-fried deviled eggs were insanely delicious. :) Loved the kick of flavor and loved the concept of deep fry and deviled eggs. I wished there was more than four eggs. I wanted to eat a whole dozen eggs like that. LOL. The pancakes were dry and tasted like baking soda. We asked for more syrup which was a little jars and were not told that they were $1 each. The whole experience was good. Just put some sugar in the pancake mix and don't charge for extra syrup.
Great value, awesome food. Only downside....no mimosas......what Vegas? Haha! But I would totally return!

this place is soooooo good!! It's almost the equivalent to Country Way in Fremont, California. If you haven't been there, you should. I got the pancakes. There were 3 pancakes as big as my face, and apple sauce sausage. It came with the cutest little jars especially made for Eat. My husband got corned beef hash. His was also delicious - of course, I had to try for myself! Oh! The orange juice. Omg. The orange juice is so fresh and the perfect amount of sweetness. Oh gosh. This place was bomb. Too bad it isn't open all day.

My husband loved his Downtown Eggs Benedict and the coffee was good and strong. My shrimp and grits was more like seafood chowder. There was so much sauce I couldn't get a good bite of grits. The shrimp was pure rubber. Expect a bit of a wait but good for downtown.
Great customer service. I very much dislike waiting for a table but at this place it's worth it :-) the food is amazing and big portions.

What can I say about this gem. Prompt polite and pleasant service.  Trendy hip vibe. Great tasting food on the lunch menu. I had a chicken sandwich that was fresh, not over cooked, and on a soft roll. The vegetarian had a tofu and veggie sandwich that she claimed was pretty good.  We also tried there vegetarian chilli.  I would order it and i am a meat eater. the one outright i didn't care for was the potato salad. It tasted some bought out of one of those plastic tubs.  Don't worry though because you should be ordering the  delicious home made potato chips anyway.

Stopped here for breakfast on a very quick trip to Vegas and I'm so glad I did. We were in on a Saturday morning (maybe around 10?) and only had to wait 5-10 minutes for a table for 2 which for brunch rush hour is nothing. The space is cute, hip and modern but warm, and the food was solid. I had a truffled egg sandwich absolutely loaded with mushrooms and a side of stellar potatoes. They were perfectly crunchy, and well seasoned - basically my ideal breakfast potato. My partner in crime had the shrimp and grits and liked them. Like a fool, I forgot to steal a taste so I can't comment on them beyond that. I also loved that it was off of the strip and in a much calmer, less crazy part of town. The menu is relatively limited, I think there was one short-ish page of options when we were there, but still enough to find something you want. Though I wouldn't have objected to maybe one more vegetarian option on the menu. Still would definitely recommend, especially if you're visiting Vegas and looking for something a little more chill and less wildly overpriced.

I came to EAT two times during my trip to LV, both times were fantastic.  First time we had a very large group and the staff was very accommodating.  The second time was with a smaller group and they managed to fit us in during a very busy lunch hour.

Both the arugula salad and the shrimp and grit dishes were delicious and perfectly prepared.  The food comes fast and the vibe is relaxed and funky.  I will definitely be back!

I couldn't wait for the Summerlin location to open!! The first time we went there Excellent!! The second not so good from the food to the wait staff.. The manager said the chef was new.. I love this restaurant and I really want Natalie to succeed!!
Great place to stop for breakfast or lunch. Ordered the corned beef hash. Phenomenal take on it. The oj is quite pricy at 6$ a glass so be careful but everything is fresh hot and delicious.

Was really disappointed when I came here the 2nd time. The food was good last time not going to lie. But the manger was just so rude to us that I don't want people to come in with a wrong impression. We called to see if they were open on Memorial Day, as yelp suggest, they said they were. Walked there and said they were closed. When we asked she said tough luck and that they didn't know they were going close. No communication and no remorse. As a server myself, not communicating with your staff is a bad business practice.

Every time I come here I have a great experience.. But never like the one we had last week.. I have a son who's a T1D. He had been struggling for about a week with his BG, when I was getting to order, I asked our waiter for the lowest carb dish on his menu. He quickly pointed me in the right direction. I told him my Son was a T1D & he pulled out his insulin pump. What a surprise! My son's face lit up. He met some one who spoke his language.. He was so kind & helpful & full of knowledge since he was DX when he was 7yrs old & currently 29yrs old. He gave us some pointers  & even gave us his personal number just in case we ever had some questions. Needless to say this was one of our best dine in experience thanks to him He totally made my sons day!

The huevos motulenos are not your typical huevos rancheros brunch dish!  I couldn't stomach sauteed sweet bananas mixed in with peas and feta cheese, but once I removed the banana, the dish was delicious!   Very down-to-earth crowd and vibe, a good respite from the glitz of The Strip.

Had breakfast here on a Sunday while visiting Las Vegas. My SO had the chef's special, eggs Benedict which was off menu. He said it was delicious" although the hollandaise was just a little bit too lemony. I ordered the Huevos Montulenos--based on Yelp reviews. I really couldn't imagine caramelized bananas and peas in the same egg dish, but somehow it works! And by "works" I mean "wow". Great house potatoes accompanied both dishes. The coffee was dark and powerful, the atmosphere urban and energetic. Great and attentive wait staff too.

I wanted to like this place alot since I like these off beat hipster places. I was in Vegas with the wife to have a fun time and meet my mom and friend. The late night search for tomorrows breakfast lead me to yelp and yelp let me to "EAT".... I offered this up to my crew for vote and we were all in!


So we arrive in this seedy little area in Vegas. Trestaurantunt is located underneath a old apartment building. Aside from the rest of the building the place is really nice. Its modern with black modern sign and concrete floors and lots cool kidkid type furniture etc. it has a buzz about it like its got a local following. Justeppingnbg in the door made me feel like we were experiencing a insider place locals are enjoying. I am up for that type thing.....

I ordered the Posole, this is a great hangover meal! Just the smell was good enough to pull me in. It has all the favorites Mexicanxican Posole would have, hominy, pork, broth etc. It was good. Although it was served in a shallow bowl so I would have appreciated to have a little more.

My wife ordered a wedge salad topped with huge shrimp. Her meal looked awesome. The shrimpCajuna cajun type seasoning that was spicy. It was good. the blue cheese dressing was excellent as well. 

My mom ordered a uneventful chicken pot wasn'tShe wasnt impressed, And I trust judgmentjudgement.

Very difficulty to get a refill on my coffee. I had to approach the kitchen counter to get coffee.don'twice.


I dont think I will go here again, but if I "end up here" I know what to avoid and I know to expect to get my own coffee.

How could bfast be better?  No way!

Excellent attentive service.  Wonderful food options. Beautiful decor and set up.  Across the street from Container Park.  Right in the heart of the food renaissance in downtown LV.  Best culinary breakfast I've had in a long while.  Not cheap but worth it.

Went for brunch.

There was a three man band outside front door - totally unexpected and really charming.  Restaurant was decorated very well - industrial chic with fresh vibrant colors.  Location was in a good spot in the heart of Fremont East "downtown."

The food I'd give it just an OK rating.  Had pancakes, which you cant really screw those up.  They were good.  The chicken or turkey sausage on top was a bit odd tasting.  I covered in ketchup to be able to eat.  We also ordered the Grilled Cheese with tomato soup - that was the surprising dish.  I expected so much more.  The cheese was dry and hard.  The amount of bread was overwhelming - way too much.  The soup was no better than what would come from a can.  Almost flavorless.  I can make better grilled cheese at home and Bar + Bistro has to die for tomato soup.  

I think overall, the food had an off day.  I'd go back and try some other things just because of ambiance and location and I like to give em' a 2nd try.
Nicely done brunch. Interesting food and reasonably priced. Friendly service staff...

From the street I would have never guessed this Unique Eat would be so rock star. The place is casual with many regulars of all kinds. I loved how some were very dressed up while others were casually brunching. This was my first time and I felt like the other diners were repeat customers for sure.   The decor is Up-Cycle cool and comfortable. 
We ordered the Shrimp and Grits, Pancakes, Spicy Egg Dish (sorry I forgot the name), and Chicken Fried Steak. 
I can not stop thinking about the Chicken Fried Steak!  It is so perfectly crispy, flavorful, and FRESH!
Everything was fantastic. The coffee was so good we had to take a bag home with us. 
The Chef and Owner made it a point to check in with us and ensure everything was wonderful. 
I don't live in Vegas, but I can not wait to visit EAT again. 
A +!

Probably one of the cooler restaurants I've been to in a while. I just had breakfast there and I was so compelled to immediately write a review. Eat is located in an area of Downtown that is being redeveloped. I'd say that this place is probably the impetus of redevelopment in its immediate area - the area looks like it could be kinda sketchy at night. But it was fine when I went in the morning. In fact, they are only open until 3pm, so don't be scared and check them out!

Walking in to the restaurant, I really got a hip, trendy, downtown feeling - exactly what I'm looking for when visiting any downtown restaurant in any city. I was promptly greeted and seated. I sat at the counter, which overlooks the open-kitchen. 

The staff working there seem to match the hip, downtown look the restaurant is going for - tattoos, t-shirts and funky hair. I must've stood out with my clean cut look, but hey there are a lot of businesses in the area so I'm sure the "corporate" folk come here too, especially for lunch. 

I ordered the truffled egg sandwich, which, thanks to Yelp, seems to be one of the more popular items. My food came out quickly and I was a lot of food! The sandwich was in a perfectly toasted croissant and was topped with eggs, mushrooms and very crisp bacon. It came with a side of potatoes. 

Overall a great breakfast to start my day and a place you should check out.

Hands down the best meal and value I ate in Vegas during my two days. It's a simple spot with all the yummy, wholesome and perfectly crafted good you could ask for. My shrimp and grits was perfection. The bacon they use (in my meal and a few others on my table) was the best I've had in ages. They didn't charge for soda water, which I always order and hate being charged for. Loved this place and we went to container park when we were don't. Downtown is really coming along and I hope this spot will stills be in business when I make it back
I got the chicken fried steak and it was delicious. Every thing was fresh and taste. The potatoes were not under or over cook with the right amount of seasoning.

My friend and I have been looking forward to coming here for weeks. We finally make it out for Sunday brunch and were extremely disappointed. We waited about 20 mins for a table which isn't bad. The decor is really cool, modern, and has a good vibe. 
Service is horrible. No one smiles or introduces themselves. A guy take our drink  order, a women comes takes our order. Neither of the servers are pleasant or friendly.  I let her know that I would like to order a sandwich to go toward the end of the meal. Food comes out quickly. 
My friend got the grilled cheese with avocado. It's average. The passion ice tea is really good. My eggs Benedict is drowning in the hollandaise sauce. I can't even enjoy all the ingredient bc the sauce is taking over the plate. I look around and others have egg Benedict's who have a lot less sauce than us, and even strawberries in their plate!  
The check is dropped while I'm still eating. Uncomfortable. I never get to order my sandwich to go bc the server honestly never really came back. Sure I could've got her attention but at this point i would take my business else where.
The cherry on top is I asked if the orange juice was fresh squeezed. The guy tells me yes. I ordered a small and it's definitely not fresh squeezed. I am charged for a large. I don't even bother to correct the $6.00 mistake. I'm just so over it at this point.

I honestly didn't think that scrambled eggs and white toast could taste this good. I will make it a point to eat here every time I come to Vegas, and encourage everyone I know to do the same.

Came in for late breakfast on a sunday. Packed house, but we didn't wait too long. We had shrimp grits with eggs & bacon, and scrambled eggs with bacon & smashed potatoes. It was all wonderful. Even though the scrambled eggs had obviously been waiting too long under a heat lamp, they tasted so good that all was forgiven.

Very, very loud - probably not the best spot for hangover breakfast.

Really happy we found this place.

Good food with great ambiance. I like coming here for breakfast. Try the golden brown pancakes and a cup
Of Coffee. It'll set your morning off right. 

Great downtown Las Vegas gem.

First, their fried deviled eggs were amazing! I would return just to have those.

We came in around 9:30AM for breakfast, there was a lot of people there but the wait was less than 10 mins, we got our order taken pretty quickly and our food was out just as fast. I had the chicken fried steak, it wasn't mind blowing but it was good. I'll definitely be back to try a few other things off the menu.

Omg, so delish! A friend was raving about eat, and I saw it as we passed through downtown Las Vegas during the RNR Half Marathon. We returned the next day. Of course, I still had the rungries. My biggest challenge? Picking what to order!

I settled on breakfast (because breakfast is the best!) and ultimately decided on the Truffled Egg Sandwich. First of all, it was ginormous, and came served with a GENEROUS portion of potatoes. They were more than happy to sub turkey bacon for regular bacon (thank you!) and it was great... not the kind of turkey bacon that leaves you feeling deprived. I did polish off the sandwich, but couldn't finish the potatoes, even with help.

For some of my friends who got toast with their dishes, wow, I have never seen toast so thick! It looked like thick cut French toast, but was just regular old toast. The ginger ale was also fantastic and I heard the coffee was, too.

Our server was delightful and knowledgeable about the menu. 

My only wish is that I had time and room to eat through more of the menu, but I guess that means I will have to make a return visit. :)

Thank you for a fantastic meal!

For starters when we sat in the waiting area there were two dead cockroaches flipped upside down in the middle of the floor. I wanted so badly to take a picture but realized how awkward that would be.
Service wasn't good at all. Not attentive, friendly, or nice. I ordered an Arnold Palmer and I was given lemonade. I see things like this as a simple mistake so I kindly asked for tea since I ordered half and half. The server (we actually had three people just rotating the whole time) told me that there was probably tea in it, and I just can't tell because the tea is very subtle. I continued to tell her it was just lemonade but she said "yeah it's just the tea isn't really prominent" ... Then when another lady came to refill my drink, she topped it off with the house tea that I asked for. Seeing as how I barely touched my drink... It was weird to me that the tea instantly made my drink darker and the taste was definitely prominent. But I guess that was too hard for the first lady.
Our food came out within fifteen minutes which really surprised me because there were quite a few others there as well.
No complaints with my eggs benedict, just thought it was a little pricey. The chicken fried steak was cold and soggy. Almost like it had been pre cooked and re heated. I could tell the flavor was there but overall it just wasn't appetizing because it didn't taste or feel fresh at all. We had no one check on our table to see how the food was. But of course they didn't hesitate to drop the check at the table and walk away.
Overall I'm very surprised and disappointed. I saw all the awesome reviews and also recognized it is Zagat rated which inclined me to go here. But after paying so much for lack luster food and terrible customer service... I'll pass on returning.

I really wanted to like this place, but too many things led up to this being a 2 star review based on my experience. We have tried several times to eat here but they were either closed or I just was pressed for time and couldn't wait as they're always packed. 



We arrived at around noon and it was stated it would be 25 minute wait. I waited outside patiently with my guy and we were seated about 20 minutes later. We sat down and my guy went back to the car to make sure we paid the parking meter. I waited about  10 minutes to even be acknowledged by anyone. The wait staff and kitchen staff were very busy and everyone running around this fairly average sized place. After a gentlemen took our drink order I waited patiently for my guy to come back. I thought he brought sanitizer back as I didn't bring anything in with me besides my phone. So I got up to head to the restroom so I could wash my hands. As packed as this restraunt gets I had to wait for the restroom. The lady who exited explained they ran out of paper towels and let a wait staff member know , but she just continued to fill drinks and then completely disappeared. So i made serveral attempts at making eye contact in hopes of being able to flag down someone to refill them. While staff members just gave me blank stares and ignored me. Finally a waitress with her hands full informed me they were in a cabinet inside the bathroom and tried to open it with her shoe while her hands were full of dirty plates and ketchup and hot sauce bottles mind you she's all the way inside the bathroom. Finally another girl came to put them in, informed me they didn't carry toilet seat liners when I asked about them. It was brought to my attention after my guy had used the restroom told me the girl who I had asked about liners was talking about me to other employees saying I was lucky they had toilet paper. 

This is not the type of service I hope to recieve in a McDonald's. After an almost 30 minute wait and the rude customer service I was hoping the food would be okay. Which it was decent. I won't lie about that. 

Shortly after we received our food but I was just so upset I didn't enjoy my meal. My guy had the shrimp and grits and since I'm not a fan of shrimp I didn't even bother to try. My corned beef was a bit on the small side but I did enjoy the sourdough toast it came with. Very buttery and crispy. Yum ! The pancake was a standard pancake nothing special.

Usually after a first time disaster I would give them another try but I definitely will not be returning to Eat.

Thank you, Yelpers for the great tip on this place! We were staying at the D and I didn't want a breakfast buffet for the second day in a row. I saw this place was only a couple blocks away, the photos and menu looked promising so we headed over.

For a Vegas visitor, the walk down Carson at 8am can seem a little sketch but have no fear! When we walked in it was cozy and cute and trendy in a very non-intimidating way. We opted to sit at the counter since every seat was full (30 minutes after opening!) and I'm really glad we did. Our pink-haired waitress was SO friendly, helpful and overall just seemed like a super positive person, which was a great start to our day. Plus, we got to watch the action in the kitchen and the chef was really commanding her own back there. 

I had the Truffled Egg Sandwich, which was super tasty. Scrambled Eggs with saut√©ed mushrooms, chives, feta and kick-ass bacon on a ciabatta roll. So freaking good. It came with Chive Potatoes, which were cooked pretty perfectly. BF had the egg dish that came with beans, peas, feta and some other stuff on a corn tortilla and he loved it. The salsas that were on top were so good. 

We HAD to split a pancake because they looked amazing. It was. Perfect crispy edges with a fluffy middle. I could eat these all day.

The lunch menu looked equally awesome, but it was 8:30 am so I passed.

We really really enjoyed Eat and would go back if we could!
So yummy, chicken fried steak second to none! Grits done equal to my dads specs!!!!! Everything had a distinct excellent taste!  My new Best breakfast place!!!!!

Great find. Not something you might pick from walking by. The interior is clean and bright. Better yet the food is outstanding. Went with my brother. He said the Shrimp and Grits were outstanding. The waitress said her favorite was the Corned Beef Hash so I got that and he got the Shrimp and Grits. Mine was very good but his was outstanding. He had pity on me and let me have quite a bit. I live in the south and never had ones that good. I highly recommend this place.

This made Vegas a worthwhile stop on our road trip. Neither of us enjoy the Las Vegas Strip, so we ventured off-strip for breakfast at eat. Staff were super-friendly and attentive. The coffee was good. Breakfast was excellent. 

My truffled egg sandwich was ridiculously good. It was strong on flavor, and the eggs were cooked perfectly. Bacon, feta, mushrooms...just terrific. The chive potatoes were also great. The bf LOVED his huevos motulenos--so much that I didn't get to taste them.

I don't expect to be back in Vegas if I can avoid it, but if I am driving through on a road trip, eat. will be my choice for a meal in town.

After several long, booze infused Vegas nights, it was nice to have a sit down, tasty breakfast of pancakes with sausage.  I wish there were more sausage, it was a great compliment with the cute jar of syrup provided.  The pancakes were decent.
This place is fabulous. Lanny talked to me about Natalie (the owner) and how he appreciated her efficiency. The owner and or head chef usually sets the tone and I couldn't recommend EAT any further.

Eat was quite good. i had the corn hash and toast and it was pretty good. My friends and i went there for breakfast and we were impressed. The atmosphere is pretty laid back and it feels and looks clean. The food amazing. You will like it. It would be a nice breakfast date place too :)

Yum!  I got here a little before 9:30 on a Saturday, and there was a 5-min wait.  I got a table for 1 (because I didn't know it had counter seats), and everyone was nice about it.  Gary, my waiter, said lines can start forming by 8:15am (opens at 8am!).  Food was SOLID!  I had the Eggs Benedict with potatoes (special that day) - good balance of flavors and perfectly poached eggs; single pancake - just the right amount of density and fluffiness, plus it came with real maple syrup; and coffee - good beans and roast.  Service was attentive and friendly.  I would totally come back!

P.S. Free parking on 9th and beyond if you don't mind walking a bit more.

Outstanding place to eat.  Away enough from the downtown area but easy walking distance from the hotels.  Worth the walk.  Service I thought could be better ate at the counter and waited while two employees were "discussing the weather".  I felt I should have been acknowledged.  Eventually I was given a menu and from that point on the experience was awesome.  Food was absolutely delicious and price was fair.  Did not know what to expect from a place called "EAT" but you must check this place out.  If not for the wait at the counter it would no doubt be five star.

Eat is located close to the heart of downtown Las Vegas.  We met my cousin here before heading home.  She heard they made good breakfast meals here, and she heard right based on what we tried.

I had the pancakes ($9.00).  My cousin tried the corn beef hash ($14.00).  My wife had the shrimp and grits ($13.00).

Shrimp and Grits looked good, and it tasted even better.  ( 4 stars )

Corned Beef Hash came with sour dough toast.  Nice combination of food.  ( 4 stars )

Pancakes were yummy!  On the menu it says Golden-Brown Pancakes.  Well, they were golden brown.  The maple syrup they provided with the pancakes complemented it very well.  The Chicken-Apple sausage on top of the pancakes was delicious!!  ( 4.5 stars )

Eat is worth venturing away from the Strip.  They make very good food here while providing a clean atmosphere and good service.

Lovely brunch spot! I came on a Saturday and waited for about 25 minutes for a party of 3, which wasn't bad at all in my opinion. Only downside is that the location is in downtown and the parking can be a bit difficult if you come by on a busy day. 

Me and my friends all ordered the Eggs Benedict which was delicious! I usually order Eggs Benedict at any brunch places and eat's benedict by far has to be one of my favorites. We shared an order of the cinnamon biscuits which I really enjoyed and wouldn't mind ordering that next time if I was craving something sweet for brunch.
