I'm happy that I finally got to try one of the most popular brunch places here in Vegas and will be coming back soon for another brunch date!

YUM!
Enjoyed this place. Will definitely come back!
Friendly service.
Huevos Motulenos are SO good! I can understand why some people are confused by them, but HOLY COW -- the combination of the huevos rancheros and the peas and the bananas was SO GOOD. I told my dining partner, "This is SO WEIRD. In the BEST WAY." It really was. 
We also shared a pancake. YUM! Yum, yum, yum.
My dining partner had the chicken sandwich and she said that it was very good.
I can't come back here soon enough!

I stroll off Fremont to Carson Ave on every visit to Las Vegas. EAT is a must for any downtown Vegas vacation. The food is pretty simple. Most of the food is just breakfast and lunch classics  prepared with the highest level of quality ingredients and short order cook skill. There are definitely a few inventive dishes that speak to the chef's talent, but for the most part the food at EAT doesn't reinvent the wheel. There is something to be said for simplicity. In my last few visits, I've ordered the fantastic Pozole as a starter. After that, you really can't lose with any of their selections. I particularly like the Shrimp and Grits for Breakfast and the DWBLTA for lunch.

After I've enjoyed my meal, I always buy a bag of their house coffee beans for the road. I like to continue enjoying EAT's bean juice for weeks after my trip.

NAIL -----+ HEAD!!!

Thank you, eat.!

When one is stuck in the saddest place is the world that is Las Vegas, one's skin might crawl. Mine actually itches. eat was such a pleasant respite from the strip mall hell that is most of that town, and it really brings it with the food and the atmosphere.

--Great music playing that's not too loud.

--Fantastic food with something for everyone (and generous portion sizes like the rest of this town).

--We had the truffled egg sandwich minus bacon (hey people, if one doesn't get bacon can you PLEASE add something else or take off some money?!), the arugula\/asparagus salad, and a side of cheesy grits. Everything was delicious, and the home fries that come with the egg sandwich are actually REAL home fries, as in, crisped and tossed with onion. We saw a number of delicious-looking menu items gets sent out from our counter\/kitchen-view seats. The housemade veggie burger looked particularly amazing too.

--Also, coffee!! The first\/only decent coffee I had on the whole trip, and you can get Sugar in the Raw.

--Leftovers NOT packed in styrofoam!! Hallelujah! While the rest of Las Vegas attempts to kill the environment and the humans in it at every turn, here at eat you can get leftovers packed in paper!

We had counter seats with a view (and ear) to the kitchen. We figured out why there are so many complaints about service. It is slow and inconsistent, and frequently there were up to 8 meals ready to go out to tables, but servers weren't taking them as fast as the kitchen was working. Also, for some reason, instead of table numbers or seat numbers, one person would say "This is for the heavyset gentleman in the hat over there" rather than "This is table 11." Very odd. 

Our service was fine, and we weren't in a hurry but I hope if any owner\/manager reads this you'll take the service complaints to heart. They seem valid. Also, vegetarians really hate having to ask for a left-off ingredient like bacon, prosciutto, sausage (things with an upcharge) but not getting offered something for a sub or $1 off.

If I ever have to return to the saddest place in the world I will eat here at least once.

Most good food (besides the buffets) in Las Vegas are found off the strip.  Eat is one of those places; a hidden gem in it's simplicity, amongst all the city lights.  Make your way to downtown Las Vegas and you'll find a nice, little popular breakfast spot, often filled with hungry guests.  I got the truffled egg sandwich 2 scrambled eggs w\/wild mushrooms, chives, feta & bacon on ciabatta with chive potatoes $12.  - Good and worth it.

Ok, so it's not perfection, but I have to give it 5 stars based on what I see passes as a "4 star" place for breakfast\/brunch on the Strip. Eat blows them out of the water.

Service is friendly and efficient; helpful with a smile. What more do you need?

Ambiance is cute, mildly hipster, but nothing over the top. Just a bunch of people digging good food.

As for the food, the standouts for us were the Truffled Egg Sandwich and the pancakes. The pancake had a sublime lightness to them with a perfectly thin crispy exterior. Seriously one of the best I've had in a long time. Potatoes on the side were great as well. Other food was less than amazing (Chicken Fried Steak tasted good, but was just a little over done and the steak wasn't pounded quite thin enough, and Chilaquiles just lacked some oomph), but still good for the eating.

Well worth the trip to downtown LV. Afterwards, we walked through the Container Park right across the street. Neat stuff.

Where the hell do you park for free nearby??

Why is Tony in there every time I'm there?  He steals all of the good service.

My last visit at eat. there were extra tons of people with cameras and video recorders.  Looked like they were setting up to film a show inside because even a dude was getting his make up Did.  

$4 orange juice.  But anyway the last two visits were on weekdays, I really need to go on a weekend because the menu is different.  But so far I've had the Mediterranean Egg White Frittata Spinach which came with tomatoes, Kalamata olives, feta and basil with whole wheat English muffin.  That was good, so healthy.  When I saw the English muffin I tried to sneak in and ask if they can make me an eggs benedict, but nope.  Then for my latest visit I had the Smoked Salmon Cream cheese, capers, sliced tomatoes, red onion and rye bread.  It was laid out neatly but I made a mess of it, it's a normal dish that can be found on your weekend brunch but I was honestly craving for their weekend brunch items.  

It just means I need to go back, park somewhere free, sit down, eat while taking my time rather than rushing.

And don't be fooled by the appearance of the neighborhood, when you go in you are in a completely different environment.  You wouldn't think a restaurant like this is located in downtown Las Vegas.
Perfection for a place like this in every bite. We love the staff and kitchen peeps.

Great customer service! Food was a decent portion. I had the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The tomato soup had an interesting taste and was on the watery side. The grill cheese was tall. I loved dipping it into the soup, made it more manageable to eat. Nothing spectacular about it but very filling. I will be back to try some other things on the menu.

Came to eat with my sister for breakfast! As soon as we arrived we got seated quickly. Our server was Allison, very nice server, she recommended the Green Chili Chicken Posole, which in fact was really good! It isn't a traditional posole, but it does have a hint of spice that makes you keep going back for more! Just wished they gave me one or two more tostadas and chicken. My sister had the Cinnamon Biscuits which are always lovely to have! They were soft and the strawberry compote wasn't over powering which made it sweet and savory! Last but not least my all time favorite deviled eggs (couldn't find the name)! Those are to die for! They are amazing! Its a creative and upgrade version of deviled eggs! Overall, the experience was great!
Absolutely amazing. The best food I've had in a long time. Excellent service. Cool atmosphere. A MUST-GO for locals and visitors alike.

Just ok! We missed breakfast, I was with a party of 4. Fairly long wait time. Average service. Meals were mediocre at best. I probably had the winner of the bunch...the Shrimp Po boy with homemade chips---great!

Simply Fabulous! Super quick to be seated. Fun, chic  ambiance. Corned beef hash, grits,  fresh squeezed orange juice,  and the COFFEE!!!! Wait staff work together to make sure you have everything you need,  before you need to even ask. Excellent place to have breakfast or brunch. Parking is on the street. $2.00 for 4 hours, but I doubt you'll need that much time. Within a walking distance to Freemont Street.
The entire menu is well priced.  Love the choices on the menu. Unique breakfast place. I wonder there why would anyone go to ihop for breakfast. Keep up the good works Natalie!

Fantastic.  Got the shrimp and grits it was so good. Staff is amazing. Sat at the bar and watched the chef and crew in action. Lemme tell you watch if I could of ate everything that came out of the kitchen I would. It looked soooo good. This is a must go while in Vegas. You can beat good food and good folks!  Come to Eat!

Gotta say this place was delicious!!! I was led to this place by one of my players who was starving and is very picky about her food. Blessing in disguise...I had shrimp and grits. It had a fried egg over medium in top. I've wanted to try it for some time now and it was more than expected. A side of pancakes was also on point. Soaked up butter and syrup like a sponge. There were other things I wanted to try on the menu that had my mouth watering...but that will have to wait til the next time I'm in Las Vegas.

Great food, stylish interior, professional staffs.  This is very good restaurant overall.  I had shrimp and grits, and ginger ale.  I really love the shrimp and grits!  In downtown area, I am kind of feeling a beautiful hope and pride of the people and the community.  Sure, I want to come back here!

We were in Vegas to visit my brother and he brought us here. Said it was one of his favorite spots for breakfast. We went at lunch time and had a bit of a wait but there were 6 of us.

The place is small but very cool. The outdoor patio looked like you were sitting in a friend's backyard, very cozy and cute.

Everything on the menu sounded amazing and 4 of us zeroed in the same thing...the killer grilled cheese with kick ass tomato soup. The other 2 in our party ordered regular breakfast of eggs, bacon and home fries - which were delicious, they call them chive potatoes and the huge chunks of potatoes were seasoned perfectly!

Back to the grilled cheese and soup...the sandwich was made on thick sourdough bread with a couple of different gooey cheeses, the tomato soup was good but kind of too garlicky. Overall awesome combo!

Cool place, great food!

Food is deliciously comfortable.  Small local charm is evident in the dining room.  Local ownership has been here during both of my visits.  Feels good to join them for breakfast.  Oh and yeah those Deviled Eggs are the most wonderful thing since before sliced bread.  They weren't on the menu but they were so yummy we could have had more of them as our meal.
Great place... I love it the cinnamon biscuits are the best. I eat there almost every week great food and wonderful service

Three things make a great breakfast joint, Atmosphere, value, service and of course taste...wait, that's four things! Well, eat. has it all. Yes it's hip, with the reclaimed wood paneling, Edison bulbs over the community table, polished\/distressed concrete floors, bar in front of open diner style kitchen and oversized black and white photos including one of Alabama Shakes, Brittany Howard... But isn't that what we want?!! Especially since it's authentic, which reflects the neighborhood and the diversity of its customers: black, Hispanic, white, Asian, big, small, bearded, shaved, bespectacled, tattooed, bare, guys, gals, young, old, gay, straight and who knows? It's a melting pot and a nice one at that, I just sneezed and the tall gal with long dark hair next to me said, " bless you."

The service is perfect. Efficient, on time, informative and uninvasive. 

The potions are huge!! I got the country fried steak with pork sausage gravy, scrambled eggs and huge chunks of fried potatoes... Huge slices of wheat bread.... The steak was huge... Everything was big and very delicious! 

Overall eat. is the new American diner for the new American landscape. Hip, diverse, with great affordable taste.

Great food - try the deviled eggs! I see why it makes giraffes dance!! Can be busy on the weekend but well worth the wait. Has a great vibe inside but can get noisy, try the patio if you want a mellow experience.
One of the top ten breakfast in Las Vegas- authentic home made meals with quality products

Amazing everything. I got the Saturday special their version of eggs Benedict, amazing. Great flavor and special ingredients they treated well. Also got a side of grits which I could have done with out because they sucked. Also on the plus side the portions are big and not too pricey.

The only place I've ever been to where they seat 3 parties of 6 before my party of 4. 
I don't mind a little wait but 45 minutes was pushing it and watching groups show up AFTER you've been waiting is unacceptable. I'll Take my business up the street to Dupars inside the golden gate where their pancakes are way better than eats.
Excellent pancakes and chicken sausage.  Sausage was so good that I had to order an extra one.  Coffee is OK but I prefer a stronger blend.

My friends and I stopped by for a late brunch while visiting Las Vegas for new years.

Located in downtown Las Vegas, it is hipster, modern, and artsy - quite refreshing compared to the Strip.

The staff was also kind and welcoming, answering all of our questions about the neighborhood and sightseeing.

As for the food - we started with the cinnamon biscuits which were the highlight of my meal. The serving contained 4 halves which was perfect to share, and the strawberry compote topping was divine.

As for my main meal, I got the dwblta with tomato soup. The sandwich was HUGE and I could barely finish half of it. The contents of the sandwich were fresh but the bread was too thick for my taste and heavily buttered. 

Overall, I enjoyed the meal and the experience but found the food too heavy for my taste. I'm not sure if I would return given the chance, but I do definitely recommend venturing off of the strip and exploring this downtown area!

Go go go!!!! This place is amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Ordered the cinnamon biscuits which are a MUST! Truffled egg sandwhich is incredible, I would highly recommend it. My sister got the corned beef and hash which was just as delicious. Different than traditional, it had chunks of meet and chunks of potato as opposed to the typical mush of corned beef hash. Dad got the chicken fried steak which he absolutely loved. There was about a 25 minute wait on Sunday morning so don't expect to walk right in but the wait was absolutely worth it.

An article in Sunset Magazine about downtown Vegas revitalization drew us to this restaurant. It delivered. The pancakes were a version of amazing I'd never tasted before and the chilaquiles rocked my tastebuds. I wished I'd have tried everything on this menu. Truly incredible vibe, atmosphere, and affordable delicious crafted dishes. I'm returning when the Container Park opens across the street for sure.

We showed up there was a bit of a line, and told a 15-20 min wait. No problem with all the positive reviews We were willing to wait, but we were at table in 5 minutes. The food and service were fantastic, my wife had the eggs Benedict with turkey bacon and tomato on an English muffin, the hollandaise made the whole thing perfect. I had the shrimp and grits, that's new territory for me having never had grits before. I have no comparison but it was so tasty. Covered with two over easy eggs and topped with a bruschetta type tomatoes and shrimp. We need to go back before vacation is over.
Lovely breakfast foods! The waffles, pancakes, and bacon were the best I have had in Vegas.

I was in old downtown Vegas and had to stop in based on the reviews of Eat.  I ordered a truffled egg sammie. It was heavy on truffle, but good!  My husband ordered the special of the day: biscuits with cajun gravy. He loved it. 

Overall, great service, great food, and cute place! Well worth the stop if you happen to be in downtown Vegas.

A fun breakfast place in DTLV.  Expect a bit of a wait, we had maybe 20 minutes, but not bad for a Sunday.  The food is very good and the service was friendly.  They do not do any substitutions or modifications and that is clearly outlined on the menu.  One awkward moment was when one of the members of our party asked if her sandwich can be cut in half as to be easier to handle.  The waitperson politely said they can't, but they could bring a knife for us to do it.  I understand the modifications and substitutions part, but I think not cutting a large sandwich is a bit over the top.  Having said that, we will be back though.  Fun vibe.
Went on a saturday so we had the brunch menu. I had the arugula salad with chicken and my boyfriend had the eggs benedict. Both items were delicious. It is a very limited menu though.

I am in LOVE with this place for putting such a unique twist on breakfast and brunch! Grilled cheese on texas toast?! Where do you see that?! Almost nowhere!

We were staying near the strip, so going to Downtown Las Vegas was a nice change from the hustle and bustle. We got seated right away during peak breakfast time on a Wednesday morning. The menu was very organized into different sections, with a few options in each section. I have a belief that the smaller the menu, the better the food (usually) because they know what works and what doesn't, and there's less of a chance for you to order something that's just "okay". Anyway! I ordered the tofu scramble that came with chive potatoes, with a side of vegetable chili. My friends ordered the grilled cheese that came with tomato soup, and some egg dish (I forgot the name!).

My tofu scramble was very different from all the other tofu scrambles I've had in my time being vegan. I usually have it in little pieces so that it looks like..scrambled egg. Mine was in cubes. Very oily cubes. I wasn't a huge fan of the oil but the tofu wasn't too bad. The potatoes were very good. My chili was flavorful but too salty.  I accidentally had some tomato soup that had cheese in it (we had no idea), but that was one of the better tomato soups I've ever had. The grilled cheese was huge. For light eaters, I think that could've satisfied two people. The housemade chips were delicious as well (I think they had cheese in it, too?!). The egg dish was given a thumbs up from my friend. 

All the servers are very efficient at what they do, but do not sacrifice customer service while doing so. Many other places should take pointers from here.

Overall, our meal was enjoyed and we left with our stomachs full and hearts happy! Come stop by if you're in Vegas to eat something a little different!
Pan seared chicken sandwich was delectable. It's a great interior space, friendly staff and cool location.

Went here for the first time with my friend and loved it! 
Simple menu, with great choices. Was very impressed that such simple food could be dressed up at taste so good!
I got the soup that resembles posole, was probably the most disappointing thing I got, but still good. A very subtle spiciness everyone could enjoy. 
I also got the spinach salad. Strawberries, pecans, feta, and onions. The option was available to add chicken or shrimp, but they were not necessary. The salad was perfect! The best thing I got, and I would enjoy to get it again, or get these ingredients and make the salad at home. Don't use to much of the dressing though :-)
I also got the two egg  meal. I got them poached. Delightful eggs, amazing toast, and a perfect amount of potatoes. Bacon is crispy, and well made.
The service was quick, they brought everything out to my friend and I in rounds, ( we each got 3 things). The things were placed in front of us with perfect timing between meals, and the busses were on top of clearing the table. 
Didn't get a chance to try the savory menu ( it's only before 11) but will definitely be back to try that.

I've been coming here since the doors have opened... Phenomenal food, always consistent and quaint atmosphere. Great edition to downtown!

Highly recommend the posole soup and The Reuben.

Art on the walls.

Art on the plates.

I sat at the bar in front of the kitchen. I wanted a bite of everything I saw head out.

Def a must-eat if you're anywhere in or around Vegas.
This place is a favorite of ours! I highly recommend the shrimp and grits, but everything is tasty! I love that it is good, locally owned and independent. Drop in if you have a chance.

It's exactly what we did when we got to this hip brunch joint. Eat!

I love the name of this place. I'm surprised that it hasn't been used yet!

My visit was on a Saturday late morning. Very hip downtown vibe, great for couples or friends to meet up for brunch after a late night.

Their menu focuses on supporting local farmers, making things in-house, and keeping it healthy. There are many unique items that are served here, Mediterranean egg white frittata, truffle egg sandwich, and shrimp & grits, which I'm always curious about. For lunch, what stood out was green chile chicken posole, salads, a Killer grilled cheese sandwich, even banh mi sandwiches! For dessert, shaved iced coffee. Interesting!

Our breakfast:

Steel-Cut Oats Cinnamon with roasted apples, cream and sugared pecans
Beignets with jam and vanilla-scented mascarpone
Golden-Brown Pancakes with chicken-apple sausage

How's the food? It tasted fresh and homemade. The pancakes were the star of this meal. AMAZING! Light, fluffy, and a little buttery crisp on the outside. My boyfriend and son shared the chicken-apple sausage and they loved it. We've had better oatmeal at other places and the beignets didn't have a light airy texture as I was hoping for. 

Service was friendly and efficient. They don't have booths, which we always try to grab to corner in my toddler and their tables were a bit small for the three of us. When we asked if we can use the next table to adjoin to ours, our server said sure, even though I know, being a server previously, that it meant she won't get that table seated. We felt bad and made sure we left a bigger tip to make up for it. 

I do wish they had a more convenient location and a slightly bigger menu. More pancake selections, for sure! That being said, EAT definitely intrigues me to return for more visits when I'm in the area.

Been here a few times and I have to say something. Such care is put into the dishes that's it's hard to ignore. One could say that a pancake is easy to perfect, but that's not true. When a restaurant pays attention to perfect execution of a simple dish, that deserves recognition.

I've eaten several dishes here and most recently had the chilequile. I've never been disappointed with the food or the warmth of the staff. Kudos for bringing such a great little eatery to my downtown neighborhood.

Heard about this spot from the owners of Sweet Spot Candy shop and been coming ever since. Definitely my favorite breakfast spot in LV, possibly I've ever had in my entire life!!! I've only ordered the Chicken Fried Steak (come hungry, it's a lot of food). The batter and succulent combination of savory gravy is a satisfying flavorful experience like no other. They master the poached egg. I usually get poached or sunny side ^. I've been wanting to try the pancakes but can't get away from the chicken fried goodness. The staff is very friendly and always in a cheerful mood. The atmosphere is very ambient and peaceful. Has a homely vibe to it. Location is excellent, after your meal take a stroll downtown or to the container park.
Really cool hole in the wall place.  Ordered the huevos motulenos.  It was good.  A little heavy on the sauce but good.

Sorry, no pictures from me here... because I forgot to save my snapchat pictures.  I am so sad that I cannot visually recapture my moment at eat.  but at least I have my vivid mental memory of this great brunch eat.tery & the pictures from yelp.

Came here on a Saturday around 11 @ the wait was about 40 mins but it was worth it.

Must get:

Coffee!!!!!
Ginger drink!!!!!
DEEP FRIED deviled eggs. ---- super must
(I swear you not, this was the best thing I've eatten in my life).  Truly was worth the calories.
Eggs Benedict (Off the menu) pretty good, but not the best

again... please please please get the deviled eggs. ( View all the pictures of the deviled eggs)
Food is good, service is great. Meat and potato dishes with velvety aftertaste, twisty Benedicts. High end diner with great coffee and orange slices in oj. Gets busy after 10am on the weekend.
Great atmosphere, even better food! We came in for lunch, I had the blt with their homemade chips mmm. Would definitely go back!

It's crazy that this place has 1K reviews! I've been interested in trying out this place for about a year now, but due to a busy schedule and their TIGHT hours (8am-3pm) I never had the opportunity to try it out! :(

Yesterday we were in the area and interested in trying something new, and luckily they were open! As soon as we walked in, we were worried about a long wait time due to the fact that there were SO many people eating and also people waiting to be seated. But as soon as we walked in, we were seated right then and there, which was convenient. I assume it was because we were a party of two. 

I ordered my food, (see photos!) and my boyfriend ordered his. Our food was okay. The service was okay. The food looked so good, but after eating it, it just felt.. greasy and heavy in my stomach. Not alot of healthier options in my opinion. And the bread that they add onto your plate... HUGE... Huge slices of sourdough bread, and 3-5 slices on your plate! I could hardly finish my bread, while my boyfriend didn't even touch his. 

The food portions are quite large, much more than we expected when we ordered. Had I known that, I wouldn't have ordered the cinnamon toast strawberry dessert, because even though we shared it, we still couldn't finish it. 

About $40.00 for brunch.. kind of pricey. Overall, my experience here was okay.. maybe in the near future I will try it again.

Before starting a day of outlet shopping with the husband, we decided to grab brunch at Eat based on some helpful Yelp reviews. The staff was friendly yet they seemed like they can barely keep up with the customers. I asked our waitress for some recommendations but she didn't have much of an opinion other than the portions were large.

We got our food and we sat for a bit realizing they forgot to bring us our utensils. I ordered the cinnamon biscuit with the strawberry compote. My husband felt like having their "killer grilled cheese" with some "kick-ass tomato soup." My dish was decent but unremarkable except that I couldn't taste any cinnamon at all. I felt that I may have punted and should have ordered the chicken fried steak despite the waitress thinking the portions might be too large for me. I tried my husband's grilled cheese. Frankly, I make a far superior grilled cheese. The bread was too thick and it seemed more like a cheese sandwich with melted cheese. I could give this place another go since we might not have ordered the right items. But in my opinion, if a place is going to name their dish "killer grilled cheese," they really need to back it up.

I spent the New Year in Vegas and decided to venture off the strip for breakfast in the downtown area. Came across the restaurant EAT on Yelp. I read the reviews and decided to give it a try. So glad I did. The food was absolutely delicious! I ordered coffee, cinnamon biscuits, bacon, eggs, & potatoes. The portions were hearty and the food was fresh and tasty. I gave them 4* because of the floor. It's a cement floor with a glossy slick finish. I almost slipped on it. Be careful when walking inside the restaurant could be a serious safety hazard.

Went downtown to get marriage liscence the clerk recommended this place. Food was excellent ordered grilled cheese it was ginormous came with tomato soup which was also very good. Husband ordered huevos rancheros also very good. 
Definitely would recommend you try this place out.

Prime rib hash special in the picture.  This place was amazing.  You know it is an awesome place when everyone around you is sharing the bits of their meals which I saw everyone around me doing.  The service was amazing and friendly, my coffee cup was always full and the meal. OMG the meal.  Good food simple and fast.  Amazing!!! Eat here at eat. And then get the ate!!!
DBLTA sandwich + pancakes for two ppl. We don't know the pancake and the sandwich will be that big. Worth the price, the veg in the sandwich is fresh. Ice tea is great, love it cuz it's not sweet.

Chef Natalie knows how to cook...Chef Natalie knows how to hire a top notch staff...Chef Natalie knows how to run a restuaurant and pleasse the public...Chef Natalie has her act together...EAT is a stunner...Breakfast and lunch done the right way...Reasonable and always packed because it IS a winner...Stop by and discover why EAT is tops on everyone's list...

Eat at Eat! This is actually one of the first restaurants I've eaten at in DTLV. I'm definitely not use to the parking, aka parallel parking. But that did not deter us from eating here. It's actually very spacious inside, it didn't take the hostess long to seat us, however there was just two.

I'm easy to please when it comes to breakfast food. All I need is a nice big cup of coffee and good food. Both of which this restaurant has plenty of. We both tried the truffle egg sandwich. The sandwich was pretty good. The sandwich was a little hard to eat though. It was pretty fat. The bacon was also a little to crispy for my liking, but I guess thats what I get for ordering something with bacon when I don't actually like bacon that much. The truffle part just sounded too good to pass up.

The service could have have been a little more attentive. It was a little hard to get a refill on my coffee. I tried asking and the girl just kind of walked away before I got the chance. I just need a refill to save me from the food coma..
Amazing super cute super yummy had the chicken fried steak and egg amazing the toast was awesome will come back for sure

STOP DONT COME TO THIS OVERRATED WANNA BE BERKELEY  KNOCKOFF OF A TYPE OF RESTAURANT... GO TO DUPARS, HASH HOUSE A GOGO OR ANYWHERE ELSE IN FREMONT... First off let me start by saying that the food here was pretty good...BUUUUUUT NOT WORTH THE BS...so I came here when I first moved here cause I live in the same building...ordered a sandwich, orange juice and a soda which cost 27 BUX ...Now was it good? yeah it was good, but there is way too many options in Vegas to come here for long waits and high San Francisco food prices.  I went in this day which is a Sunday and asked can I still make a to go order since it was about 12 minutes till close.  The hostess said we don't do to go orders on the weekend.  This is fine I totally understand not taking a call in to go order, but I'm standing right there. Like even when I'm right here? So I walked away from that stupidity.  Although I walked away, I was thinking about how dumb that was and how if I were to order and sit down and when the food got there I said hey I have to go. Would they take my food away? No they would have given me a box. Why couldn't that have happened? Anyway I was just being lazy and didn't want to walk another block..lesson learned.

I had read about this place on fb n newsfeeds n of course yelp...so i wanted to check it out..im glad i did..greeted a nice warm hello when i got in the door..sat at the counter..server brought my coffee right away...i was lucky to get a seat its so busy n crowded..but i can see why..the food! I didnt kno what to order so my server recommended the shrimp n grits...im glad he did..omgg so delicious! Creamy, cheesy, shrimp, bacon=deliciousness! My server was nice n funny he made my dining experience gr8..Excellent food n service..i will definitely b back again!
BEST breakfast I've ever experienced. The people were so incredibly cool, and the food was memorable to say the least. Get the truffled egg sandwich and\/or the huevos. Ahhh-may-zing.

Downtown Las Vegas gem.  We had a group of eight and service was excellent. The Downtown Benedict was yummy. I love the turkey bacon, whole wheat English muffin and spinach. I also had the short stack pancakes! Yum! We also had the corn beef hash. It is a must when you come here. The coffee is great. 
If you are staying downtown or entertaining family and friends you need to visit this place!

The setting for this place looks like the streets of San francisco or the cafes in Manhattan. This is a cute little eatery great to hang out with friends for brunch. I ordered the roast beef sandwich and my other friends had the veggie burger and the chicken sandwich. 

What I thought to look really simple there was tremendous flavor in every bite. The tomato soup that my friend had was very delicious with tons of the buttery garlic flavor leveled to the extreme. Not bad for your wallet because pricing was very reasonable. Our small stomachs couldn't handle eating the other half of the sandwich so we took the rest Togo. Wait time isn't too long because it was a Monday. I bet weekends are jam packed. 

We are def coming back!

Great place to have lunch at a moderate price. The wait can be long, so have patience. I had the Cherry Tomato salad which had a great dressing on it. The free range chicken sandwhich was good. The chicken was moist and not over cooked. It was well seasoned and tasty. The tomato soup also was quite  tasty with quite a bit of cheese in it.

What a great spot.  We had some friends in town and went to the Neon museum then decided to "yelp" a new breakfast place.  We found this and we were pleasantly surprised with the service and food.  I got the eggs Benedict and it was super tasty.  Our server Laura is very cool.  We will definitely be back and will be recommending this spot to our friends.

Eat has wonderful food. I think the breakfast menu is superior to the lunch menu. There are only 2 reasons I don't come here more often:

1. The place is regularly busy, which is fine considering it's a tasty and cozy place to eat. However, the soundproofing is nonexistent and it gets so loud that you can't have a conversation without having to raise your voice. Not my preferred atmosphere.

2. They need to serve breakfast after 11 on weekdays, it's too good to take off the menu when other places are serving breakfast all day. I really like  being able to order breakfast for lunch.

I LOVE BRUNCH. The truffled egg sandwich makes my tummy happy! 

Parking is on the street, so unless you park right across the street, you'll have to walk. It's a bit small inside the restuarant but so far, the waits haven't been too long each time I go. The staff weren't amazing, but they also weren't bad. They're kinda just doing their job. 

The food is amazing though (only reason for the four stars). The pancakes are golden with yummy, yummy syrup. The deviled eggs are pretty good too; though; I wouldn't just order that. Again, the truffled egg sandwich is delicioussssssss. Truffle is just YUM. You must order this sandwich.

The food here is nothing short of spectacular. The flavor profile is sophisticated yet comforting. I had the pleasure of ordering the brown sugar biscuits, just enough sweetness to them...I also ordered the truffle egg sandwich with chives potatoes. Oh my was it delicious!!! Truffle can at times be overdone but this was just enough. My husband had ordered the huevos (rancheros?) we forgot the name but that as well was amazing! We were very happy to have stumbled upon this place while in Vegas! Kudos to the chef!

Great food and great service. Stripped down decor is appropriate. Place was jam packed and kitchen was slow, but servers were warm and attentive so it didn't matter. Eggs Benny were possibly best I've had. 42 for good coffee, fresh OJ, and three dishes between two people. Good value, great job.

Great place, with good service and nice food. We had to wait around 5 min before getting seated, but that was not a problem at all. There was a lot of people because the place is popular, but it didn't affect the level of service at all.

After finding this place on Yelp I made sure it was one of my first stops, and wow what a awesome experience! Had the fried deviled eggs to start and the chicken fried steak breakfast with very thick sourdough toast. This place met and exceeded all my expectations. My go to spot for breakfast hands down, now ready to try the lunch and dinner menu.

Mixed feelings about this place. The wait is monstrous (even for a solo diner, due to rude fools hanging out at the bar when they're done) and they "don't do takeout when they're busy" so I couldn't just give them my money and leave. Food was good, but seemed like it wasn't their best effort.

Host was friendly and polite, despite being frazzled due to the crowd- a 10 minute estimate for my seat somehow turned into 40+ which was more time than I spent ordering, waiting for my food, eating, paying, and visiting another store, but I digress- with business this busy, they must be good, right?

Torn between the shrimp and grits or the truffled egg sando, I opted for the former and was only half-satisfied with my order, but by the time I got my food I was too hungry to complain. Grits were okay, bacon was crispy and added both flavor and texture, eggs were cooked perfectly, but shrimp were small and overcooked- should have been blackened, not precooked and tossed on like an afterthought. They lacked flavor and the pico was the most stand-out element of the dish, and there wasn't much of it.

I'm not generally a fan of community tables, though they're not much different than sitting at the bar- but I did make friends with the super-sweet couple who dined beside me. They ordered the egg sando and insisted I get it on my next visit. I'll eventually get around to coming back but it sure as hell won't be on a weekend.
Highly overrated. Biscuits with strawberry were good, not amazing. Tofu scramble was completely flavorless.

Visiting for work and found this on yelp. The photos and the reviews looked good especially for the huevo motulenos.  Yummm!!!   The potatoes were crispy and tasty.  And the eggs, black beans, over the tortilla, and salsa blended very well together.  

You got a pleasant sweet surprise with the fried plantains underneath.  I liked the uniqueness of that extra ingredient. 

I devoured my meal and cannot wait to return here and bring my husband.

I was so exited to try this place out! I thought finally something new downtown! After three visits, this place gets boring. Yes they do have some few good entr√©e to offer, but are they memorable? I would say no. What memorable to me is the wait I get all the time for meeting a friend for brunch. Their policy is they wont seat you until the whole party is present. Yes maybe a friend or two is running late, but to see the place empty full of open chairs, and still they won't seat you, now that's different service.

There's also this discomfort of eating when the owner just seats there and watch her servers do their job. She'll correct them discreetly but not so privately. I've seen owners help out by greeting you or seating you, but this one is different. She just seats in her throne. I am more about interaction with your customers, but never in the three visits have I seen her interact with customers. 

Like I said, food is good, but not memorable.

Host was inviting and sat us fast

Greeted by a super sweet girl with black Framed glasses and tattoos, who took our drinks and was really nice!! 

Laura served us who was very attentive and helpful making up our minds on what to get!! 

You have to try there fried devil eggs and strawberry biscuits!! 

Simple things like there coffee was so good 

Easy parking 
Fast service 
Will come back!!

Was staying close by for the past week and for some reason kept skipping this place- Big Mistake! Went for the Cinnamon Biscuits the next to last morning. Talked myself out of them because I was afraid they would be too much (many). Big Mistake\/Convenient excuse. Got the Truffled Scrambled Egg Sandwich- WHOA!! I was slightly disappointed in myself for ordering something so..."safe". Heh, perfection is NOT safe. There was nothing in there that I couldn't\/haven't prepared before for myself BUT this was seriously delicious and well balanced. I like spicier food or interesting combinations but this sandwich was on point. I would have it again and wholeheartedly recommend it to less adventurous friends. HOWEVER, the hash browns....I spent pretty much each bite trying to determine why they were so good and how I can make mine as delicious. Not spicy like some places, but very flavorful. Soft but crispy, NOT greasy like so many others. Thick but cooked through and the few onions were perfectly cooked to coincidence. I'm not lying, I'm from the South and I've eaten and cooked hash browns my entire life but these really were that perfect and I almost feel like a dork going on about them! 
While contemplating my egg sandwich and hash browns, the couple next to me ordered and received the Cinnamon Biscuits. So not as intimidating. I was afraid they'd be huge- nope, normal size biscuits. Made a plan right then and there to return the next morning after checking out from my hotel. Quick note on the coffee- no fancy table presentation but just a good, well balanced cup of joe. Not strong but not bitter either. A really good coffee choice. I almost asked for a cup to go but thought I'd try a nearby coffee shop- Big Mistake!! Went to the other place, crap coffee and it was barely warm!!! Did not finish- should've taken it back but I was in such a contented state from my eat. experience I just dumped it.

Next day- Cinnamon Biscuit Day! Ran over from hotel. To spare the details- I ordered the biscuits minus the powdered sugar, with the compote on the side. I feared sugary overload for something which should stand alone. I also got a side Chicken Apple Sausage. Alone, the Cinnamon Biscuits are very, very good. Delicious in fact. I pride myself on my traditional Southern biscuits, which these are not, but a tasteful alternative. NOW, with the compote (as designed)-SLAP MY MAMA!! So, so, SO good and the flavors don't clash, they totally compliment if not reinforce. Fresh berries accompany. Great concept and execution. Even better than I expected! I can wholeheartedly recommend the Chicken Apple Sausage, also. Split and grilled, not greasy and went great with the sweet of the biscuits. Learning from yesterday's mistake, I asked for a to go cup for the awesome coffee. 

Two times service, both early morning before the crowds- exceptional- especially for Vegas. Seated quickly, someone at my table moments after seating for my drink order, quick turn and back with recommendations and helpful advice for my food order. Food turnaround both days was super quick. For a town known for ambivalent service at best, this place gets it. I was recognized the second day and thanked for returning. So nice to be appreciated as a customer. 

Exceptional menu, superior execution, great service, fair pricing. That's a five for me.
Very hearty, but high quality good here ..love the shrimp n grits, Rueben, and dBLT sandwich.  Quaint little place downtown and always busy ..good sign.
Great place!  Very unique menu and great service! Very hipster with menu items such as fried deviled eggs and biscuits topped with strawberry and powdered sugar.  Pretty heavy food but very yummy!!
a bit on the extra loud side, but the service was great and the food was fantastic! great options for vegetarians and vegans :)

It's ok I guess but the hostess was as sharp as a marble and kept skipping my group of 4. Once seated, I realized that this place does NOT allow for modifications to their items even if it's for food allergies. When our drinks came, my daughter was served a water with the glass chipped on the rim where her lips would go...because that is such a genius thing to bring out to a table. Then finally when the food came my food was cold. I do not intend on returning.

Great little place! Ive been here twice already for lunch.  Simple tasty menu with great service.  Either try to go early or after the lunch rush.  I would say the downfall of coming here is the parking. Bring quarters!
Wonderful breakfast and great friendly service. Everything was fresh, and the coffee is roasted locally.
This place is amazing the food the environment the staff . A must visit for breakfast I will definitely be back

Great local spot! Fast service. The Huevos Motuleno is delicious! Tip: Add some hot sauce for some spice. And do yourself a favor. GET THE PANCAKES! They have a crispy outside and a fluffy inside. Best bite we've had in Vegas so far.
Love this place!  Had the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  Never have been disappointed

I had never heard of it until today. Walked in and was taken aback. I ate a roast beef sandwich... It was excellent! My friend had another type sandwich and she devoured it. What a place. A little noisy but the quality of food makes up. Right across the street from container city. It is a place to come back many more times.

Great local b'fast in Vegas. Ignore the neighborhood and run (don't walk) for the tasty huevos multenos, one of the most inventive egg dishes ive tried.  pancakes were the bomb.  Dbl blt and grilled cheese were delish too. The place has a good vibe.

I have been here for lunch twice now. It's a smaller restaurant which makes you very in tune with the atmosphere.  The service I have gotten has been prompt and very approachable. The food comes out fast, and you can definitely see that they care about what they are serving here. I've had the Reuben, thick toast, not soggy with dressing, it was hands down one of the best reubens I have had the pleasure of eating.  

I cannot recommend this place enough. Oh, and try the cinnamon biscuits with the fruit, your taste buds will thank you.

I wanted to find a cool place to eat in Vegas, where locals go and get off The Strip. I was excited to eat @eat, close to Eleventh Street Records and downtown. As soon as I walked in the door, 2 guys in the front said you can't bring that in here, you have to throw it away. I don't make the rules. I was holding a full ice coffee, with a lid. I like to get my ice coffee before a restaurant in case they only have hot coffee, which I cannot drink. So I tossed it and was so very unhappy at that moment. The two guys were not even nice about it, never said hi, welcome. One of the guys was my waiter, he never introduced himself, just wanted to know what I wanted. A lady walks in after me with a water, they said nothing to her about her drink. I really wanted to not leave a tip, but I will never do that, so I am leaving this review. I won't be back! 
-Oh, the food was just ok, not worth the lose of a $5 coffee, or dealing with attitude! Next time I will just go to Mr. Lucky's @Hard Rock, where there is no attitude.

Saw EAT on yelp and decided to stop in for lunch. I am so glad we did.... wow.... I was really impressed. Atmosphere is so nice, even though the neighborhood is a little rough.
I had the DWBLTA sandwich (smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and chipotle mayo on sour dough bread) with the tomato soup. The sandwich was fantastic... everything was fresh and the sourdough bread was perfect. The tomato soup was seriously the best I have ever had! If you go to EAT definitely try the tomato soup!
My husband had the Shrimp and Grits, which is one of their signature dishes, it was incredible as well.
We will definitely be back!

The best breakfast\/brunch\/lunch experience in Vegas. Get off the strip, get down town. Honestly, after the 2nd time I'd been here, I thought I saw the owner on an amex commercish. 
The food is great, but honestly the service keeps me coming back. These people know how to treat customers! 
The food is well done, and affordable for the quality. Its a wonderful staple for me, to the point where if I bring friends with me to Vegas, we go here at least once. Sandos are HUGE!

Came here one afternoon for lunch with my girlfriend around 1pm on a Tuesday. Eat. is located in the trendy side of downtown right behind container park and at the edge of the action at life is beautiful. Parking is street parking and luckily we were able to get a spot close to Eat. We had to pay like $2 for parking and convenience but the machines to pay are all new and very easy to use.  When we went inside there were a good amount of people but it wasn't packed and we were still able to find a seat. I'd imagine on weekends there would definitely be a wait. 

Service: Our server was friendly and offered\/provided help when needed. Kept up with our waters and did her due diligence. The chef or owner? I'm not sure also came by to check on us and other tables which was a nice touch. Very laid back but prompt and knowledgable, which is perfect for a place like this. 

Entrees: Killer Grilled Cheese x Roast Beef Sandwich. Both came with sides and my girlfriend chose tomato soup for her grilled cheese and I got chips for my sandwich. When I first looked through the menu I wasn't expecting much. I found the menu to be quite boring and dull as everything sounded so basic, but I was quickly proven wrong. The ciabatta bread was extremely soft and the sandwich was pleasantly warm and not cold. The combination of the roast beef, wild mushroom, mayo, and definitely the arugula provided a nice mixture of flavor and the crunch of the arugula made it just the more satisfying. The Grilled Cheese is very hearty and reminiscent of an english breakfast. Very buttery and tasted like a mix of brioche and french toast. This was also a pleasant surprise as I did not expect the grilled cheese to be like this. Fun to dip with the tomato soup but I'm not a big soup person so I wasn't too blown away. Tomato soup was simple as was the side of chips although the chips were a little too salty for my taste. 

Extras: Stack of Pancakes: Ordered a stack of pancakes due to popular reviews as well as thinking that I wouldn't be as full from the sandwich. Not a pancake expert but it's definitely better than the normal ihop pancakes. Butter and Syrup is provided on the side and the exterior is crusted just right. Not too thick either which I like as I feel like pancakes can get real dry, real fast. Thankfully these didn't and I enjoyed it as did my girlfriend. 

Thoughts: This is a fun little restaurant downtown as part of the trendy hipster revolution that's swept over this side of the city. Walking around and seeing the area definitely reminded me of places like Seattle, Portland, and Downtown La.  The design of the restaurant too with it's black\/ white colors, natural sunlight, open kitchen, exposed bricks, and thrifty furniture. It's like  the neighborhood spot down the street that main character in romcoms go to for a bite to eat. Food is simple, clean, and delicious. Portions are generous, and it's a perfect place for breakfast or a quick lunch. I'm a big fan of this side of town as change is sweeping and I can definitely see a shift in culture. It's exciting to see the growth and change of this area from being the "ghetto" or "old" to the "new" and trendy side of town.
Friendly service & BOMB food!! I'll drive downtown to Eat anytime it's totally worth it!

Delicious and regular human portions! We shared the corned beef hash and an order of eggs benedict.  Both were so good!  My only disappointment was that the poached eggs were a little overdone.  The service was awesome as well!  This was by far the best meal we had in Vegas!

Good food. Good menu. Friendly helpful staff.

 The chicken pot pie with a fried egg on top was good. Better than average coffee. Clean place. Neighborhood seems a little rough if you're an old lady. But thats cool.

 It's very loud inside. So loud u can't hear the people sitting across from you. They need to add some soft surfaces to soak up some noise. Cement floors, ceilings, walls. Noise just bounces all over. 

Small complaint tho for a very good ,friendly restaurant.  Burt  recommends it .
Great food in an urban atmosphere!  Excellent service. Highly recommend this diversion from the corporate strip.

Can you please open on of these in NYC?!

I fell in love with this place. The food. The service. The ambiance. Even the location was perfect. 
It's away from the Vegas strip which can be a bit too loud for one to enjoy a nice meal but at the same time its so close to Fremont St that has a lot to offer. The restaurant is located exactly across from the back of the Container Park, which by the way everyone should go to. 

The wait time here is tricky, it depends at what time you show up. But don't be taken back by the amount of people waiting, every second you wait will be worth it once you go in and eat. 

The menu is very basic, but everything sounds great and if you are like me you will find yourself looking at other table sot see what people ordered. So everywhere I turned everything looked amazingly good. For appetizer, we had some biscuits with strawberry sauce drizzled with confectionery sugar....TO DIE FOR. As soon as we took a bite of the biscuit we knew that we were in for a good eat. 
For main course i went for the pancakes with an apple sausage and my brother and mom went for the breaded steak, yes STEAK. When they ordered they missed the part that said steak so when they went in for the cut they say that it was not a fried chicken breast, it was steak. And holy moly was that a big piece of steak. Both of them could of ate from one plate. The steak came with two eggs and potatoes. As to my pancakes, it was a simple dish, but boy were those pancakes huge.  They gave me three I only ate one and a half. I couldn't do it. And let's just say that for the price I did not mind not being able to finish it all.

Hubby and I took a day date to visit a place he's wanted to try for a while: eat.

We've seen their brunch and lunch menu but living way in Henderson (so far away! lol) we hadn't made it out before dinner time.

I had the truffled egg sandwich and boy was it a great choice! I loved the perfect texture of my eggs, the veggie additions, and truffle taste that wasn't overpowering. Hubby tried the shrimp po boy which had a banh mi kick to it! It was very fresh and delicious. We sampled their deviled eggs which were deep fried with sriracha on top -- I have to say they were the best deviled eggs I've ever had! 

Hubby had their passion tea and I had the sparkling strawberry lemonade which was pretty amazing.

Gary was our server and he was very in tune to hearing what we were deciding on and also with making recommendations since it was our first visit! 

We definitely liked the ambiance - casual and quaint - and want to come back!

Truffle egg sandwich WHAT!!!!!! AMAZING. 
Every time I hit Vegas this place will be at the top of my list..... Every one is so friendly open kitchen is popping yet organized its awesome to watch them get it done.
 This is another Vegas staple. Kudos guys

This place was super cool. I loved the atmosphere and decor. The food was absolutely amazing too! I had a chicken breast on a ciabatta bread. They chicken tasted so clean and healthy. It wasn't greasy or oily at all! The bread wasn't like ciabatta bread I'm used to having. It was soft and literally melted in my mouth! There wasn't a wait to get seated and the waiters are all very nice and attentive. I highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to try some great breakfast off of the strip!

What a pleasant experience in downtown Las Vegas.  The truffled egg sandwich was superb, the feta really made the dish! The bacon was perfectly crisp- almost fluffy- and the bread had the perfect bite, chewy but not tough.  The coffee was excellent, the staff professional,  the entire breakfast was 360 degrees of perfection.

Lauren was Great, Very quick to refill coffee and had a big smile. Perfect amount of attention. Chilaquiles and Shrimp and Grits were delicious. This is one of my favorite places for Breakfast when I am in town and if you try it I am sure it will be yours as well.

I rarely give 5-star ratings, but this place is definitely an exception.  Came here this morning for a working breakfast with my department's management team.  This restaurant is a hidden gem!  Service was very attentive.  Our orders were taken quickly and before we knew it, our food arrived hot and fresh from the kitchen.  I had the Chicken Fried Steak.  Delish!  The chef\/owner came into the restaurant while we were there.  I really wanted to shake her hand and give her props, but by the time we left, I couldn't find her.  The only criticism I can give is that there is no parking lot, but there is lots of street parking nearby.  Don't let that scare you into not trying this amazing place!

I was expecting a lot, from reading previous reviews.  The noise factor was very off-putting.  As we entered, about noon, the music was booming. There is nothing soft around to absorb sound, so don't expect to have a conversation.  The music did tone down after a bit...but not because they lowered it.  Everyone who does talk has to raise his voice to be heard, so the sound escalates as the restaurant fills.  I had to put in the earplugs I always have with me.  My chicken pot pie used puff pastry underneath and on top of the filling.  The filling was okay; I didn't detect a lot of chicken in it, but it wasn't all sauce like some--mostly veggies I think.  The bottom crust couldn't be crispy, and the top crust wasn't either--so I just ate arouond the edges.  The chicken sandwich was ordinary, and the potato salad tasted more like the packaged salad in a regular market.  The one I make myself is much better.  It's unlikely we will return.  Breakfast is enticing, but ends at 11 am.

Swanky breakfast\/lunch place downtown. I would say brunch HOWEVER we all know the quintessential brunch item is a mimosa... They don't have this.

So! The PIC & I ventured through the urban jungle that is DTLV & walked in. We were promptly greeted by the hostess and seated. Browsed through the menu, and got the cinnamon strawberry biscuits. WOW order these, you will not be disappointed. 

For the main entrees we got the truffled egg sandwich. Yum, really good & the chive potatoes that accompany their breakfast dishes are on point. The grilled cheese with tomato bisque is delish as well. 

Why not 5 stars? Service can be improved just a bit & some of their more popular items (the chicken fried steak) should be available all day. Nonetheless, I will be back.

Hip diner feel that you'd expect to see in Los Angeles. Lots of people coming here from the local law offices and downtown businesses. Good coffee. Good hearty breakfast if that's what you seek. This spot is a fantastic alternative to the restaurants you'll find attached to a casino downtown. Make a reservation!
Fast, efficient and friendly service.  Truffled egg sandwich was delicious!!  Nice location away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

Every dish here is great. I love trying the specials, they're always different and tasty from Chef Natalie's reinterpretation of comfort foods. The staff is nice, even when they're busy. The coffee could be better.  My only complain is that it's so darn loud in there. The acoustic is awful there for some reason. Maybe once the patio open it'll provide a quieter forum to sit.

Visited in May 2015 and have added Eat to our list of must "Eat" restaurants. I had the DWBLTA sandwich with the house made chips and it was delish! Fresh ingredients, HUGE portions and great service. Sandwich stuffed so thick with goodness I could barely take a bite out of it. Coffee was tasty as well.

Within walking distance of the Freemont Experience.

Love this place. Hubby read about it in the Sunset Magazine and I questioned, "What does Sunset Mag know?"  Well, was I wrong.  It's in Downtown where the street has posted "Neighborhood Watch", so you know it's not a great place to be at night.  The place is clean, bright and modern looking, located approximately 2 miles from the Strip.
The food:
1. Beignets, $8 for a place of 6 rectangles, 2-3 inches.  Very good, like donuts but NOT as good as Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans.  Came with jam and a "to die for" cinnamon butter.
2. Chicken fried steak, $13.  Hubby says it's definitely homemade because the shape was irregular.  I had a bite, good.  But we both agreed we like the CFS better at the Pork Store Cafe in SF. Came with potato chunks.
3. Shrimp and Grits, $12.  I loved this dish.  Layers on the bottom of my dish was creamy, soft grits, topped with a tortilla, bacon strips and the shrimp sauce with large pieces of shrimp.  It was more than enough for 1 person but I stuffed myself and ate the whole thing so as not to waste any.  Milk, $2 and OJ $4.

The chef was working in the back kitchen with 2 other cooks.  This is my bookmark place for local breakfast.  Serving staff were so friendly and were a good tag team, helping each other out, even better than some of the restaurants in the hotels on the Strip.
Tuesday lunch. Excellent food, service, and atmosphere. We'll definitely be coming back often.

We were staying at Main Street Station, so this was a simple 3\/4 mile walk.  Coming from Reno, we're not huge on casino food, and I was intrigued by this restaurant, trying to contribute to the re-development of the downtown area.

We had the beignets (delicious pillows of light, fluffy flavor, with just the right amount of sweet), and I ended up getting the huevos motulenos (an interesting mix of peas, feta, egg, black beans, salsa etc on corn tortillas), while the GF got a grilled cheese. The GF liked it - inch-thick pieces of sourdough, with generous amounts of cheese, and there was definitely that nice blend of buttery, grilled toast, contrasted by the almost gooey cheese.

Definitely worth checking out if you're staying in downtown Vegas.

Went on a Saturday for lunch and it was pretty full with about a 10-15 min wait. Food and service were good. I tried the chicken fried steak. The steak was overdone to the point that the meat around the sides was crispy but the gravy was delicious. Lots of interesting items on the menu that I plan to try next time we go.

The space is nice with an open kitchen you can see right into. Downside is that it's quite noisy.

This is a great place to enjoy some good, fresh but simple eats. It seems like a neighborhood spot. Open concept, casual dining.. feels like you are at a big outdoor dining room. I booked through Open Table. They set us up with a great seat to accommodate our baby stroller. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and the staff took the extra time to put together a special birthday dessert for us without us requesting.

Not much of a whole in the wall but more of an urban hot spot. I don't know about most people, but coming downtown for breakfast takes a lot in me. My girlfriend and I really wanted to try out this place as it has been on our Instagram newsfeeds for the last month or so. I couldn't take the heckling I received via social media and thus forced myself into the oblivion... and shawty was I not disappointed. 

As a "Yelper" I'm going to do my best to not throw around the holy "5 Stars" unless it is deserved. This place deserved it. Location wise, it isn't the most convenient but good food is always worth the the drive and in this case, area wise, worth the risk. I may be over exaggerating but it isn't the nicest part of town, but I'll be honest and say I didn't feel uncomfortable at all. I assume you usually would have to pay for parking as there are meters everywhere, coming here on a Sunday we so graciously avoided that. So firstly, come on a Sunday. 

We walk in and you just feel the vibe. It's like, "who cares that you're here just eat!" kinda vibe. The wait was minimal at least and the spot is decently sized for a downtown restaurant. We were sat down and greeted almost immediately. The service was on point, one of those places that you're kind of taken back by how friendly everyone is. 

The food. Ah yes the food. We both ordered some generous cups of coffee to get us started, good coffee can make a place. We decided to try their beignets, which were accompanied by a side of this berry-concoction jam and this sweet frosting butter mix, if you will. I've had beignets before, I lived in New Orleans for a little and was spoiled by the Cafe du Monde's of the gulf. These were delicious. A fresh take on a French classic, well worth it. My girlfriend ordered the Chicken Fried Steak which was delicious and was sided with some grilled potatoes and onions. I ordered the Downtown Benedict which had turkey bacon and fresh as can be spinach and tomatoes accompanied with just the right amount of hollandaise on top. Mine was sided with those scrumptious potatoes and onions as well. The portions were extremely generous for the price, I was stuffed. The food was amazing and I can't complain about anything. 

The vibe was great there, the music playing ahead was perfect. From John Mayer to Israel Kamakawiwo'ole soothing our ears. But before we could get to attached, a local artist named Sabrielle (someone please message me if they can correct me on this or where I can purchase her music) performed live. Her voice was amazing and kind of sold it for us. Apparently she's there every other Sunday so if you're lucky enough, she's gonna be famous one day. 

All in all, go eat at eat. It's a great place to go and I'd recommend this to anyone. You won't be disappointed.
Had breakfast here for the last two mornings. Had bacon and eggs and huevos motulenos both dishes were fantastic can't recommend this enough

Eat is a solid, three star brunch joint. I enjoyed my meal here.  It's a mostly good spot.  Anyone reading this seeing 3 stars and thinking it's a bad review, it's not! But there were several issues during our meal that made this place miss the 4 star level.

One place they excel: the pancake. It's thick and fluffy, while still being crispy on the outside. I rarely order pancakes, but after two bites, I was hooked.  The homemade tomato soup was quite good, with large, thin chunks or parmesan floating on top. Also, the coffee served here is excellent.

We also tried the truffled egg sandwich. I've seen other reviewers rave about this, but something was missing. The bread wasn't good, and the flavors of the ingredients didn't meld well together. 

The service here was lacking.  It seems to be focused on turnover rather than true customer interaction. Our server asked us about five times if we were ready to order.  Once we were finished, three different people asked if we wanted the check.  We weren't checked on a single time while dining. 

Lastly, the name is kind of dumb:
"Hey, you want to go eat?" 
"Sure, what are you thinking?"
"How about eat?"
"....I know, like, what place"
"No...the restaurant in downtown called eat, silly"
"..."


Bottom Line: A fine brunch\/lunch spot, and certainly better than a lot of other Las Vegas spot. They serve brunch daily, which is really nice if you are visiting and everyday seems like a Saturday.  Maybe I went on an off day, but this place is already good and has potential to get better.

Stopped in for breakfast after reading good reviews in Yelp. It was pretty busy so we had to wait about 25 minutes for a table. I had the chicken fried steak breakfast which came with potatoes, eggs, and your choice of bread. Overall, my dish was pretty good. My husband had pancakes which were amazing. They were huge, fluffy, and buttery. So I would recommend pancakes over the chicken fried steak. We had a pleasant experience. Quick service and close to Fremont street downtown.

I took the advice of my fellow Yelpers and stopped here for breakfast.  I had looked at the menu online, and I had practically decided what I would have before going, but I looked at the menu in any case.Coffee was brought quickly while I was looking at the menu and reaffirming my decision.  I had to go with the Huevos Motulenos.

What an interesting breakfast!  A corn tortilla topped with black beans, peas, saut√©ed bananas, and feta cheese with two over easy eggs on top and then topped with red and green chili sauce.  The dish comes with home fried potatoes.  Since this is a breakfast and lunch restaurant only, these home fries are made from scratch. These aren't cubed potatoes left over from last night's baked potatoes.  I watched as the one cook cut the potatoes and then stirred them as they grilled.

The menu states that this is a zesty dish.  It was excellent!  I could have used a little Cholula, but I decided to have it as it was served than eat breakfast with lots of hot sauce like I'm known to do.  Service was very good.

I like this small new place--open only 2 months--and it does have a "loft" kind of vibe like another reviewer stated.  My only complaint is parking over which Eat has no control.

----End of review

----Editorial follows:

** Note to the mayor and city council **

If you're going to have meters, convert them so you can pay with a credit card like other cities.  I don't walk around with parking meter change in Las Vegas.  Better yet, take them out.  If you want us to continue to come downtown, make it a bit easier!

Awesome place! 

I liked the trendy vibe it had. I prefer this place rather the hash hash a go go for sure. 

Very friendly service and attentive to my needs. 

Food was fresh and had a great presentation. 

When I come back to downtown Las Vegas I have to hit up this place again.

Located in Downtown LV this quaint little place had a lot a character. After being sat we were immediately greeted and offered recommendations. My wife doesn't drink black coffee and after being convinced by our server she ordered it. She loved it and also bought a bag of the coffee beans. A little pricey at $15 but it is great to support a local business. We started with an order of beignets. They were absolutely amazing. Light, crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. Served along side a strawberry preserve and flavored cream cheese. It was delicious together and by itself. A definite must have. I ordered the chicken fried steak and a side pancake (another recommendation by our server). The steak was filled with gristle and hard to cut and chew. This took away from my enjoyment of the dish. The batter was light and crispy. The big plus was the gravy, absolutely delicious. Creamy with chunks of sausage, perfectly balanced, not overly creamy it oily. They claimed to have the best pancake. It was served with pure maple syrup. It looked like it was cooked in a cast iron skillet. It had crispy edges and a fluffy center. It was an absolutely perfect pancake. Next time I'm ordering just the pancake stack. This is a definite place to stop by any time you're in Vegas for breakfast or brunch.

If you want a good breakfast, I'd recommend venturing outside of the strip to this small joint a block outside of the main street in downtown Las Vegas. Expect a wait, because it tends to get really crowded. There's not much shade or seating outside while you wait so beware of the heat during the summer. We were taken here by a LV local, but I dunno if it's really a "local" place.

I got the eggs benedict, and wow, I don't know if it's because I was nearing the end of my road trip from San diego to Denver and back again and was eating subway\/in&out everyday, but that Benedict just made my DAY. ShOOt. The benedict was topped with a perfect little egg - poached to perfection - covered with hollandaise, under which lay strips of thick turkey bacon, swiss or thick cheese of some sort, tomato, greens, and a nicely toasted piece of bread. The egg had a GREAT ooze to it as you slowly cut into the center of the yoke, adding to the taste and texture. The bacon was so thick i had to chew slower than I wanted to. On the side was a heaping of potatoes, seasoned well. 

Definitely a great change from huge and not very good portions served at quick joints on the strip, but super filling! Friends got shrimp and grits, pancakes, country fried steak, all of which no one complained about. I'd come back again!!!

I'm giving a 3\/5 because I felt like not only was the menu limited, but there wasn't a lot of creativity and nothing that blew me away. 

My corned Beef Hash was fine, but nothing special. 

My friend Ms. W and Mr. P both got the Pancakes. It was a much better portion for the price compared to my dish. And the Pancakes were very nicely done. I particularly appreciated the little jars of  real maple syrup they came with. But getting plain and simple pancakes just isn't my thing - I need them full of granola, smothered in Nutella and topped with strawberries because I'm that kind of crazy girl. 

The best, most special thing I had was definitely the deviled Eggs. They were panko-encrusted and fried, then topped with bacon. Now we're talking!

Maybe I should've tried their cinnamon biscuits topped with strawberries. It seems to be one of their most popular dishes and based on the Pancakes and the amazing bread the provide to go with just about every plate, they do Grain-based dishes best.

I had the shrimp and grits. It was decent not very seasoned but was still good. Service is good, the only thing that bothered me was how close the tables are, it's hard to hear the person in front of you because you have people to your left and right speaking loudly.

Food was fantastic and unique. We tried their deviled eggs appetizer, amazing!!!!! The heuvos motulenos dish was tasty and different. However, very worth a try. Staff was friendly and johnny on the spot.

Holy cow! Let me start by saying I'm absolutely in love with this place. I've been dying to get here for a brunch but turns out a coworker and I dropped by for lunch instead.

Props to the interior designer because this place is totally my cup of tea. It's got that downtown, upscale hipster vibe that just makes you feel welcomed. 

Now to the good part, the food. Our waitress recommended the biscuits to start. Ah-mazing! They come with a fruity syrup and fresh fruit. Seems like more of a breakfast or dessert item so maybe next time I'll save it for later. For an entree I chose the grilled cheese & tomato soup. No joke this was the best grilled cheese I've ever had in my life! The portion size was huge so it lasted me for lunch & dinner. Enjoyed each and every minute of it! My coworker had the BLT which looked great too.

Can this place get any better? I'll definitely be back soon for brunch & more.

A twenty minute wait turned into over forty. No rhyme or reason to seating.... Even taking into account parties of 2, 3, 4, 5 or six.... certainly not first come. 
I ordered the chicken fried steak and the steak crust was cold and doughy. Once the coating was removed it was edible. The potatoes looked good but were also lukewarm and soggy.  My wife's potatoes weren't cooked on the inside.
Best Breakfast Ever in Las Vegas! Cinnamon Bisquits with berries and huevos motulenos! Yummy coffee. Fast service. Pleasant staff and kind manager!
All great!  Service was great and food was even better. Highlights were the pancakes and the tomato basil salad.  Highly recommend.

We stopped by for brunch at around 11am on a Sunday. There was no line so we were seated right away by a very prompt hostess.

The restaurant and its location are both interestingly quirky. The interior and ambience of the restaurant felt fun and inviting. It just feels like a cool place to go have a meal.

The server was friendly and quick. There was a good variety of dishes to choose from. We ordered some coffees, beignets, oatmeal and some pancakes with sausage. 

The coffee was delicious. There wasn't a trace of bitterness in the coffee. The rest of the food was very good as well. It tasted fresh and well made.

All in all a delightful place to have a meal. I would definitely go again to try out the other dishes.

As someone who's lived in NYC an la and in Vegas for just a year, I love this place. It's got a cute, casual, hipster vibe with great breakfast food!  I literally crave the cinnamon biscuits and strawberries and will venture here just for them! The service is friendly and quick. It makes me forget I'm in a chain filled city and pretend that I'm in downtown la :). So glad they're here!  (Great vegetarian options too!)

My first time at Eat. and it was fabulous service and GREAT FOOD! The prices are great for the amount of food you get. I will definitely be back. Thank you :) I had the pancakes and chicken apple sausage with a side of grits and definitely took a to-go box! :) Ooh and the coffee is AMAZING as well. Great place!

Breakfast...the best Chicken Fried Steak in Las Vegas, I had grits instead of potatoes I swear my mother was in the kitchen making them.  Two eggs cooked to perfection had a couple slices of applewood bacon...fantastic, the toast is so thick you think you have 3 slices glued together to make one...sorry no pictures to busy eating breakfast at Eat.

Came here with my mom and beau. I the place was packed, and still received a warm welcome from the wait staff. Seated promptly and was served in a timely manner. The food was piping hot. I ordered the shrimp and grits, which was a big hefty serving.  My mom and beau dishes week equally delicious.

Great addition to the whole laid-back vibe of Downtown Vegas. Yummy!!!

Had the special prime rib hash served with Texas toast, potatoes, green chilies, tomato, and eggs. Taste was ok, but not knock your socks off great. I also thought it was overpriced at $15.00, considering the amount of prime rib I got (tiny cut up pieces also). At $10 I probably wouldn't complain.
Service was good and the staff was friendly, but one thing I noticed was that the cooks pre-prepare a lot of their food, probably in anticipation for the crowds? I saw stacks of pre-cooked bacon, potatoes, biscuits, etc., which leads me to believe that the food isn't as freshly made as you would think. Maybe this is the norm everywhere, but I just happened to notice that here. 
Other than that, I kind of regret my choice for breakfast and wish I had opted for something else...like the shrimp and grits. May return, but while on vacation, probably won't. 
Additional note, the coffee was also kinda pricey.
Hip and delicious. Great service and food by people passionate about it.

Great tasting food had the pancakes and also tried the grilled cheese and tomato soup,there also very generous with portions the only complain really was the waitress was a bit pushy coming by every other minute to see if we where ready to order even after I told her it was my first time at eat and I wanted to see all the options I would understand if it was busy but there was only like 4 customers at the time on a Wednesday just saying

4.5 stars. The food is incredible. The cinnamon biscuits are a must order. Its heaven on a plate. Make sure to eat them while they are still warm. The tomato soup is fresh. You can taste they made it homemade; very light and flavorful. The grill cheese is a monster of sandwich, like you have never seen before. The bread is soft and buttery with plenty of cheese. Perfect ratio. The deviled eggs were crunchy and very tasty. And the lemonade was right on. Half a star goes off because the service was a little unorganized.
