Eat. Yum! Try to go as much as I can since it has opened. I love the place and love that it's downtown. Think I've tried something new each time and always impressed. Those beignets ah and the grill cheese.. Perfect early morning weekend place-  its good food!

The food was pretty good, but the service was poor. We arrived about 12:45 pm on a Sunday. They had a ton of staff, but apparently they were done for the day. I had to go up to the counter for refills on our beverages.  We had ordered Beignet's, as an appetizer, and i think the waitress forgot to put the order in because it took almost 30 minutes.  Overall- disappointed.

Not a good experience today. Our waiter was rude. Food was okay but missing elements promised on the menu. One of our napkins had a hair ball. After we reported it to the waiter and the supervisor we still got no apology. So disappointed because the last time we were here we had a wonderful meal.

This place is hidden underneath what looks like an apartment complex. I went there for lunch with a few friends and was plesantly surprised at how nice the inside of the restaurant was. 

We were seated promtly and the chef was there overseeing everything. The food was average. I ordered the posole and shared the roast beef sandwich. The sandwich was great but there was not enough meat for the bread. I had half the sandwich and then had to leave the other half of the bread alone since there wasn't enough meat to eat with it. 

The only downside to this place is that it gets EXTREMLY loud when the restaurant is full. When we first arrived the place didn't have that many customers which was why we were seated promptly. Unfortunately when more customers arrived the louder the place got. It was also almost as if they turned up the music as well making it that much louder since people had to talk over the music. I felt I had to scream to my friend who was sitting next to me just so that she can hear me. :-( 

I will be coming back again, hopefully they will have addressed the noise issue and mabe give me a sandwich that has a better filling to bread ratio.

This is my very first review.  Usually, I don't have issues...but this place has gotten more positive reviews than it deserves.  I kind of depend on YELP reviewers to help me decide where I'm going to spend my hard earned cash or in this case, cash I won at the casinos. 
Our table ordered several dishes and we all shared. 
The Chicken Fried Steak was amazingly tough given the fact that the inexpensive cut of beef was tenderized!       The dwblta was served with a very hard, unripe, and inedible avocado.    The "made to order" beignets came to the table fresh out of the fryer.  They "looked" very good.  Unfortunately, they were very dense and really needed a lot of jam and mascarpone to give enough flavor.   I'm not sure whether they were really "made to order" or just "refried " to order.  The Huevos Motulenos dish wasn't too bad....actually not bad at all, but the potatoes were tasteless.  
The coffee was good.  But, the mug it came in looked as if it had been previously used.  Coffee drips were on the front and back of the mug....not necessarily from someone drinking from it...but none the less, not a clean looking mug.  Later, I asked some server walking by to get me a clean mug, and without hesitation did so and filled it with fresh coffee.    
We asked for an extra plate and got the smallest plate possible.  So, we asked again and finally received one after a wait.  We asked for extra jam and immediately got the jam, as well as attitude from some tattooed server\/cashier.
The servers were many...in fact there were so many different ones coming to our table to do things (two to take our order, two others to serve, another one to get the plate, and yet another one to bring the attitude, and still another to bring the check or it could have been the same one....bottom line it would be nice to have just one who tends to our table.   (BTW, our initial servers who took our order were out the door by 9ish that morning. We couldn't figure that one out.  Maybe that was why it seemed we had so many different servers plus it appeared some were in-training.)   I paid and left a small tip because not every server there was lacking "good waiter" qualities.  
There are so many restaurants competing for our business and thanks to YELP it makes it a little easier to decide.  But it is unfortunate when customers don't take the time to critique bad experiences.  What we experienced today does not appear to be a one time thing.....but a lack of control over the quality and preparation of the food and the disregard for its customers experience.  I was disappointed that I wasted my money and  I will  NOT be coming back to this restaurant.

Thank you, fellow yelpers for another great find! Just a few short blocks away from the Fremont St. Experience, you'll find eat. tucked away on an unassuming street. BF and I came here on a Sunday morning (thank you daylight savings and east coast time difference) around 9:30am. We got a table within 10 minutes. The restaurant is spacious and you don't feel like you're sitting on top of each other, which is nice. Everyone working there is super friendly. Although Charity was supposed to be our waitress she was very busy with other tables, so another waitress helped her out. I even noticed Charity find a woman's credit card that was left on the table after the group had already left and she ran out of the restaurant to find them (they were parked across the street). Although Charity didn't take our order she still checked on us while we were eating. 

Speaking of food, we ordered the Eggs Benedict, Chicken Fried Steak with sunny side up eggs, and a side of short stack pancakes. The eggs benny was deliciously light and perfectly poached.  One of the best I've had! The Chicken Fried Steak and gravy was comforting and flavorful. The pancakes.... OH the pancakes! BEST BEST BEST! The edges were crispy and while the middle was fluffy and perfect. WOW. I want more. 

Next time I'm in Vegas I know where I'm going for brunch!

I'm always craving brunch. Since we're in Vegas, I was sure there's a good spot around downtown. 

Yelp said this place was good so went to try it out with a few friends. Coming inside the restaurant, Instantly enjoyed the environment. 

Got to order the corn beef hash. The corn beef is chopped into small squares along with potato bites and pieces of sourdough bread along with one egg. Maybe two eggs would of even out the plate in my opinion. The food tasted really good and I enjoyed mixing little bit of everything on one bite

Great customer service!

Cool thing we caught was as we walked out, there's another sign that said ate. You guys are clever

Been here several times for lunch and its a solid triple with one man on!   I always walk away happy.  Got great sandwiches, soups and breakfast and lunch is the specialty, with a hip downtown flair.  Need a quick meeting with a business lunch, get there EARLY to get a seat, there is a wait sometimes, but not long.   Also, weekends I am sure are slammed.   I go during the week for my trips and its a great hipster trip every time.   Solid grinds!

I have visited Eat a few months before and all I remember was how amazing the pancakes were-simple buttermilk plain pancakes.......It wasn't a fluke, their pancakes are the perfect amount of crispiness and fluff. By far makes the drive downtown worth it. Other highlights are the deep fried deviled eggs, tomato soup, and the local Mothership brewed coffee (could have skipped the grilled cheese.....unless your looking for 2 xxl pieces of Texas toast for lunch). 

My only gripes about Eat is they have a selected breakfast menu that is only available until 11am (I am dying to try these chilaquiles) and I really wish they offered espresso based coffee drinks. But for those pancakes I will gladly spend 10 minutes rifling through 6th street looking for a parking spot. 

Also, they have an awesome outdoor patio with picnic tables set up. Perfect for a private event

The noise at lunch here left the most distinctive impression on me so I guess the food was good.  I had the arugula salad and a less than flavorful iced tea.  Everyone else enjoyed their food but we all had to shout at each other in order to be heard.  The best part of my experience was leaving.  Come when it's quiet and you might enjoy it more.

Ordered the biscuits and truffled egg sandwich. Delicious. Nice open kitchen and clean. Bring coins to park meters only.

Try it you'll like it

While I'm guessing this was a great option relative to LV, I'm not exactly wishing I could transplant this restaurant to Chicago. The truffle egg sandwich really was delish, though scant on the shrooms. The cinnamon cakes had a tasty berry coulis but were themselves pretty dry and lackluster. We ordered an appetizer of panko-breaded deviled eggs (very nummy), which came out 10 minutes after the entrees. At first it seemed like one man was our server, who was seemingly annoyed to be asked for almond milk with our coffee, and then it switched to a woman who was not much friendlier. Kudos to the hippie hostess who seemed to take her job seriously, though!

This place likes their food THICK! Thick toast, thick bacon, thick pancakes! Atmosphere is extremely fun and retro. I had to give 4 stars because I wasn't a fan of the "thickness" of my food. Service was excellent! Would definitely come back and try a lunch maybe I will like that food a little better.

If I could give this place zero stars I would. Bad service and bad food. The hostess told us it would be an hour to sit even though there were open seats. When they did try and seat us they argued about what name was listed as if we were lying to them. The waiter had an attitude, as if it was our fault he hated his job. I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was so disgusting. Floating in oil\/butter and topped with pico de gallo. Why would I want pico on shrimp and grits but they refused to remove it when asked. The other guests with me ordered pancakes that came out burned. There were several employees that looked like they were 16 and were confused about what they were bringing us. I could go on with more poor service we received, but you get the point. Terrible!!

What a awesome small local eatery 2 blocks away from the Fremont Experiencce.

Order the corned beef hash with poached eggs and sourdough. It's was so tasty. I'm not a fancy corned beef hash fan. I like the canned stuff, but his one was perfectly flavored and the poached eggs were cooked just right.

If you wanna get away from the standard casino buffets, stop by this place. You won't be disappointed.

As I was leaving, someone ordered the pancakes. I'm not even a pancakes fan, but the next time I'm in Vegas, I gotta try it!! They were so fluffy and enticing. Maybe this place will change my mind about pancakes.

I'll keep you Yelpers posted...

I was looking for a place to get a quick breakfast and Yelp directed me to eat. The name is interesting by itself, but the interior of the place is nicely intriguing as well. eat. is a small, clean restaurant with a 'young' vibe. I was seated quickly and ordered a pretty standard meal- scrambled eggs, bacon, and toast. Although it is a simple order, eat. managed to impress. The eggs were very smooth, the bacon nice and crispy, and the toast was perfect- it had a very 'homemade' flavor. In addition to the great breakfast, our waiter was very friendly and helpful.

A unique, simple, and tasty place to eat.

I went here on my first (and possibly last) trip to Las Vegas, and boy was it a welcome change from the mediocre excess of the Strip.  Well worth the trip Downtown (just make sure the cabbies don't rip you off, which they're better at doing than driving).  

We had the green chile posole and wedge salad and both were very tasty with high-quality ingredients. The posole had just the right amount of spice and had ample, good-quality meat.  Both portion sizes were very generous and appropriate to the price, which was reasonable. The service was quick, friendly, and attentive.  The decor of this place is refreshingly normal and clean-looking.  It's about the furthest thing you'll find from typical LV fare, which is tailor made for either poseur high-roller wannabes or smokers on oxygen tanks with no remaining sense of taste.  My only regret is that we didn't have the opportunity to try more dishes or come back for breakfast. If you're in Vegas, GO.

The exterior is more than a bit deceiving. It looks like an accidental restaurant fell into a motel, but don't let that fool ya.  If you don't know to ask about the chicken fried steak, then you are missing out! The pancakes are incredible too! The food is worth paying for parking and the cramped table space. Give it a shot! You won't be disappointed.
Best place to eat in Vegas. Might be the only place I eat in Vegas from on. Amazing food, great service, very friendly staff. Didn't expect this in the land of disgusting buffets and $10 prime rib!

I love Eat! I enjoy breakfast here often. The ¬†Huevos motule√±os, shrimp & grits, and pancakes are fantastic, I usually order the two eggs any style. They serve the best coffee from Mothership Coffee Roasters, and toast from Bon Breads. The service is mostly solid. The quality of food is pretty consistent. I take everyone I know and love here, which is the best endorsement I can give.

Quaint downtown location!  Non-touristy. Great decor and great service. 

I had the truffled egg sandwich and I loved it. I feel like I will never be able to eat "regular" eggs again, after having these.  

I had read other reviews about issues with refills, but we did not have this issue on our trip.  Our service, was fast and hospitable. 

I look forward to going again for the chicken fried steak.

I had been wanting to come here to 'eat' for over a year, and finally got my chance this morning with my business partner.  

I liked it.  The service was good, the food was tasty.  

My only critique was the menu which I thought was limited.  I know that is good for the owner, as it increases the profit margin (and I'm all for that) but I am not sure, I just felt it needed some omlettes, and other items to make it a real breakfast place.  It just might be me, but that is what I felt.

I would go back, and I want to try lunch next time.

I opted for eating here because my usual breakfast place is no longer open for business and downtown area is near my neighborhood. I was excited to try this little joint but wasn't wowed like most of the folks seem to be. 

The service was friendly, fast and accurate and the mood of the restaurant was very California hipster vibeish, which should be expected for a place like eat.

I had the 2 eggs, bacon and chive potatoes breakfast for $10 with $3 passion iced tea, my hubby had the huevos montelu√±os for $11 and $4 OJ and he was not too thrilled about the overwhelming flavors that weren't mixed in well. 

The main complaint on his part was that there were some bites that were too spicy and some that were too sweet, therefore the concoction didn't seem to pair off very well but he still liked the meal.

I on the other hand can't justify paying $10 for a mediocre breakfast. The portions were very small and it was nothing special. I would have liked to have ordered something different but there wasn't too much on the menu to choose from. So I opted for the simple, expecting that at least the size of the meal would compensate for the lack of wow factor.

I know about keeping the choices on the menu simple but this was just way too plain. So in a nutshell for me this joint was just okay nothing really special and not really sure I would recommend it but I also wouldn't discourage anyone from trying it out.

We went to check Eat. after the Breast Cancer Awareness walk and we were glad we did.  The menu was simple and made total sense.  We started out with the cinnamon biscuits with the strawberry compote.  I expected it to be sweet but it was just a tad sweet, so perfect.  Then I ordered the corned beef hash while my husband ordered the truffle egg sandwich, and my mother in law ordered the pancakes.  My favorite was the truffle egg sandwich.  It was just bursting with flavor!  Also, the chicken sausage was pretty darn good too.

I can't wait to return and try out other items.

At first I didn't really wanna order anything but like light snacks or something. The menu looks good but it's just menu was all about eggs and I'm pregnant, for some weird reasons, eggs lately make me puke just by the sight of it. Anyway, I tried the tomato soup full size, serving was pretty good. The food itself was awesome. My husband had the shrimp and grits, I dont usually eat grits but their grits are so surprisingly good. It was so tasty, full of chopped tomatoes on top and the shrimp you can see that they're really fresh.

I've been in search for a good chicken fried steak, and theirs is on top of my list. It's nicely battered and come with sausage infused gravy. All in all great flavor! Oh and their sourdough bread was amazing.. thick and fluffy. I would definitely recommend this place. Also check out the container park across the street!

I like Eat. I like the fact that it's modern, hip, urban, and located downtown. Charm, character, and frankly, they need more places like these downtown. Just across the street from Container Park and down the street from LVA (geez, where were all these places when I was a student?!). 

PARKING: There's metered parking galore for around $2 an hour during the daytime around here and DO NOT think you can get away without being fined. 

PROTIP: Get a player's card at El Cortez (free; takes two minutes) and you get to park for FREE at either of the manned parking garages (located at 7th and Ogden). Even when they charge $10 parking on Fridays\/Saturday nights now, it's free if you flash your card. If you suck at parallel parking like I do even for the after-6pm free street parking, then park in the garages (you don't have to worry about walking too far to get to Container Park or the Fremont East bars). 

AMBIANCE: Eat. is a cute breakfast\/lunch place. They're only open 8AM-3PM on weekdays and close an hour earlier on weekends. I like the decor and there's a ton of seating here for 2-4 people tables. Great use of space without feeling too cramped. There's a nice breakfast bar area near the cashier but I feel like it's a secret "oh-god-please-don't-pick-to-sit-here-because-you'll-just-stare-at-us"-type thing. Luckily there's another high table bar in the center that you can sit at. 

Hip, casual atmosphere. Fun place to meet with friends or a semi-loud business lunch.

FOOD: I ordered the chicken sausage, and the Chicken Pot Pie (they offer it every monday) Every other day than monday, they offer a special off-menu item so be sure to ask! 

I thought it was kind of funny listing "free-range chicken" at every mention in the menu. I wanted to ask my server for a profile of my slaughtered hen right there. You know, just to make sure it was a happy free-range chicken when it was living. 

Chicken pot pie ($14ish?) was good. Nicely seasoned with the right amount of mashed potatoes, gravy (dear god the gravy), carrots, slices of moist chicken, and peas inside. The pastry encasing it was fluffy, golden, and wasn't too hard biting into it. Comes with a small side salad of mixed greens and sliced carrots. Presentation was nice! Does it blow me away for what it is flavor-wise? Nope. Delicious, yes. Very well-thought out, but not wowing. Portion was decent, but not really worth the price tag. 

My chicken sausage ($5ish) side dish was okay. A bit tough, but the flavor was decent. Honey-soaked flavor. Tasted fine but not really worth the price for portion honestly. 

Service was good. Checked back on us often and our server recommended the pot pie to me. 

VERDICT: Overall, Eat is a few unique steps up from your average brunch place. Presentation of the food is gorgeous and the flavors are good\/okay, but the price tag? Ouch. Maybe it's quality of the ingredients that justifies it. The food isn't mediocre by any means, but it's not something stunning as I'm led to believe. It's a great place to reenact scenes from Portlandia. I would definitely come back for lunch with the girlfriends. I like Eat a lot, but I'm not drinking the kool-aid just yet.

This is a very refreshing option, away from the noise of the Vegas strip and it's tourists. Tried this place for breakfast on a whim and was not disappointed. The day's special was the breakfast burrito and it was a perfect mix of fresh and comforting flavours. The staff is great, the atmosphere is friendly, casual and refreshing.
Thank you for being off the strip but neighborhood was a little sketch. Food here was above average but not superb.
typically would have enjoyed this restaurant but todays experience was subpar in terms of customer service. i will never dine here again. ever.

As a local, wanted to try out a different place. The menu is very small, only a handful of choices, the space does not regulate sound well so it's very loud. The staff was very friendly, we did sit without water toward the end of our meal. We had the pancakes, fried devil eggs, eggs Benedict, and chicken fried stake. It was my first time having a bene and probably my last. not sure how the sauce is supposed to take but I didnt like it at all. My daughters pancakes were tasty, the bf didnt seem too impressed with his meal. The chive potatoes were good though. I gave it 3 stars for the prices and lack of choices. $4.00 for a glass of lemonade? Our meal with tip was $70 for 2 adults and 1 child.

After a couple of visits, I figured it was time to writ ea review. Both visits have come on weekends, where the menu is slightly different. The second visit was on a Sunday, when you don't have to dig for quarters to feed the meter.

I've now had the beignets, pancakes, Downtown Benedict (only available on the weekends) and Huevos Motulenos. All of the food has been outstanding. In fact, if I was rating this place just on the food, it probably would have been a five-star rating. The servers were competent, but nothing special. In fact, my coffee cup sat empty for long stretches on both visits. 

My real issue comes down to the lack of an overall "WOW" that I'd expect from a Downtown Project-invested business. First, when ordering today we were informed of a new policy that forbids substitutions on the weekend. Something as simple as swapping the sausage out for bacon or asking for eggs over medium instead of eggs over easy. The server even said he didn't want to submit it because he didn't want any more demerits. Second, when we went to pay, there was a note in folio that "when they are slammed" they only accept one credit card when checks are being split. Both of these policies will be enough to stop the casual diner from returning. Substitutions are a reality in the restaurant business and splitting checks among multiple credit cards is also commonplace. 

Finally, we did not receive a "warm fuzzy" from Chef Nat. She was there on both of my visits and, even though she wasn't working in the kitchen, never stopped by our table. In fact, on my most recent visit looked downright unpleasant until my wife said "have a nice day." 

Ultimately, the key to a great restaurant is great food and great service. They definitely have the food down. The service just needs to catch up.

This place is wonderful! The food is fantastic. The staff is very friendly. You can't really ask for much more. I had the blt and it was probably the best sandwich I've had in a LONG time. It's not a huge restaurant and I think that definitely adds to the charm. I'll be back for sure!

I was lucky enough to visit friends in Vegas area for a few days.  One of them knew I was a "foodie" and had a  (as she said) "PERFECT" spot for me.  MAN was she right.

Monday morning we took off to Eat. for breakfast about 9a.  For 9a, off the strip, on a monday- I didn't expect them to be so busy.  But they were hopping!  We were promptly seated and looked through the amazing menu.

I couldn't ask for a better send off meal.  I wanted to try everything - but stuck with the simple 2 eggs.  So good.  I am not a big bread eater.  Typically when my meal comes with bread - i take it or leave it.  However - at Eat. they do the bread in a skillet - similar to how you do a grilled cheese.  I devoured every morsel of bread.  Everything else was amazing too - but that bread.

I cant wait to go back to Vegas so I can visit again.

Hipster vibe, minimalistic decor, a menu with about 10 good breakfast choices.  Good option for a night after drinking.  Good sunlight, lots of windows, friendly staff, decent coffee.   Not as amazing as Bronze Center Cafe but I would go back.
One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  It;s always my choice when asked.  Great food, ambiance, and location.

3.5\/5

We came for lunch on a weekday. Wasn't too busy but service was kinda slow. 

dwBLTa - smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado, with chipotle mayo on a toasted sourdough. Bread was buttery and soft, bacon crisp and thick, but couldn't really taste the chipotle mayo. Potato salad was meh. 


Roast Beef - blue cheese, wild mushrooms, picked red onions, arugula, with mayo on ciabatta. Roast beef was tender and moist. The mushrooms were a great addition and added a nice sweetness. The bread was soft and warm. Satisfying sandwich. The fresh-still-warm potato chips were fantastic.

Chef Natalie has changed my life. Before I had her food, I had no taste. Now all other breakfast in Vegas is not worth the effort. Although off strip and small, this plave is worth the trek. Andy provided great service. Natalie knows how to make a mouth party. Praise Jesus, I'll be back on Sunday!

My June Vegas trip this year was not feeling like a getaway because of the lowsy HOT weather of 109 degree. But when my trust worthy yelp contact in Sin city highly recommended this place,  our trip became a memorable one indeed. 

Located in sketchy downtown, sits this corner restaurant surrounded with motels and run down apartments. 
Meter street parking for $1\/hr was a treat compared to California rates. 

Anyway, we were greeted fairly welcoming on a busy mid week peaking breakfast hour. We were seated right away.  And our server was pleasant and helpful in explaining their specials. 

We went with what we were craving. Screw the reviews, everything looked and sounded so good on paper.

We had their steel cut oatmeal sprinkled with cinnamon apple slices and walnuts. Sooooo good! Yes. Trying to be healthy here:) 

He had to order the chicken fried steak with gravy. May be not so healthy but actually very good. Cooked tender inside and a nice bite into the bird. Yum yum gravy btw! Right amount of light gravy and not thick just the way he likes it. 

I also ordered their pancakes. Straight up traditional pancakes.  And OMG! The BEST pancake i have ever tasted. It's fluffy in the middle and a little crusted on the edge and i can completely taste that battered pancake flavor. Love it!!!
Definitely an oldie and oh such a goodie!  Thank God they give huge portions! Because i ate it all!!! 

Eat will definitely be one of our MUST eat  next time we fly to LV again! 

# falling # in # love # again!

Pros:
Got seated right away on a Friday morning
Relatively friendly service (our server was not that great, but everyone else was)
Good variety on menu

Cons:
Food was just okay. Tried the truffled egg sandwich and the shrimp and grits. Truffled egg sandwich was good, but nothing amazing. Shrimp and grits were subpar. Bacon was soggy (who would put crispy bacon on the bottom of a bowl of grits? It's like, why even crisp the bacon at all?), shrimp was overcooked. Grits weren't seasoned well and were too watery. 

3 stars is a little harsh. 3.5 is more appropriate. Would I come back? No.

I saw this place in a magazine and decided to try it. I had the shrimp & grits and a pancake on the side (I love pancakes) awesome savory satisfying dish, only thing I didn't like so much was my shrimp weren't hot. Not a fan of cold shrimp but it didn't take anything away from the flavor. The best part of the meal was the PANCAKE!! Sweet Baby Jesus the pancakes are like manna from heaven! Better than any pancake I've had EVER IN LIFE and I've eaten a lot of pancakes. 

These pancakes were soooo delish, I had them 4 times that week... yes 4 times, i thought I was gonna need rehab. I believe they are laced with some sort of highly addictive drug and I mean that in the BEST WAY! I would eat these pancakes off the floor they are so good! I wanted to hugg and kiss the owner they are so good! I would fight my momma they are soooo good! I'm having withdrawal symptoms as I'm writing this review they are soo good!

If you're reading this, stop and go get some pancakes. Don't think just do it, i promise you your life will be brighter and filled with rainbows. They are soo good!
Truffle egg sandwich kills me every time. I haven't eaten anything there that I didn't really enjoy. Appetizers, breakfast, lunch, and even the juice.

Impressive and totally unexpected; a healthy, trendy, farm to table eatery in the sketchy confines of  Downtown Vegas.  

Serving only breakfast and lunch.  Short but well thought out menu that uses the same ingredients throughout.

Right to it, the fried to order beignets are phenomenal.  Crispy, lightly sweetened pillows topped with powdered sugar.  Eat them while they're hot, with the melting side of vanilla mascarpone and tart fruit jam.  Yum.  The egg white frittata filled with spinach, tomatoes, olives and feta is equally good.  Aggressively seasoned and not dry. 

For lunch, the "DWBLT" (smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and chipotle mayo sourdough sandwich) is vibrant and refreshing with a decent kick.  The grilled aged cheddar sandwich on sourdough with a fresh tomato salad a definite winner of a reinvented classic.

Good prices.  Friendly service.  

Hopefully the menu evolves with the seasons.  For now, a welcome addition to the blah food scene of downtown but by no means a destination restaurant.

Side note - Thank you Vegas yeep Leonel M. whose review made me break my self imposed, five plus year hiatus from town to eat at Eat.

The bf and I went in for our 'Valentine's Brunch' (the weekend following Valentine's Day) We waited no more than 3 minutes to be seated. The restaurant was filled with patrons but not in an overwhelming sense. We were seated at kind of an awkward table. It was a tiny table RIGHT next to a bar-like seating area. We sort of felt weird sitting in regular height chairs right next to people sitting on bar height chairs, but whatever. Definitely not enough to keep us away. I ordered a hot green tea (which was organic and didn't turn the water a lime green color, I hate that!) and the shrimp and grits. Boyfriend ordered their country fried steak and eggs with a side of pancakes to share.

Shrimp & Grits: SOoosososososoo delicious. I love the smooth texture of their grits  and the hints of crispiness from the bacon and pico de gallo. The shrimps (which they gave an abundant amount of) were cooked perfectly and the over-easy eggs they topped the whole thing off with gave the whole dish an extra creaminess that nobody can get mad over. They give you really big portion so I didn't end up eating the whole thing. Boyfriend didn't mind finishing it off at all :)

Country Fried Steak and Eggs (with seasoned potatoes): I had a bite of the steak and it was delicious. Not to much breading and the meat was tender. The gravy was perfect. Thick but not pudding-like. (gross)

Pancakes: The pancakes were sooooo fluffy and delicious. They had a yummy crispiness all around the edge and had a beignet-like texture and flavor to them. They soaked up the syrup like nobody's business so I suggest you do the 'pour and eat right away' method. 

The service was OK. Our waiter checked on us to fill up our drinks (once) but then forgot that I wanted more hot water for my tea. It's conveniently located right beside the container park so I could see us having breakfast\/brunch here again.

We specifically went downtown so we could have breakfast at Eat after reading the rave reviews on YELP. In all honesty, I have to agree with the glowing reviews. Great place to get some good comfort food downtown. It's a bit hard to find, but 5 minute walk off Fremont street. If you're downtown or heading down that way I'd strongly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch. This place has a menu that offers a broad selection from pancakes with chicken maple sausage, grilled cheese on Texas toast with tomato soup to a mozzarella caprese style chicken sandwich. Various side dishes are offered. The food was nicely presented and tasty. Tasty passion fruit unsweetened iced teas is available to whet your appetite. Come early or come late. Usually busy at mealtime. And yes there is counter to eat at where you can watch the creations being made. A pretty good way to start the day.
I also think that for the quality and quantity, this place has really good value.

Eat is FANTASTIC! I don't understand why they aren't open for dinner or why breakfast ends at 11am (on weekdays)....their food is so great I want it all the time. 

Highlights:
Huevos Montulenos: amazing breakfast\/brunch dish that feels relatively healthy. Basically a more exciting huevos rancheros with over easy eggs, two delicious salsas, black beans, feta, and bananas (they were a little surprising at first, but added an interesting element of sweetness).

Bahn Mi Sandwich--this dish is no longer on the menu, but it was super delicious and sometimes available if they have the ingredients in house. 

Downtown Benedict--classically amazing in every way. 

perk: super comfy seating. 

Don't order tea or orange juice, it's crazy over priced.

Aaaaaaamazing !!! Right on be corner, you've got to pay to park on the street but there's always empty spots. They sit you down as soon as possible, staff is amazing, food is bomb, comes fast and you can tell it was just made. 

Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great breakfast place downtown.

We arrived and the wait was out the door. Luckily our party of 13 wasn't in a rush:))). Had an opportunity to meet the owner during the wait. She guaranteed me that the wait would be well worth it. And boy was she right. Not one complaint from anyone in our group!!!

We went a few weekends ago with a fairly large group (6) and I am happy to report that the venue lived up to the considerable hype it has generated in the short time it has been opened. Although they were very busy the staff was friendly and accommodating. We all shared the beignets and they were great - an unusual menu item that stacked up the ones I've had at Caf√© du Monde (sp) in New Orleans. For my main entr√©e I went with the shrimp and grits and was very happy with my choice. The sauce, consistency and seasoning was a great blend of savory and spice. I was pleasantly surprised to find bacon strip buried at the bottom! Topped with an egg that you can break up and mix - this is a dish I will order again. There is a good selection of teas and coffee - which I had to top off the breakfast.

This place is lovely and definitely a go-to spot downtown. The service is always very friendly and helpful when ordering. The decor goes along with the new atmosphere downtown is trying to create: trendy with a little bit of vintage to it. Everything on the menu sounds good to eat. The service is always fast and the food is fresh. 

My favorite is the grilled cheese. It's enormous, and the bread is fluffy and perfectly toasted, and the cheese is good quality. I also enjoy the truffled egg sandwich if you feel for a breakfast mood. Both are completely satisfying and worth a try. My boyfriend loves to get the huevos motulenos. The combinations make it sound interesting, but the flavor is amazing. The waiters love to recommend to start off with the cinnamon biscuits, and I would, too.

While staying at the Bellagio was nice, I had to get off the strip to find a good, local, hole in the wall brunch spot. Brunch is my wife's middle name and she put this place at the top of her list. Great service, fun atmosphere, and amazing food.

Decided to grab some breakfast on Saturday morning, saw eat. On yelp decided to try it. Waited about 30 minutes but it was well worth the wait. Walked In and sat at the bar area, service was so fast and friendly feels like your family when your there. I ordered the eggs Benedict, and my boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak. We got to see the preparation, because we had seats facing the kitchen. The food was amazing and you get a lot of food for your money. Everything was so fresh and tasted amazing definitely want to go back and try other items on the menu. A must go if you are in the downtown area.

This place is awesome and just what I like...nice place, not too expensive, and offering food with unique twists\/additions than the usual or outright inventions. 

The coffee is awesome. Drink the coffee. I haven't eaten chicken fried steak in about a decade but that's what was calling my name. It seems like that is the biggest breakfast and just what I needed: a massive piece of chicken fried steak with sausage gravy dumped on top, plus some eggs, plus some potatoes, plus some mongo thick sourdough toast! Awesome! 

My frau got the truffled egg sandwich and I had a bite of that - delicious! We went on a Saturday around noonish with a party of four and were seated in about 10 minutes. No complaints about the service - everyone was nice and chipper.

We finally tried eat this past weekend and I'm sorry to say that I don't think the experience matched my expectations.

We came for brunch, and the brunch menu is different from the breakfast menu online so the truffled egg sandwich I wanted to order wasn't actually on the menu. :( Instead, I had beignets, which were just ok. They were moist and doughy, not the light fluffy texture I associate with beignets. There was a box of Cafe du Monde beignet mix sitting on a shelf in the kitchen so I guess maybe they use that? But the texture was unlike the real thing and not even like the ones I've made with the same mix at home. They were served with a really tasty jam that greatly improved the flavor, though.

I also found the coffee to be a bit weak, which is normally not something I would not even bother to mention, but I think it's important for a breakfast\/brunch spot to have great coffee.

My husband had a chicken-fried steak which I did not sample. I did try all of the accompaniments, though, and the potatoes, eggs and especially the toast were all pretty delicious. Maybe savory food is the way to go here!

Our waitress was pleasant if a bit scattered and we did get seated right away despite it being basically peak breakfast time. I am willing to give eat another shot- I hear that a dog-friendly patio is in the works so since we live, like, ridiculously close, we will be back, pug in tow, for weekday breakfast or maybe lunch when that opens up.

Food was delicious! The wait is insane but if you have the time then it's definitely worth it. We had the egg truffle sandwiches. The server offered us some extras like a side of avocado and I heard her offer extra cheese to someone at another table- she doesn't tell you these things are at additional costs. Other than that great place!

I remembered when I used to love this place. But over time it has gotten worse and I am only writing a bad review because after the first two times I came it was not a good experience. Let me start off by saying that at this point it is over hyped. The only thing I crave about this place is their pancakes. Previous time I came w\/ my mother we waited for over 30 minutes which is fine w.e. Our waiter seriously only checked up on us about twice and what made me so angry was that they gave us the check before our food even came out!!!! Are you effin kidding me? I let it go and didn't say anything. For some reason I felt like we were treated as minority's since everyone else in the room was white except us. I had their shrimp and grits and it was okay, lacked a lot of flavor. Today we went back with my family and waited for over an hour! The host kept seating people left & right instead of trying to hold a table for us since a lot of people came after us. I understand smaller parties get seated quicker but it was only 6 of us. Anyways we finally got seated and our waitress was great. Can't complain we were checked up on multiple times. But the food was not what it used to be. Very sad to say that I probably won't be coming back here again and deff not recommending it to others any longer.
Great service and exceptional food. I recommend the deep fried deviled eggs. The homemade jelly was also worth mentioning.

My friend took us out of towners into this local brunch spot for some much deserved chowing after a morning hike at red rock canyon. For a Saturday morning, the wait was manageable and there was plenty to explore in the area to make time pass quickly. All the menu options seemed incredible. We split fried deviled eggs, a twist on the classic I've never experienced. Needless to say they were fantastic. I had the truffled egg sandwich and the flavor was on point. I'm generally not an egg or egg sandwich person, but between the AMAZING bread, truffles, bacon and avocado, it was an egg sandwich like no other.

My husband and I decided to try this place on Sunday, April 19, 2015 based on Yelp reviews.  The food and the service were GREAT.  I had shrimp and grits and my husband had the Huevos Motulenos.  Both dishes were delicious and filing.  We kept looking at the food that others ordered.  It all looked tempting.  We will come again the next time we're in town and work our way through the menu.

Loved this place! Look beyond the neighborhood.  It's large yet cozy, great waiters and AWESOME food!  We all tried different dishes ranging from eggs to sandwiches to pancakes to oatmeal.  And EVERYTHING  was delish!!!!

honestly, I think this place is all hype. I WASN'T impressed at all. the service was crap. our server took our order by saying "ready?" didn't even greet us or introduce himself. and even after we got our food, he barely checked on us, just a casual "you good?" when he walked by. and he didn't even ask us if we were ready for our check, he just placed it on our table as if he was ready for us to leave. 

the food was just alright, nothing mind blowing. we ordered the cinnamon biscuits, shrimp & grits, and the shrimp po boy. 

I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon, sorry eat.

A nice, quiet spot to grab a good breakfast.  We ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and the Huevos Motulenos.  The food and the energy were good.  It is a little hard to find both the restuarant and parking.  Overall, a nice change of pace for a Vegas morning.

Overpriced and unimpressed. Ordered the chicken fried steak and oh so horrible. Worst piece of overcooked and underflavored piece of rubber I ever attempted to chew. And they didn't even serve it with a steak knife...poor butter knife tried but couldn't.
The place was crowded on Sunday AM and the host staff a bit unfriendly. Must of had a rough Saturday night.
Anyway, we won't go back.
Their shrimp and grits is OMFG good, but make sure to make a reservation before you go, or go earlier, it's gonna be so packed! :)) highly recommended

Cute, hipster joint to grab breakfast, brunch, or lunch. I came here for a Sunday brunch. We found parking on the side streets right away. There are other available parking spots nearby. There was a little wait, 25-30 minutes which was expected since it was featured on Anthony Bourdain's show.

Got the cinnamon biscuits in strawberry compote for an appetizer for four people. Our group ordered poached eggs over corned beef hash, Eggs Benedict with turkey bacon, shrimp & grits, & your basic American breakfast-eggs, bacon, toast, & pancakes. Our appetizer-I barely tasted any cinnamon. The biscuits were OK but thought the strawberry compote would be paired better with something else. However, the compote was refreshing and good. After having a sample of everyone's dishes, I like the shrimp and grits the best and the fluffy pancakes the second. I did not like the Eggs Benedict (who invented turkey bacon?) and my corned beef was not that great.

I thought the plates all had a beautiful presentation but many of the flavors did not come together for me. There were other items I would love to try but after sampling several dishes, I'm not in a hurry to come back here but not opposed to it if someone wanted to come here.

Service was good and we were constantly checked on but felt like they were trying to hurry us for the next table. Good for people waiting. I'm not one to linger after I finish eating so it wasn't a big deal.

It's hard to choose the amount of stars for this. The food was really good and our beverage server was super sweet! So as you read this you think, wow a five star review right here.....ummm NOPE!! Unfortunately it takes one person to ruin it ALL! That one person?? GARY! He was rude. Didn't introduce himself, came up to us and said "what?" when we asked a busser to get our waiter. He was then clearly rude to that poor girl - you could tell by body language. Anyways - this would be a 5 star, but GARY ruined it all!! I do not think that Gary should be in any customer service type of position! To the EAT Owners & Management - get rid of him!! He's not worth losing business or having bad reviews over!

This place is awesome. Great atmosphere. And the food is great! I got a basic two egg breakfast and it was all perfectly prepared. My boyfriend had the chicken fried steak and that was delicious a well. Service was wonderful. We never had to ask for water. Can't wait to come back another time and try lunch!!
Great food and Great Staff what more do you want from a place to eat? Chef is OUTSTANDING!!

We had the Chicken Fried Steak and it was delicious, the potatoes was a tad burnt on some pieces. The pancake was awesome and the Shrimp & Grits was Superb. I had the Ruben sandwich and it was perfect. I had to say that the bread were delicious. The only thing that was slightly upsetting was the amount of time to plaxe our orders, they sat us down but took almost 10 minutes to ask us what to drink, let alone say hello. On the other hand, after ordering, it took less than 5 minutes for the food to come out, and it was very large portions.The atmosphere was excellent and clean place.
Great service and great food.  Especially loved the potatoes that came with my eggs Benedict and the waffles were fluffy and tasty.  Finding a parking space is a bit of a challenge:)
If you find yourself in Downtown Vegas you've got to try eat!  Hippest joint in town!

My wife loves this place and it seems like other people do too! I didn't see what the hype was all about.

We were trying to get a table for 10. After a long wait (because it was extremely busy) we were taken outside in the patio. Well, the table didn't fit 10. The waitress simply didn't know how to count chairs. We had to wait again (15+ min) to get seated inside. 
After our meal, it took our waitress sooooo long to get our checks and to get us out.

I ordered pancakes, and sure there's not much to it but they were on the dry side. I had to drown them in syrup. 

This place wasn't bad but definitely hyped up. I'll try it again and order something different and hopefully the service gets better.

Fantastic breakfast! Went to breakfast on the main strip our first day, wish we came here first so we could come back! We started with the cinnamon biscuit. Four nice sized biscuits to share. A great start. I had the egg truffle sandwich, my husband had the chicken fried steak, dad had eggs benedict and my mom had the pancakes. We each had a little of everyone's and meal and all were excellent! Highly recommend this place to any and all.

I ate at Eat and it was delicious.  I tried everything because my family and friends all ordered different menu items.  I could not recall all the names of everything we ate;  however, I do recall a great meal for a great price;  most of Vegas is giant fast commercial in your face; yet, when you get to Eat, it is a calm atmosphere with great people.  Around the area of Eat is Old town and you can't go wrong spending time in this area;  moreover if you like Roulette go to El Cortez .50 chips, 2 $ min...you can take $20 and if you play your game right you will have paid for break fest at Eat !  The staff was as good as the food!   Sometimes if you are lucky the head chef and owner will be sitting outside just listening to comments to figure out how to make Eat even better!  ENJOY!

I had the truffle egg sandwich which was pretty tasty. Overall a pretty good breakfast. If you're staying at The Cortez it's a block away and worth the walk. For some reason I still think Bob Evans has the best bacon. BTW, I would have installed your security cameras for next to nothing. We could have bartered free breakfasts for my service.

I am so happy to have this place within walking distance. It is exactly the kind of locals place that I have been missing since moving to Vegas.

The menu is very creative and the food is really good. I'm not a meat eater so most of it is off limits to me but I am hopeful that they will offer more veggie friendly options in the future.

Some of the best pancakes we have ever had at a restaurant! Now, as for the rest of the food... everything was delicious and very well prepared. We were just passing through on a road trip and needed a place with a patio that was pet friendly as we had our little mini pig in tow. We were met by a wonderful staff all around. They were not only very sweet to our little pig, but just friendly people all around and really provided great service. Even met the owner and she was quite a wonderful lady and you can tell she has put a lot of love into this place. The menu is very accommodating to all types of eaters from vegan to meat eaters and they are very easy going when it comes to substitutions if you want a dish to suit your specific needs. They serve hearty portions with thick delicious bread on the sandwiches. Again... we got the pancakes for the table to share as just an afterthought and were shocked at how perfect they were. This place is a must try if you are in Vegas!

We specifically went downtown so we could have breakfast at Eat after reading the rave reviews on Yelp. In all honesty, I have to agree with the glowing reviews.
What a great place! The main section of the menu is only available until 11am (the second time we went, sadly, we missed the deadline). Both days there was a line -- a testament to the quality of the food. The servers were so friendly, efficient, and worked well together. The food was delivered quite quickly, was delicious, and came in huge portions.

On the first day, we sat at the community table to get seated quicker. We were seated with a couple from LA, who were in Vegas for a wedding. They said EAT was their favorite place for breakfast and they always eat there when they come to Las Vegas. They gave us some great suggestions of what to eat before they left. We started with their recommendation of the cinnamon biscuits covered in strawberry compote. They were even more delicious than they sound. Oh my! Then my wife and I split an order of The Huevos Motulenos, which consisted of two fried eggs w\/ red & green New Mexican chili, black beans, peas, feta, & saut√©ed bananas on a corn tortilla. Different, yet delectable. 

Before we were served our Huevos Motulenos the server asked if four new people could join our community table. Of course we said, "Yes", and soon engaged them in conversation, it turned out that one of the four was Tim Olyphant, the star of the TV shows "Justified", and "Deadwood". That was a great breakfast!

My reviews are usually some long rambling story. In light of my 100th review...I decided to catch up on my yelping to make eat lucky number 100 by keeping it 100. 

Upon reading the other reviews, I was still interested in eating here. Mainly for the hipsterism of it. However, the reviews about service...do not lie. We came in after stuffing our faces at donutbar. Who does that? Lol. We did and we are still feeling the chubby from it and this was a week ago. That's another review. Anyway, hostess seats folks infront of us, then seats us. Seating was quick, perfect. She wasn't rude nor was she anything near the good morning sunshine vibe I like to spread. No biggie.

We were a party of 4 that day. 2 adults with 2 minions.
We sat down, menu pages clipped to a clipboard... spiffy. As I scrolled through the menu I immediately get the I should've done a u-turn because nothing genuinely appealed to me and nothing on it was something my minions mouths could be entertained by. Now note....MY minions. So if you have kids and they're into such selection, don't go talking about my review and how there are plenty for kids. =P

It felt like we had forever minutes to go through our menu. I must've flipped those 3 pages as long as it takes to watch Titanic. Of course I'm joking, but you get the drift. I'm going to skip the fine details inbetween but by the time our waiter got to us, he seriously asked us if we needed more time. At this point, I had told my husband numerous times I am not feeling the vibe and I'm ready to exit to prevent anymore disappointment. The waiters didnt even look happy to be there, people are staring at their cellphones like they've been sitting through the Titanic movie for the 3rd time in one sitting.

I immediately replied, noooope, we are ready. Waiter seriously didn't even look at us in greeting form or just to connect. He was seriously distracted by something. He was taking our orders but looking up and around, as he was jotting it. Imagine your waiter not looking at you, looking around, looking behind his back like he is being chased, and is pretending to be a waiter until his assailants have passed by, then he can rip the waiter uniform off and be on his merry way. 

The meal took too long to come considering what we ordered. My husband had the half bowl posole with a stale piece of tortilla chip. He said the stale tortilla chip ruined the vibe. I side ordered their chive potatoe and scouts honor...a bowl of burnt potatoes were served. I don't know if there were garlic pieces in it or whatever...but they were burrrrrnt. Did I say anything? No. I was tired of waiting and our metered parking by then was down to 20minutes. Eat what wasn't charred and move on. I ordered the free range chicken sandwich and decided for the house chips. For the waiting time for our meal to what was serve...it definitely did not live up to what it looked. Chicken is supposed to be pan seared...but my chicken tasted more like pan seared in bulk just to reheat later. I didn't like that my chicken was a bit cold. Not to mention it was pretty bland. I had to open it to double check if the pesto mayo was even smeared in there.  Even their house chips were over cooked--abandoned.

Our server was MIA the whole time...which made everything about our experience here a reason to not return. I literally had to catch him as he was clearly planning on by passing us, failing to realize my husband needs an h20 refill. Just give us our check. 

I seriously walked out with regret. That says a lot. I never want to make negative reviews, but it is my quest to eat somewhere and decide what is true annnnd if I personally find it kid friendly.

Negative reviews on service....very true in my experience. My kids were the only kids there at that time. I didn't find the menu too kid friendly. But scope the menu ahead because I didnt. It's good to not be so planned in such a calculated world. I loved the decor and concept, and imagined it being a cute place to eat at with a friend or partner after a walk or something...just didn't live up to the hype or what I hoped it'd be.

Sadly, I won't return. Unless, a friend wanted to go. I always say give it a shot because my experience doesn't necessarily mean it'll be everyone's experience.

High chairs available with working buckles, yay. I'd leave the stroller in the car just to make it less of a hassle. 

2 stars is what the gut said to click. 
Just keeping it 100 for the 100th review.

A hidden gem just outside of Las Vegas - on the floor level of all things - a motel!  A little seedy from the outside, but that all dissipated when you walk through the door into a modern, chic diner.   They don't take reservations, but come early to avoid the wait.  We got there just before eleven on a Saturday and were able to be seated right away.  There was a bit of a wait (in 100+ heat!) by the time we left.

On to the food - in order of yumminess, BOLDs are HIGHLY recommended:

GRILLED CHICKEN SANDWICH on ciabatta - This was the highlight of the meal.  Stuffed with tomato and arugula, - warm, tasty, and fresh.  I would definitely recommend this.

BIEGNETS - SO yummy!!!  Probably best to share, since they really are just donuts, but so soft and warm, and perfect with the jam and cream.

SHRIMP AND GRITS - This was really good.  I can't even explain it - it really just looks like a bowl of runny grits with shrimp, but the flavor was superb. 

Huevos montunlenos - I know these are a big hit on Yelp, but maybe I'm just not a Mexican breakfast type of person.  I recognize that these had a good, spicy flavor with the salsa and tortillas cooked in, but just not my cup of tea.  Now, if you LOVE your Mexican breakfast, go for it!

Tomato soup - I agree with the other reviews - really salty.  We initially had wanted the tomato salad, but were told they were out and only had the soup, which we settled for.  Oh well.

All in all, a great meal.  My dad still talks about it weeks later.  Street parking was not too difficult.  And it's just down the street from where they shoot Pawn Stars, so you can spend a little time walking off your food perusing there!  :)   (did I just embarrass myself by admitting we watch that show so much that we recognized the shop driving by?)
What a great place in old downtown. Shrimp and Grits were awesome. Love the design on the inside.

I am utterly disappointed with my brunch experience at eat. Let's start with the food...

I ordered the eggs Benedict, which seems like a weekend special only (It wasn't on the menu). It was ok--I think the presentation was better than the actual food. There was a little too much hollandaise sauce and it tasted like any other eggs benedict; not a "special" if you ask me! The potatoes were good--it was due to the seasoning though...just the right amount of salt!

My friends got the corn hash, tomato soup and truffled egg sandwich. While the pictures all depict a salivating taste in your mouth, collectively, we thought otherwise. It was okay....I guess we were expecting more since the reviews had high ratings. But then again, we are from southern ca--the land of innovation and delicious food. 

Let's just move on to the part that caused me to give this establishment a 2 star rating: Customer Service. Coming into the restaurant, we had a 20 minute wait, which was reasonable for a Sunday. Upon sitting, they took our drink orders and brought it out fairly quickly. Our server took a while to finally take our orders and from there it went downhill. My friend got the soup and it came out first. Thus, we can assume our order was put in (since one person in our party got their meal). But nope! For some reason, the rest of the orders were "cut off" and the kitchen didn't receive it. After 30 minutes, our server still hasn't checked up on us (not even to refill our coffee and waters!) and I had to ask another server for our order. You could imagine how annoyed we were seeing tables paying for their meals...even though they were sat after us! Yep...pretty sucky! With 2 apologies and no compensations for the lack of error on their part, I would not come back to this, nor recommend it to others. There are better brunch places out there that are worth trying and I'd rather give those establishments my time for their service. Eat definitely failed me and my friends. While some people won't take my review into consideration, I hope someone from eat will look more into this to ensure it doesn't happen again.

This is a good place to eat. I've been here a couple of times for lunch. Always been happy with my choices. They serve healthy flavorful dishes. Last time I was there, which was Wednesday with my son. I tried breakfast. All I can say it was delicious. The toast was so yummy. The eggs were cooked to perfection and the hash browns crisp and seasoned just right. So next time your out for lunch at Eat don't be afraid to order breakfast!

I have been here a number of times and usually everything is just about perfect.

They are getting a 3 because the food is amazing...

The problem this time is the service has been beyond dysfunctional...a call for our name and table that never happened...35 minute plus wait times for food...an unbelievable amount of flies as we wait in the heat for our food..

And it's now just here...

More attention to detail makes a difference in the execution.

Love the food but don't like the dysfunction.

Let me preface this by saying that I've been to Eat many times.   The last 3 times I've been I've had an unfortunate experience.  The first two involved the seating.  When you have open tables and you have no persons waiting, instead of cramming us in the corner, give us an open table (4 of them).  The excuse I got was that they were reserved for 'larger' parties...more than the two in my party.   The second time was almost the same exact experience. 
Today, it wasn't about the searing, it was about the food.   I ordered the two eggs breakfast and my girl ordered the pancakes.  The pancakes are delicious.  Today, they weren't as crisp, but still good.  My breakfast was not up to standard.  I ordered my eggs over-easy.  They came runny and the toast was cold. I table next to us also had a problem with the eggs.  That gentleman ordered the corn beef hash.  He waited for his eggs as long as I did (9 minutes).  As I waited, I nibbled on the pancakes.  I also ordered an extra egg with breakfast.  
So, when the check came, my meal was full price.  I was also charged for the extra egg ($2).  I never complain about the cost of food, but when the order is messed up, it should be corrected on the bill.  It never was.  Maybe cover the cost of the drinks ($3 each) or the extra egg.  Even a discount (maybe 50%) off MY meal.  I'm not looking for free. With so many options living downtown, why would I go back to a spot where they don't take care of the customer?  
I give the waitress props (Christina) because she was obviously perturbed over the problems.  Gary (I think it's his name), that consistently made sure the coffee and water were filled, deserves props too.  
I'm hopeful they read the reviews and respond to my concern.

Every time we come to Vegas this is our first place for breakfast! It's near Fremont Street and I love the menu!  there is nothing on the menu that isn't worth trying.... but please, I do miss the crepes!  Bring them back

Just had breakfast with my boss here and the breakfast was very tasty. I had the spicy eggs with tortilla and banana. The atmosphere is nice. Even though they only had 1 waitress waiting on people and pass by us twice forgetting our toast. She was not that attentive to us. Yet I will most likely go back.

Perfect spot downtown for breakfast or lunch!  We enjoyed the beignets and then the shrimp and grits!  Amazing food incredible service!  Hip and beautiful space!  I can't wait to go back and try more!

Great spot! We go here for brunch all the time. Service can be slow and forgetful at times, but the food is always solid. The live music can be too loud, but it is still definitely the best brunch place downtown. The beignets and pancakes are always great.

If you eat at one place in Vegas, make this the place.  Went there for breakfast, and had about a 10 minute wait......no big deal.  After being seated and given menu's I noticed a woman that was bussing other tables.  She came over and greeted my wife and I and introduced herself as the owner.  WHATTTTTTT!!!  The owner is bussing a table, I was impressed and I told her that.  Next up the food.  PHENOMENAL is an understatement. Even the chef came out to refill our water glasses, not sure if this is a new concept but I have never experienced this type of service and I loved it!!!!  Every time I visit Vegas I won't leave until I dine here.   INCREDIBLE dining experience.

This is a must-go place for me in Las Vegas. The service is great and fast and the food is so good. The deviled eggs are totally amazing, although they're rather heavy so don't be surprised if you can't finish your entree afterward.

Bad attitude and bad policy overrides any kind of food here. No coffee while waiting - that's a first at a brunch place. Curt responses to EVERY question with a bit of pretentiousness that makes me say, "What did I do wrong?"  Perhaps Vegas is not used to brunch culture.  I cannot recommend this place unless you wanted to be treated like you're not welcome and they don't want your business.

My boyfriend and I went here for brunch last Sunday and it was delicious. It seemed very busy but they sat us down in about 15 minutes. I was a little disappointed they didn't have mimosas, but that was my own bad for assuming and not checking. 

I had the frijoles and they were pretty good. They could have had a bit more flavor, but hot sauce helped out with that. My boyfriend had the truffled egg sandwich and said it was delicious.

All in all, it's right next to the Downtown Container Park and it's a fun little area to walk around in. 

Last but not least, they had the Toys for Tots drive going on when I was there and it was really cool to see all the toys they were able to take away!

Fun and yummy - but a lot of large carb portions on and with the dish and my tofu scramble was the smallest thing next to my TOWER of
Toast and 2lb potato side! Coffee is delicious and pancakes pretty good too.

Not really sure what the big fuss is about with this place. It's not bad really, but nothing to write home about. Usually the line is out the door for this place, but this time we were lucky and got seats at the kitchen bar top. We ordered a chicken sandwich and a breakfast sandwich (not sure what it's actually called). Both were decent, but really nothing exciting. My tomato soup was lukewarm and pretty salty, I couldn't have any of it.

Our server was super sweet and despite the hustle and bustle, we were well attended and she always made sure our coffee was full. Cute restaurant and all, but the food just wasn't quite there. In addition, the chef looked super stressed out and unhappy being there, which seemed like it made the rest of the staff unhappy. It's interesting watching all that while sitting at the kitchen bar top. 

Overall, if there's no wait here and you're hungry, stop by. But there are plenty of other options in the area that serves much better food.

Brought my family here for my wedding weekend. We had large party with separate checks.  Service was great and everyone enjoyed their meals.  I had the shrimp and grits some of the best I ever had.  I highly recommend this place

Let me start this by saying that I'm not the biggest fan of Vegas in general.

A few friends and I stopped through on the last leg of a 10 day road trip for some much needed R&R--yes technically the road trip was supposed to be the R&R but something about driving 2000+ miles warrants a fun night somewhere.

After the debauchery had taken place, we needed something to eat. One of our group had been here once before, and highly recommended it.

I ordered the chilaquiles and was not disappointed..We all had some great coffees, and good conversation.

It was nice to be able to walk off the main strip and find a nice, calm, place to eat, with quality food.

I would definitely go here on my next trip to vegas.

This is my second visit. I just had the Huevos Motulenos, and it was exquisite. If I had to guess it's origin, I'd say Cuba (but maybe somewhere in Central America, because people tend to liken Cuban foods with blandness). It was an unlikely mix of eggs, black beans, PEAS, and saut√©ed bananas. Crazy, right? Well, it worked! 

I should have asked for more tortillas. It was a shame to let that salsa and yolk return to the Earth. One of the reasons I made the decision to come back was that the coffee and juice are fresh and definitely on point. Didn't need to add anything to the coffee, so that says a lot. 

The only reason that I didn't rate all five stars is that there is no free parking (Downtown blues, ugh) and they open at 8am. It's hard to consider it an actual breakfast place when it opens halfway into breakfast time. ;) 

Great job, guys! I'll be eating at eat again, that's for sure.

Let me begin with this...if you like deviled eggs you MUST try the deep fried deviled eggs! They were the best little piece of heaven I had in years. The egg whites  are fried perfection and the filling is topped with a bacon and tomato chutney essence. I am a fan of Cracker Barrel style pancakes and this is the first place in Vegas that I have had the  fried edged griddle style cakes! They were awesome. There was a 30 min wait but container park is directly across the street and made the time go by. You must check this out for a brunch option.

Wow, today's lunch was a disappointment...

After eating here for lunch once before, I couldn't wait to come back.. and today was the day. 

Went with coworkers and couldn't decide between the BLT or the Banh Mi Chicken, 
Our waitress suggested the Banh Mi and said it was delicious and a bit spicy.. Yay.. bring it on.. I love Banh Mi, and thought this will be a great little twist with chicken.
NOT at all what I expected. The chicken was pounded flat, fried and chewy, almost as though it was leftover from last week and reheated. The chicken was hot, so when put on the sandwich bread it wilted the vegetables. They were not crispy and there was no spice. The bread was also overdressed. 

The homemade chips are some of the best I have ever had... crispy, and lightly salted for great flavor.   

The service was friendly and fast. 

Not going to let one sandwich stop me from going back,.. Looking forward to another lunch. 
Oh, if you're going to discuss any business during lunch, forget it..a great selection of music plays, but it is loud.

First time here.. It's a really cute brunch spot located downtown. I loved the decor and the overall vibe. The food and coffee was delicious. The service could be a little better but they do get very busy.

CHICKEN
FRIED
STEAK

That's all you need to know.  Chicken fried steak is my go to meal for breakfast and it is what my personal mission in life is.  This high quality chicken fried steak is my personal choice for THE BEST on the west coast.  It is crispy on the outside, thick and juicy on the inside, and is seasoned perfectly.  It is not a frozen reheated hockey puck, but a handmade beautiful heart stopper.  
I will confess, I don't remember what my wife had because I was so stoked about my meal, but she said it was good.

I like Vegas a lot, and I am so thankful (and sad) that my search is over for the perfect chicken fried steak!

Eat. is a short walk from the main strip in Downtown Vegas. 

Everything we tried was fresh and tasty and a great mix up from the food at the hotels and chain restaurants. 

There's also a cool little shopping and restaurant hub across the road made from shipping containers with a kids playground in the middle.

This is one of my favorite places to eat and take friends! The inside is beautiful and comfortable. The location is right in the heart of downtown and across from Container Park. I have taken a few friends here and they have taken their friends here after their first visit.  The menu is so creative and delicious. Try it for yourself. 

PROS: Shrimp & Grits
             Killer Grilled Cheese
             Eggs Benedict
             Coffee (it's a special label)

Good food, decent service and yummy toast.  I know, toast.  But it was the highlight of the meal and really made everything else that I ordered for breakfast yummy.  The wait was a little long due to the fact that the place was small, but it was worth the wait.  I will recommend that they do a better job of cleaning the silverware, but other than that I really liked this spot!

This place is probably one of the best places I ate during the 4 days I was in Las Vegas. It's a little off the beaten path, 2-3 blocks from Freemont and off the Strip in general but this place was PACKED on Saturday morning. I came in a group of 6 people and we were told it would be about a 20-30 minute wait; no big deal to us since the place looked very busy. When we did sit down our waitress was super friendly and we got our drinks quickly; the sparkling strawberry lemonade was possibly the best lemonade I'd had on the trip. I got a Chicken Fried Steak and I have to say it was the best one I've had at a restaurant ever. The gravy was what you want in a gravy; those superb lumps of bacon\/sausage with that peppery bite. The steak was cooked to perfection, tasty on the inside and well seasoned with an awesome amount of crunch on the outside all served on top of eggs and potatoes. The potatoes were perfectly cooked, soft on the inside and that golden sear on the outside. Waitress was super friendly and had a great sense of humor! The wait for the tables in a big group is worth is 100% and if I ever go back to Las Vegas this is definitely on the list of places I would eat at again.

Do not order the arugula with 2 pieces of asparagus. The salad is super lame, with the whole extension of the word. This salad is so boring, this is how i can describe it: bowl of 95% arugula with 2 pieces of asparagus, 2 cashews and about 3 tomatoes with the minimum amount of Parmesan cheese shavings. For the price, omg, not worth it just don't get it. I finished my bowl of arugula within 3 minutes. Also my "server" Roberto, didn't even help me at all. A black girl really nice helped me out with questions, grabbing my drink, and taking my order, while -----Roberto(0 stars)---- was supposed to be my server he didn't even check if the food was right, how anything was, nothing, all he did was drop off the check and run my card. Just ask for another server when you go there. Also, this might not be the place to get salad but for having only two salads in the menu, they need to step up their game. Id give the restaurant 1 star but I'm doing 2 because the rest of the staff were very nice and happy and the place look nice and clean. I might give it another chance and order a sandwich since i come to Vegas about 10-12 times\/month, but I might just also go somewhere else for salads. Sorry my review was long but I had to get my frustration out of my chest. Kuddos!

Went in for brunch and I did enjoy it. I don't think it was amazing but it was good. The only problem was waiting in line for 40 minutes for food that was just average. Not sure I would come back especially with the lack of finding parking spaces nearby.
YUM!  What a cute little place in Downtown LV!  For breakfast I had oatmeal with brown sugar, pecans and apples...so good and healthy!  This is a great place to meet a friend for breakfast or lunch.

Best breakfast spot in town. The menu is straight to the point, not to limit your choices, but to assure you that every item on the menu was created with care. I personally LOVE the pancakes and the grilled cheese. I've never had better pancakes before. The grilled cheese is served with huge slices of the most delicious and thick bread and a fantastic tomato soup. I'm honestly getting hungry just typing this. 

The owner takes her job very seriously. You won't find a rude waiter in the place, and she makes sure of it. She's always around making sure things are running smoothly no matter how busy it gets. And trust me, those pancakes really do draw a crowd.

The food at eat. is fantastic. The food, even despite the fact that it's a little pricey, might get 5 stars by itself. 

My issue with eat. however, is how unwelcome I feel when I go there. I work nearby and have stopped by for lunch on a handful of occasions, never really loving the service, but my visit yesterday was the last straw. First, our table was given away after the hostess failed to step outside to call my name (the waiting area inside was full). Second, our order was never put in by the waitress and it wasn't until another server checked on us 30 minutes later that the food was finally prepared. Finally, when the food did arrive, one of our orders was wrong. At that point, we had both already gone over our allotted lunch hour, so my companion gave up and just ate what she had received. 

The server who noticed we never got food did apologize for the issue, but the original waitress who took the order never bothered to come by to apologize. Over an hour and half after our arrival we finally paid and left. I'll probably avoid going back with co-workers in the future - I can't keep taking such long lunch breaks. And I can't justify paying so much on a lunch at a place that doesn't seem to appreciate my business.

My sister and I had lunch here 5\/24\/13, it was very good.  I had the Chicken Posole and side salad. The soup was absolutely the best tasting soup I've ever had - ever! My sister had the Tomato & Grilled Cheese combo - these were good also.  

It was pretty loud in there, at times hard to hold a conversation.  Some people say good for kids, but I disagree, seating was close together and no softness to keep the noise levels down.

Wait staff was great and helpful.  The location is off, but the food is worth it for sure! I will be back next time I'm in town, hoping to make it for breakfast!!

Very nice brunch setting, I ordered the pancakes, felt like something was missing though... Would have paired perfectly with 3 eggs and potatoes
Overall good visit, would likely come back

No complaints here! Accommodating and friendly staff. Delicious food. Loved the eggs benedict and the pancakes which my friend described as "life changing" lol. They were very very good. Worth venturing off the main strip for real good food.

Wow. DELISH. I'm writing this NOT ONLY because I'm hard core procrastinating on doing the writing I'm SUPPOSED to be doing right now, but because that truffled egg sandwich was amazing. And I had a sparkling strawberry lemonade. That's the first non-alcoholic drink I've ordered in an establishment since the Reagan administration. PLUS good service. See why I had to take the time to write a review? This isn't slacking. This is important news.

My first time at Eat. was yesterday for brunch. This place was amazing! I had the roast beef sandwich with chips as a side. My friends had the truffled egg sandwich, eggs with bacon and potatoes and we all shared an order of the strawberry\/cinnamon biscuits. Everything was delicious and extremely filling. The service was great, the restaurant was very clean and in a good location- We then visited Container Park and walk around Downtown. The only thing I would like is for them to serve their breakfast all day long!
