We took a cab from LVH to downtown Las Vegas to check out "eat - the breakfast & lunch joint". A few of our friends had checked it out the day before. It has a relaxed industrial vibe. I particularly like the light fixtures. But the overall feel of the place is cool without pretentiousness. 
We had a chance to eat at the bar which looks into the kitchen. From this vantage you could see the chefs hard at work creating great food. On our visit Chef Natalie was sitting at a table doing admin work near the bar, but even though she worked on these paperwork duties, every dish still went out with her keeping a watchful eye on quality. She would occasionally banter back and forth with the chefs and comment about how they garnished the meal. The waitstaff was professional and friendly and checked on our needs throughout our meal without being obtrusive. 
As for the food, I got the Huevos Motulenos - two eggs over easy with red and green chili, black beans, peas, feta and sauteed bananas on corn tortilla. And Rachel got the Mediterranean Egg White Frittata - Spinach, tomatoes, Kalamata olives, feta and micro-basil with whole wheat Toast. We were both very happy with our orders. 
I liked the sweet and spiciness of my dish and I thought the peas added a great texture and flavor. I would definitely order it again. Rachel really liked how the spinach inside of the frittata was cooked so that it still had texture. The feta on top of the frittata was flavorful, and the olives had a good brininess but didn't over power the dish. She thought each bite had a good combination of flavor and it didn't need any extra seasoning.
Our meal including fresh ground coffee was about $24 (not including tip). Considering the breakfasts and lunches we had at LVH, we thought the price was comparable if not cheaper and the food was a billion times better at eat. Even with the extra we paid for the cab ride, to us, it was worth the trip to get amazing food.
Eat has only been open for about 7 months and I hope that they have continued success. We only get to Las Vegas about once a year and I really hope to get a chance to check out the rest of their menu. We would eat every breakfast and lunch here each time we come to Vegas.

From a chefs point of view, I can't think of a more inspiring breakfast and lunch eatery in town.  If I new nothing of chef Natalie, but by fresh ingredients she's has selected for her menus would be enough. Her knowledge yet complex approach to simple food has all of her patrons feeling at home. If your rolling stag there is a great table over looking the kitchen, known as the community table. Its a great place to sit and reflect on the dish of choice while striking up conversation with a total stranger.  Whether, you just rolled out of bed or a local construction worker, student, or a suit wearing business professional. Your sure to be at home.  Try the truffled egg sandwich.
Great staff, warm and welcoming, food was fresh and came out quick.  can't really complain .

I have to say with all these excellent reviews I expected better.  The staff here was super friendly and that I have no  complaints about. We were helped in a timely manner, placed our order quickly and even our food came pretty fast. The place wasn't super busy though so no real surprise there. 

The food was the disappointment here. My server said the grilled cheese and tomato soup combo was just okay even though the host told me it was awesome. I should have listened to him because I honestly was not impressed. The soup was watery and didn't taste like a homemade tomato soup. The "grilled cheese" which was too huge to even fit in your mouth was covered in butter...gross. I actually got it with eggs and turkey bacon to try and make it more of a full meal. To be honest it was okay, nothing I couldn't make at home though.

Overall I would say my experience was average and probably would not run back for multiple reasons. No free parking-you have to pay to park to eat here, no validation what so ever. Plus the food was just average, nothing blew me out of the water here. The staff was quite nice to deal with but that is not a reason to come back to a place wouldn't you say?

Best Pancakes I have ever had....

I could eat their pancakes without any syrup....it just melted in my mouth, and I would go back here (before 11AM) just for the pancakes.

The place reminds me of CowFish (in Charlotte, NC), so the atmosphere is pretty cool.  It is in a strange location in terms of the area, but do not be fooled, it is very nice on the inside.

Never had a chance to get lunch here, but I see no need for that, as I have already found their superstar menu item.
The truffled egg sandwich and cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compost is some of the best breakfast items I've ever had!

While visiting Vegas we were looking for great, local eateries... places off the strip, away from the tourists and the nasty attitudes of those who cater to the masses (who don't seem to care as much about great food and service and really only want a huge buffet.).
We came across Eat. and saw that the rating was in the top 20 of over 4200 restaurants in Vegas and just HAD to try this place... we were soooo happy we did and can't wait to go back for more on the next trip!

Upon entering, it's got a unique look and feel, like a kitchen and dining room.  The staff was all very happy, smiled and gave great service.  Restrooms are clean!!

The menu is AMAZING!  What I did was look around, quickly saw the Reuben that someone was eating and said I wanted that!  Otherwise, I'd still be sitting there trying to decide, because the menu was THAT GOOD!

We also tried their soups, the green chile chicken posole and the Black Bean Chili.  Both were very nice, but that green chile chicken posole blew me out of the water!  The many fresh flavors coming together in that soup were truly AMAZING! WOW!  

The Reuben was one of the BEST I've ever had!  The corned beef on it was perfectly done, but the bread knocked it out of the park!  It was a HUGE, THICK and SOFT coupling of rye that resembled sour dough in it's softness, texture and size, but tasted 100% like a grilled rye - it was AMAZING!  The perfect amount of condiments were also on it, to include their amazing house-made sauerkraut!

The arugula Salad was very nicely done... lots of fresh veggies, greens and great flavors all coming together in a salad bowl - get it with chicken on top!

In all, this is an extraordinary experience... one that'll leave you wanting more!  
EAT HERE!!!

Was excited to try this place.  It is in a weird spot with pay street parking.  I looked at it and thought are we at a crummy motel converted to apartments. Indeed it is on the corner of a cheap apartment. The place was fun and quirky inside and very busy. We went for lunch.  They had a very limited menu.  I opted for the grill cheese. It was huge and I mean huge. Talk about carb load. The bread was delicious soft and perfect texture. I could only eat one of the humongous slices the tomato soup was just okay tasted like tomato sauce with very little seasoning.  My hub had the chicken fried steak which was very tough and peppery  all in all I was not impressed with this place maybe we chose the wrong items. Our Neal total was 40 bucks. Too much.
AMAZING PLACE and the portions of the plates are great! Definitely recommend and also recommend the DevilEggs.

Stumbled across this little gem on my weekend get away to Vegas and i gotta say my only regret is.... Not taking a picture of my food before feasting lol. But what can you say after a long night of partying your stomach gets the best of you.
Their BTLA with the chipotle mayo is absolutely PHENOMENAL
with a side of their famous spiced potatoes and its heaven on earth.
The only disappointment were the their house made potato chips. Delicious but they have so much salt that it takes away from the taste. 
That aside will definitely go back to eat here on my next visit.

Just had brunch here. The food was good. The service awful. We were put on the list and told it would be a half hour. A half hour comes around and it seems like they let everyone even people that came after us seat first. There was this really rude blonde waitress with tattoos and some guy with dark hair that made it seem like they were put out to split our check. Will not be returning.

WORST PLACE TO EAT EVER! I don't understand how as an owner you think it's okay and very professional to tell a customer that it's just personal preference if you didn't like what you ordered?! No it's not personal preference if the food was nasty!

But let's start from the top. When we arrived it was a short wait. 20 mins for a party of 4. No problem. We ended waiting about 15 mins if that.

We get sat and our drink order taken. So far so good. The sprarkling strawberry lemonade was decent. Would get it again.

And then it went all down hill from there. Our server was very rude and short. Had no personality. How do you expect to make money with that dry personality?!

The food.....was just okay. Nothing special or out of the ordinary. Our two friends took maybe 2 bites of the oh so famous best seller shrimp and grits and didn't eat anymore. Said it was tasteless and nasty. So much for top selling dish huh?! 

Then the bill came. Wwaayyy to expensive for what we got. Nothing was too notch nor worth the price.

In the end we will NEVER return to Eat. Nor will we be sending any business there. Stay far away and go elsewhere for better food, better service and better owner!!

Visited Eat around noon for brunch. There were two of us and we had to wait 20 minutes for a table, which we thought was ok. We put our names on the list and waited outside where there were some benches on the sidewalk. While waiting we looked through the menu.

When it was time for us to be seated, the helpful greeter inside called my name loud and clear both inside (I heard it, even though we were outside) and then they came outside too! Great service for this part.

We were seated quickly and someone came to take drink orders right away. Coffee here was average, but there were other options like lemonade and many teas in the selection.

The menu is pretty standard food for a brunch spot. I ordered the corned beef hash, but it came as meat cubes, not hash. The poached eggs were average and presentation here is clearly not important. While the food tasted OK, it was not outstanding or memorable. There's no reason to wait in line for this.

Service was prompt, but I was surprised that nobody offered water for our table. Just bring water - it's the most basic thing humans need after air. Bring it, or at least offer it. 

Overall this place feels rushed and driven by turnover. It's clean and the food is OK. The servers are friendly, but they are moving fast and that is their main focus.
The food was not all that.  The customer service was just okay. Don't get what all the rave is about??

Had a chance to drop by here the Saturday after Mother's day. I'm guessing since everyone had been out to eat the week before it was less crowded than usual. Parking is metered (boo!) but there was plenty of it across the street and in the surrounding area. The ambience is very hipster, but also casual. 
There was a big selection of food for brunch (although I do not think I saw anything vegan- I would call and check first) and there were NO CHANGES allowed to the menu. I don't know if this is all day, or just a brunch thing. For someone with allergies I would call ahead. The deviled eggs are apparently very popular and deep fried. I can vouch for their cinnamon biscuits, which are basically bisquick biscuits (to me) with some cinnamon and fruit preserves on top, the latin inspired eggs with salsa, beans, and bananas, and the ABLT sandwich. All were delicious. 
Service was quick and friendly, but not overly so. It is obvious, but not unfriendly obvious, that they are trying to turn tables very quickly. Food comes out in 5-7 minutes and the check comes not soon after. If you are looking for a leisurely brunch this is not the place. There were no lines but I imagine on heavy days the fast turn around is nice for people who don't want to wait in line a long time.

Just met Natalie. Like this place!

The food was decent here but the service, decor and vibe made up for it pushing me to give it a 4 star. 

Natalie is the owner and she is awesome. Probably go back for her and the good tunes.

Stopped in one Saturday, with the wife.  Pretty cool setting as they continue with reclaiming of Downtown Las Vegas Project.  Order the Shrimp and Grits and Strawberry Biscuits.  In keeping it honest, everything was truly delicious.  My only ding, is I personally though the Strawberry Biscuits sauce, could have been a bit sweeter.  Besides that, things were spot on.  We got there at around 9am.  Lucky too, because as we were leaving (around 9:40AM) that front door was swinging.  Speaking of front door.  Nice touch on the wording as you exit: ATE!

Nicely played.  We will be back.

I'm like a pig in s*** when a new place opens up downtown for lunch.  Granted, this place isn't BRAND new but still, I was one happy girl!  First off, location can't get better. There's plenty of parking which saves me a headache.  Unlike Le Thai or that awful "La Comida," you don't have to walk several blocks. The decor is adorable and the music is awesome. Just an all around great atmosphere and the staff is super friendly.

Now to the food- This place has the BEST chicken caesar salad in town!  Its amazing...sliced chicken breast, shaved parmigiano, real bread croutons, and a tasty dressing. The arugula salad is a close second. Chef Nat's version of the shrimp po boy is delicious as well.  Its healthier than a real po boy (Lola's still has the best) but its definitely legit.  And let's not forget the green chili chicken posole.  Its a MUST try!  I'm latin and love a good posole and Nat's version is pretty f****** amazing!  Oh yes, and last but not least, the passion fruit iced tea!  Love.

I'd give this place 5 stars if it wasn't for one thing.  They supposedly do not take rezzies.  Funny, every time I walk in I see "reserved" signs on several tables. Its quite annoying but I take a sip of the yummy iced tea and all is quickly forgiven. :)

I had the deviled eggs and the shrimp "po'boy".  The deviled eggs are good and unique, they deep fry the white part and then put the yolk on.  Really good but not worth  $8.  The shrimp "po'boy" was tasty but not a po'boy. The tomato was soggy, the were hardly any shrimp, the bread was wrong.  It tasted fresh but I wouldn't call it a shrimp po'boy by any means.  Not worth $14 either.
Incredible food, enjoyable vibe, pleasant staff, timely service. Loved the art. Loved the seating. Loved it all. My eggs were cooked perfectly. Go.
Service is so great here. Food was also excellent, had the Eggs Benedict and my friend had the chicken sandwich. I will definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

I am back to only going to places like this. Chef owned and the chef is there not a place they just put their name on. 
   Now I was amazed right from the beginning the vibe this place has is perfect the wait staff professional and the food just perfect. The Chef Natalie Young has found the perfect place for her food and has done a great job putting it all together. Can't wait for the outside seating. I had the Chicken Fried steak with potatoes,eggs and toast and everything down to the toast was perfect. She puts her love into this place and the food and it shows.

Located across the street from Container Park. Metered parking for certain hours of the day. My friend and I came here pretty early on a Sunday morning (~8:30am). We were seated promptly and greeted within a few seconds by our waitress who brought waters over for us. 

A few moments later she came back to take our orders; I ordered the Truffled Egg Sandwich with a coffee and my friend ordered the Shrimp and Grits. Both meals were not only delicious, but super hearty also. The Truffled Egg Sandwich was ON POINT. I'm always nervous about the bread to filling ratio, but this was perfect. Breakfast sandwich dreams are made of! I would try to recount what deliciousness was in the sandwich, but I think I was so sleep-deprived that I couldn't recall. It also came with a hearty side of breakfast potatoes. My friend's Shrimp and Grits were also pretty tasty. It's served with thick cut bacon on the bottom, topped with a runny egg, and an optional side of toast for dipping (this toast was more like Texas toast and not standard bread). 

Service was great, food was great, coffee was great. All in a great day in DTLV.

Shrimp & grits & a shrimp po boy. Believe the hype people!! Would've done 5 stars but service kinda lagged altho it wasn't super busy our waiter left our drinks empty for a awhile..but food is 5 stars for sure !

Drove here today very hungry and had to wait 30 minutes. I would have to say it was not the kind of food that would get me to come back again. It was just ok, especially when you have to wait and you leave not safisfied. I'm giving it 3 because the only thing I really enjoyed was there coffee that they make there.

Downtown Las Vegas treasure! So happy to try it! We had the chicken fried steak (my husband tries this everywhere and says it was pretty dang good- his top 3) and the eggs any style were good, but what makes the entire dish is the smoked bacon. We couldn't not try the biscuits with strawberry deliciousness that others have reviewed. Fresh berries and just amazing! Well worth the stop and we would absolutely go again!

Decided to come here for brunch after reading the reviews. Located in a up-and-coming "hipster" neighborhood in downtown LV.

We arrived around 10am and there was no wait. The prices are fair compared to other brunch restaurants on the strip.
The service was friendly.

We ordered the deviled eggs - Deviled eggs with a breakfast twist. These were very good. There's a light batter coated around the egg, which provides a nice crunch. The bacon is also a nice touch. Has a breakfast-y feel for deviled eggs.

Country fried chicken with potatoes - Looked and smelled amazing. However, the chicken steak, I felt, was under seasoned. The gravy was also under seasoned. I wish I had ordered the shrimp and grits instead. 

Reasonably priced brunch spot in downtown LV. 4 stars for the deviled eggs and 3 stars for the country fried steak.

Awesome spot, I really liked the vibe and the atmosphere. The people were very friendly and the food was amazing. We ordered the special sandwich that they have with eggs, mushrooms and feta chesse and it was the bomb!
I loved the whole experience and would come back again. Great place for bruch.

Stopped off here before we headed to the Las Vegas Premium Outlets North which is very close by.  

It's sort of in this strange neighborhood and there were barely any cars around.  However, when you get inside, this place is packed and bustling.  

We ended up sitting at the bar, which was great!  Everyone was very nice to us and we had great service during our entire meal. 

My husband ordered the Country Fried Steak which is ginormous.  You can probably feed about 2-3 people with that dish.  It was heavy but yummy!  

I ordered the oatmeal to be healthy and it was huge!  Portion sizes seem to be pretty large here.  It was really good as it was topped with some cinnamon roasted apples.  I didn't have to sweeten the oatmeal at all because it was so good. 

My friend ordered pancakes which were amazing!  The pancakes were light and fluffy and just delicious!  It's on my list to order next time.  

We also ordered the beignets which I was slightly disappointed about.  I think I've had the ones at Disneyland way too much and nothing can come close to those.  These were decent but just not how I like them which are soft and just melt in your mouth yummy with all the powdered sugar on top. 

There are a ton of other things I want to try on their menu but since I don't live in Las Vegas it looks like I would only be able to eat here whenever we go to the outlets.  It's now on my must stop list for Vegas. 

I also loved their wheat toast!!  You must be thinking that toast is toast but here the toast is fresh, light, fluffy and thick and it's toasted on their griddle.  One word to describe it ... Yummy.  If you like toast, you have to try that here.   

You have to come with an empty stomach because you will leave completely full.  Great stop for lunch or brunch!!!

Happy to report that our second visit was just as satisfying. generous portions. flavorful. I ordered their homemade corned beef hash with eggs. I'm high maintenance when it comes to eggs -- don't cringe: over hard with the yokes broken and crispy on the edges. Well, the eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash was as good as homemade. Hubby ordered chicken fried steak again. Yum. Our go to breakfast place when visiting Las Vegas.

Eat.  Ate.  

The two words you'll see on the door walking in hangry, and walking out full.  Very clever if you ask me.

I ordered their chicken fried steak.  This plate was huge.  The CFS was smothered in gravy sauce, came with two eggs (any way you want it), potatoes and butter toasted bread.  The customer service here was really great.  Everyone was friendly, and walked around with a smile.  Very very local spot located down the street from the Fremont Experience.  

TIP - they're very strict about not serving the chicken fried steak after 11am.  If you try ordering it at 11:01am, you're shit out of luck.  Trust me, I know.  Was definitely worth coming back the next day.

eat. was good, and I'd definitely come back. I wasn't wow-ed by my meal, but overall, I was happy with the experience here.  One of my friends described it as ,"a diner with a good attitude" and that fits it almost exactly.  It is urban-hip in decor, and a pretty small restaurant overall.  On a Sunday at 1p, expect a 20 minute wait.  I don't know if it was the acoustics, but it was pretty loud in there, so we chose to wait on the benches outside.

The servers were friendly and pleasant, and the coffee was strong and hot. I'd already scoped out the menu online, but alas, the menu at the restaurant was not exactly the same (no Shrimp Po Boy?! GASP!) 

Luckily, I had a second choice in mind.  I ordered the Shrimp & Grits, and yep... My Yelp-ers were correct, those are some runny grits!! I generally don't like my grits so thin.  However, it comes with a lot of shrimp (no tails, either!), big slabs of bacon, and an egg (it comes poached, but they ask how you like it, so I ordered it cooked a little harder).  

Because the grits were so thin, I stole my friend's delicious sourdough toast, which was soft and buttery, just the way I like it. The bread helped to sop up the grits, so maybe this meal should come with bread?  My friend enjoyed her corrnbeef hash, and loved that it tasted fresh and homemade. Our other dining companions got the grilled cheese and the huevo ranchero and both said they were delicious. 

I'm glad to have a brunch option downtown, and eat. did the trick!

Went here on New Year's Day and so happy we did! The website said it stopped serving breakfast at 11 but since it was a holiday they had a special menu until 2. I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had the chicken fried steak. They were both amazing but the shrimp and grits took the cake! The shrimp were huge and meaty and the sauce with the over easy eggs were to die for. The chicken fried steak had an awesome spice to the breading and was cooked perfectly! The only downfall to this place was no alcohol. Probably didn't need it on New Year's Day! The coffee was outstanding and the passion fruit ice tea was great! It was not sweet but really good. Would come back and try the truffle egg sandwich next time!

5 is for the food. The food was very flavorful. Got eggs & grits, yummy. Hubby got blt added egg super yum. Little one got oatmeal and fruit which was great. 

We were the first people in on a weekend morning and our Server was a little awkward, then a more experienced server assisted her.

This is my favorite downtown breakfast place. They make lots of yummy items. My favorite as of now is the huevos moltolenos. Who would have thought that eggs, black beans, peas and bananas would go well together? Chef Nat! Thats who! 
Friendly staff also! Ive been here at least a dozen times and will continue to go back!

Awesome brunch spot in downtown. Friendly, attentive staff, fun, inventive and tasty food, and a cool location. I spend a lot of time in Vegas for work and this is my new go-to spot. I love that downtown has all these new, independent businesses popping up left and right. Eat is a stones throw from Container Park (another cool local business hotspot) and I haven't seen a brunch menu this creative in awhile. Coffee is great too! Check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

Fast service and good food. Very cool vibe.  I had the huevos rancheros ($11) very interesting flavor.  It's sort of just a hot mess, with salsa beans, eggs, peas, tortillas and potatoes. The flavor was great.  My girl had the short stack pancakes, which was only $5, cheap date. The pancakes were a tad dry and just not enough syrup. The soft drinks where the typical Vegas price $3 , ouch.  Overall a great place to eat breakfast or lunch just a short walk from Fremont st.  They are right next to the new container park, which is cool.  I would defiantly eat here again.

A friend of mine that lives in Vegas suggested we eat here for brunch as she has been wanting to try it for sometime. I'm so glad she did! The food was incredible and the service was good. Get here early because there will be a wait ( so worth it ) if you can; sit at the bar tops facing the Kitchen. Their bread is to die for!!
Clean hip place with a fantastic menu. Best eggs Benedict and potatoes, you also have to try the cinnamon biscuits

Pleasant fare at a fair price. I ate lunch here twice in three days if that's any indicator. It's a short walk on a nice day from old Vegas. #1 was the BLT with avocado and chicken-chili soup. Lunch #2 was a simple breakfast. The bacon in both instances  was memorable but everything, including the service, was consistently good. None of my dining companions had anything negative to say about their meals either.

The best breakfast I've had in forever!!!!!!! And I LOOOOOOOOVE breakfast!  From atmosphere, to service, to food!! They deserve all stars!!!!

We wanted something other than the regular Boyd casino buffets and found this place a hop, skip and away next to container park.

We walked in and they had a good crowd inside. We thought the wait was gonna be long, but it wasn't. They sat us right away.  I'll get straight to it.....

LOCATION: convenient, close to the Fremont experience, about a 3 minute walk.

PARKING: lots of street parking everywhere 

SERVICE: quick, friendly, fast.... they got everything we ordered correct.

FOOD: AMAZEBALLS! truffle egg sandwich! The food here was sooooooooooo delicious! Truffled egg sandwich! Truffled egg sandwich!

PRICE: worth every penny... affordable but not cheap. Like I said, worth every penny. This place won't break your wallet :)

My next trip back to Vegas, I'm definitely stopping by here for breakfast!

Very nice restaurant. Had the truffled egg sandwich two scrambled eggs, wild mushrooms, green onions, feta (substituted with cheddar) & bacon on ciabatta with chive potatoes. 
The toast came with bacon over easy eggs and chive potatoes... I didn't photograph that entree.  
Service was very good, water and coffee refilled and waiter checked on us.
Food was very delicious. 
Metered street parking was confusing. We didnt know how to pay using a credit card.

Wow, everything was AWESOME, food, price, staff, cleanliness, and FAST. Was a little concerned pulling up due to surroundings but definitely go in.  I had truffle egg sandwich, not sure what was better those or the potatoes

The food was absolutely incredible in portion and taste!! Only issue was our server, Gary. He was not very friendly and appeared annoyed the whole time. All other staff seemed friendly and welcoming, guess we just got unlucky. Overall, however, great food!

Visited on July 13, 2016 at 1:30-2:30 pm.

The chicken fried steak was probably the best I have ever had. The gravy was outstanding and definitely home made with a lot of love. The pancakes were perfect. I have never tasted a pancake that was so buttery and sweet and the house syrup they provided was a perfect match. I loved it. I can't send enough people here to enjoy their food. You must stop if you're in Downtown LV. You won't regret it!

BLT was amazing!! A little on the cold side, but still very good. Atmosphere is very simple and modern and fits in well downtown. Lots of young people eat here. We came in at 1pm when they closed at 2pm and the hostess was very cold and did not even say a word - I would somewhat understand if it was 10 minutes until closing but even then she needs an attitude adjustment.

I wanted to try something new for brunch and this place came to mind since I have seen it. But since this place always closes early which is totally understandable since it's a brunch place. I went in already knowing what to try since I was digging thru other people's comments. So I ordered the cinnamon biscuit with powered sugar and strawberry and shrimp po'boy and my boyfriend ordered the killer  gill Cheese with bacon with a side of tomato soup. Sounds good right ? It really wasn't that good as I expected seems like any other regular place. Maybe I went in expecting a lot. Overall it was okay but not worth going again.

Must try this place.  Their breakfast is as good as any 5 stars hotel on the strip in Vegas.  Price is very reasonable. Service is good.  Very friendly staff.  I had Deep-fried deviled eggs and pancake.  They put may spicy ketcup, mayo and bacon over the fried eggs.   They were outstanding.  The pancake was pan-fried crispy on the top but soft inside.  It was the best pancake I had so far.

First off, the food--
- Deviled Eggs: AMAZING! Best deviled eggs I've ever had. 
- corn beef hash: also delicious. The food is really good here!

The Service--
- The hostess was nice and sat us quickly. 
- Our waiter was super friendly. He makes up for the bad experience. However, he did not check on us at all once our entrees came. Although, he was charismatic about serving us. 
- The Manager: absolutely rude. Being from out of town, we stopped by Dutch Brothers for some coffee. We brought it in not thinking about it at all. Many of the waiters commented on how much they love our coffee. So when the manager came around and said "You can have your coffee in here but you can't drink it," we thought he was joking and laughed. He goes on to say "I'm not joking. It's a law. You can't have it in here." It is an understanding rule, but we were so put off by it because of how rude he said it. If he would have been kind and humble about it, we would have been fine with it and would have complied. Instead, he decided to be an asshole about it. He went on throughout the meal with checking on other guest but not once did he come to us. 

The food was great. The hostesses and the waiter service was great. The manager...he was an asshole. As much as I want to give 4 stars for the food, the manager killed my experience. I would recommend this place to others strictly for the food, but will warn them about the Hitler manager.

The name says it all... this is where you come to EAT.  I am always looking for something new in Vegas and this place checks off all the boxes.  Innovative food, hip atmosphere, in an unexpected location.

We came for breakfast and we were not disappointed.  We came at opening so parking was not a problem and we were seated immediately.  I had my 1 year old grandson with and it was very comfortable for him too.

Our server suggested we get a starter... I have to be honest, I have never ordered a starter for breakfast.  He urgently suggested we try the fried deviled eggs.  So we complied and ordered them.  I will be dreaming of these eggs for a very long time.  They were delicious.  The whites are breaded and fried, and yet they were light and not at all oily.  Then the fried whites are piped with creamy, flavorful egg yolks, topped with bacon, sriracha and ketchup.  The combination of hot\/cold\/crunchy\/creamy\/spicy is FABULOUS.  All I know is this is a must have next time we go (and THERE will be a next time). https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/eat-las-vegas-2?select=ovBp2Y8KJ3B-RAy3RqHMbg

For my main, I ordered the huevos motulenos.  I can't even begin to describe this dish.  The description on the menu didn't make much sense, I just trusted and jumped in.  It was superb.  My eggs were done perfectly, the flavors blended in a way that I never imagined.  I do not like peas, but the notation on the bottom of the menu told me that NO changes to the dishes will be made and after eating this dish I understand why.  Unless you have a life threatening allergy, trust in this chef and just order the dish that appeals to you.  She has put together flavors and textures that we would not normally think of, but they work perfectly.  This dish was a perfect example of this.  I especially loved the banana sauce on one of the eggs.  The chive potatoes were delicious as well. https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/eat-las-vegas-2?select=gpqlDvGzaN4aZvLybvpk8A

My daughter ordered the chicken fried steak and was not disappointed.  The breading to steak ration was very good and the gravy on top wonderful.  She ate the whole thing and it is not a small plate.  I never finished mine, but it was not for lack of trying to.  https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/eat-las-vegas-2?select=DAt-XT-3YHrndxuxn-9LZw  The one item that comes with the chicken fried steak is toast, you choose what kind.  She chose the sourdough and it turned out to be a star all on its own.  LARGE slices of fluffy, airy delicious bread.  We both decided it was something that would have to be ordered again, regardless of which meal we chose.  I would love to see this as French Toast (hint hint)  https:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/eat-las-vegas-2?select=xLwaGNgrMlV_a4DoltfTgA


The location is not what you expect from Vegas, although I see the eateries popping up in this neighborhood and I think we are seeing the beginning of a wonderful future.  The staff is friendly and helpful, they are also very playful, so come ready to have a fun time.  The ambiance is very new, different.  Very comfortable.  Loved the decor and they even have a patio area.

Great breakfast spot. The atmosphere was chill and hip and servers friendly and nice. My water and coffee were always full.

I got the shrimp and grits. It had a nice presentation and the bacon was thick. Though there wasn't as much shrimp as I thought there would be. Regardless the savory flavor was killer. The rye bread I had on the side was a great addition to help scoop up the grits. Literally licked my plate clean. :)

You MUST get the strawberry biscuits. I've of my friends shared hers with me and they were fantastic. I ordered the huevos Motulenos. They were good, but a lot better without the banana. I tried a few things from my friends' plates and they were all really well executed. Their coffee is good. I'd definitely go back. When the weather is nice, try sitting in the patio area. It was relaxing to be out there.

This place is awesome. I've been coming to Vegas for years and have struggled to find a good breakfast place, so glad to have finally found one in eat. Loved the "off the menu" Chicken Fried Steak and the coffee is the best. Look forward to coming back for more...

We decided to try a new place based on the reviews and thought we may have found a new spot.  The service was awesome and everyone there was friendly and helpful!  The food though was mediocre at best.  The truffle mushroom sandwich was not very flavorful.  The mushrooms tasted and looked like they had been cooked in a large batch and then thrown on top.  The potatoes were not very good either overcooked with burnt chips scattered throughout.   The Huevos was an unusual combination and probably good if you like the strange combination of flavors.  We should have read the menu more closely, the peas were out of place. Unfortunately, this will not be our new goto breakfast spot :(

This place only serves breakfast and lunch but everything that we ordered was delicious! We tried the "chef special" deviled eggs which had deep fried egg whites which was great.  The best thing we ordered had to be the shrimp and grits, it was creamy and flavorful. Our servers were very attentive, checking in on us often.  This place is more on the pricey side for breakfast\/lunch food but the quality and freshness of the ingredients makes it worth it.  Good sized portions, our family left the place more than satisfied. Definitely check out this place if you're in the area and looking for a good place for brunch\/lunch.
The meal was fantastic. Service fun and casual. The eggs with banana (huevos mutelonos (sp?) was the best I have ever had.

Best pancake in LV! Real maple syrup. So delicious.

Forever order:
Pancake, a single.
Arugla Salad for breakfast
Side of bacon
Mothership coffee.

The deep-fried deviled eggs might be the best thing I had, for the price, while visiting Las Vegas.  I visited the restaurant and ordered them twice while I was there.  They are a little spicy.  I definitely plan on going back for more on my next trip.

If you are in Las Vegas, you probably expect to pay far too much for food and walk away disappointed about 80% of the time. EAT was a completely different experience. You'll get the sense that this is more of a neighborhood restaurant and more of a passion for the people who work there. 

We had about a 20 minute wait and sat outside watching hipsters wander back and forth which is always entertaining. The streets were quiet due to an upcoming iHeart Radio event which made other businesses in the area a bit tense but not the people at EAT.

Service was fast and many people came by our little party of three asking if everything was ok. They were very patient when I had to run out to take a call and I appreciated that. We ordered the two eggs with potatoes, cinnamon biscuits, grilled cheese sandwich and the BLT. Everything was perfectly made, hot and fresh. 

The sourdough bread was a hit as it was thick cut and surprisingly light. The potatoes were very well seasoned and the bacon a delight. Cinnamon biscuits were light and fluffy with a strawberry sauce and powdered sugar and blueberries. We plan to go back every time we are in town. 

Get off the strip and have some good food. Eat at EAT.

Unique and delicious! Loved everything about this place. Food, service and ambiance. Yes you have to pay to park, but you always do downtown! (Only downside) had their pancakes and let me say hands down best pancakes I've  had in a while. The coffee complemented the pancakes incredibly. I would highly recommend eat. To anyone looking for a new place to get your breakfast fix!
Fantastic! Me and my girlfriends walked here from The Golden Nugget. Great quality and the food was delish! I can't wait to go back!
Great bfast probably the best weve had in a long time. Pancakes were unbelievable a def must. Friendly and quick staff. A def must when in Vegas.

This place is alright. 
But they take forever to go to your table and circle around. 
I've seen my server once this whole time. 
My coffee was not refilled, but the seat next to me was. 
No one really came around to ask how our food was or if we needed anything once the food arrived. 
I ordered chicken fried steak and was sorely disappointed. 
The gravy was good, steak was bland and super dry. 
The pancake was alright.
I just Love it! delicious food! the ambience and the personal are great! Thank my friend to invite me! very good place!

This place has some of the best breakfast food I have tasted here in Vegas.

I have come here plenty of times, and it is always consistent. Even down to a lot of the photos that are posted here on Yelp, that is how the food always looks when I order it or I see it pass by my table. 

I regularly get the pancakes. They are always crispy on the outside and on the edges while being soft and fluffy on the inside. The size is always generous with it filling up most of the plate it comes on. Instead of maple syrup, I normally ask for a side of their homemade strawberry compote to go along with it. I don't normally eat pancakes that way, even if I am at home, but it ends up being a good addition to a already good pancake. Also, while the chive potatoes are good on their own, I would suggest ordering a side of their gravy used for the country fried steak, and pouring some of it over your potatoes. You will not regret it.

Come early since you might end up waiting a bit, especially on the weekends and especially on Sunday, but when you do, get ready for a treat in the downtown area.
Amazing food with great service. Had the shrimp and grits with a pancake. Everything was cooked to perfection.  The presentation nice with a great aroma and delicious flavors. A must try.

Great food!
Service, food and atmosphere were all a pleasure.
Adding this to the list to revisit for sure.
My favorite place for breakfast and lunch in Vegas. Everything is always fantastic.   You won't be disappointed.

We had the shrimp sandwich, hot pastrami sandwich, tomato soup, chips and delicious coffee. Everything was very tasty. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that there was a hint of rancid oil in the shrimp sandwich. The coffee was so good we bought two bags. The staff is very friendly. Atmosphere is loud and bustling.

SUPER LET DOWN. This place was SO hyped we had to try it. Group of 6. Five of us were present with one parking his car. We were told we would not be seated until the whole group was present. We countered with the logical point that our friend was literally two minutes away. Still, we would not be seated because "we can serve people in less than 20 minutes." Not sure what that had to do with it. We could have easily sat down and ordered his coffee within that two minutes. Oh well, gotta love rule followers. 

Anyway slightly annoyed we eventually sat down and started with OJ and coffee. Our server was awesome. She had a great attitude and was fun. 

The cinnamon biscuits were crazy hyped as the thing to get so we got 2 orders. Yea, not sure what that was all about. Dry, bland. Sure yea it's awesome I guess, when you sprinkle cinnamon on biscuits and call it a craze? Fail.

Most of us are huge fans of deviled eggs so we ordered those as well. 5 star presentation but 1 star taste. Again, bland. Was hoping for some horseradish taste or seasoning. Just tasted like a deep fried egg which was a unique twist on the item but lacked flavor.

I ordered the eggs benedict which happened to be a special. I love eggs benedict and order them any time I can. I took two bites and pushed the plate back. The hollandaise sauce was bland and the turkey bacon or whatever it was tasted like cardboard. Again, horrible absence of flavor. Hollandaise should catch a slight lemon flavor and bacon of any kind should be exploding with flavor. 

Our server graciously took it off the check but that didn't help my breakfast hunger any. 

So, yea, sorry. Don't get the hype. Won't be back.
All the trappings of a great restaurant, just not the food. Pancakes were doughy and the little tiny sausage they gave was insulting. I also had poached eggs, the yolks were cooked solid? WTF?

Ok, so I've been here a few times (I visit every time I go to Las Vegas). I went twice on this trip and was very disappointed. The first day I ordered the corned beef hash with 2 eggs and received 2 eggs with potatoes and chopped beef\/steak. The beef wasn't cured at all or maybe it was old. Either way, it wasn't what I've received on previous visits. Ok, so at this point I'm going to give Eat the benefit of a doubt a revisit the next day. My mistake. I ordered the chicken fried steak breakfast and I think I could have chewed my leather shoes easier. The accompanying eggs and potatoes were good, but of course, the real challenge was making a delicious steak and they've failed. Remember, these choices were not new, so expectations were high and I was let down. I gave 2 stars for the friendly staff, but unfortunately that doesn't satiate my hunger. I doubt if I will ever return to Eat.
Very pleasant surprise!  Food was creative and mad my mouth happy.  We are already thinking about having breakfast tomorrow!

Great spot for breakfast or lunch. The food is fresh, yummy, & local. I like the ambiance with nice outdoor area as well. The BLT, eggs with mole, & arugula salad were all great. The service was friendly & prompt.

Tried this place with my wife for Brunch.
The food is just ok. My wife found a couple of Bristles from a brush in her food! And they burned one of my pancakes. We brought that to their attention with the intention to improve their service but got taken with one of the staff as if we wanted some sort of a comp! We can pay for what we consume and don't need a Freebee! Still left a decent tip after all of that! Not good to judge like that!

This place was uniquely centered in downtown right across the container park.
The location was a nice stroll from Fremont (7mins away walking).
It's located on a cute corner with benches outside of people waiting to eat.
They only open a few hours for brunch & the menu is limited but incising.
The inside is sleek, very design forward but all the waiters make it casual.
Had a very LA type of feel.
Our male waiter was nice, in a rush I felt tho. At least my water was filled at all times.
I went for the eggs Benedict that wasn't on the menu that our server said right before we ordered
Their potatoes were good & the eggs Benedict was awesome.
Flavorful but yet still nice and consistent with the rest of the dish.
We waited about 15 minutes until the hostess came over and took our check, not sure where our waiter was the entire time we ate & finished.
We left filled and happy.
The wait time went by quickly which was nice
I will say tho, for those picky eaters this is not the best place to bring.
Very limited & no sides.
I wish some plates came with your casual eggs & pancakes but that's not the case here.
It's a good spot if you have an open pallet!

New to Vegas and was exploring Container Park when we were told by a local about eat. We're beyond happy she did! Great feel and environment in the restaurant. Best Iced Tea I've ever had and we both loved our lunches. I got the Reuben and my wife got the grilled cheese with the tomato soup. If you're in the area.....GO!

When this restaurant was first opened, their sandwiches were really good and the place was always packed.

Past forward to present day. I visited this place recently when I took an out of town vendor to visit this joint because he wanted a good sandwich. Anyway, we went during peak lunch hour and I was nervous about the long wait, but when I got to the joint, we didn't have to wait at all. That should have been a sign.

Anyway, I ordered the BBLT sandwich and he ordered something else. For a place that wasn't that busy, it took a long time for the sandwiches to come out. When I took a few bites, I realized the quality really went down hill from the time it first opened. The other guy wasn't impressed with the sandwich either. 

Now here is the main reason why I will never come back to this joint beside the mediocre sandwich. A few days before this visit, I received a new credit card with new numbers on it and I used it only at a few places (markets and gas stations) and the credit card was never out of my sight and hand. By the way, I always checked for skimming devices at the gas stations. The only transaction where the credit card was out of my sight was at this restaurant and I started getting fraudulent charges on this card about two weeks after my visit. Now I'm not and won't directly accuse someone at this restaurant of skimming my credit card numbers, because I don't have any proof. But knowing that this was the only place that my credit card (with new numbers) was taken out of my sight made me nervous of potential credit card theft.
Great atmosphere with good service...very cozy area for small groups to hang and enjoy good food.

Food and service are so good.
The music is so loud that I kind of don't want to come back.
:(

We woke up this morning feeling like a celebratory breakfast was in order, considering the positive outcome of the Presidential election last night! It seemed like the perfect time to try eat, downtown's newest chef-driven hotspot. I'm happy to say that chef Natalie Young's restaurant fully met my expectations, and the waitstaff seemed slightly more friendly than anticipated. I noticed mixed reviews of the service, but I'm guessing that Romney's loss put everyone in a good mood!

Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young was playing when we arrived, and Tony Hsieh was dining at a table in the front corner of the restaurant that I will assume is reserved for him. The soundtrack continued with the 60s\/70s folk theme, which suited me just fine! Choosing between the creative egg dishes and scrambled tofu on the breakfast menu was tough, but I was most interested in the truffled egg sandwich. Served on a buttery croissant (presumably from Chocolate & Spice, like the other pastries served at eat), the sandwich featured a flavorful melted cheese, perfectly scrambled eggs, sauteed wild mushrooms, and a side of tasty breakfast potatoes. I won't be surprised when I see one of those Food Network "stars" describing this dish as The Best Thing They Ever Ate, as it is certainly worthy of the praise. My request to leave the bacon off the sandwich was granted without attitude. The wild mushroom mix likely included some pesky shiitakes, but they were tastefully prepared.

I love the feel of this restaurant and can't wait to return to sample the huevos motulenos and explore the lunch menu. My only complaint would be the difficulty of obtaining a coffee refill, but I'm not inclined to subtract a star for that.

Soooooo glad boyfriend and I decided to try this place while vacationing in Vegas. It's about a 10 min can ride from the strip, but so so so worth it. Trust me. We were sat immediately, even though it was a busy morning. In my opinion, they had quite a surprising amount of people working for a Monday morning, which showed. The service was impeccable. Both glasses never went below half empty. The iced tea was phenomenal. We started with the special of the day, their deep fried deviled eggs. UNBELIEVABLE. At one point, I think every single table in the restaurant had one on the table. management: take note that your servers clearly push specials well, and know how to sell them. For brunch, boyfriend had the Reuben with chips, I had the two eggs breakfast with their special sausage, sourdough toast, and a pancake on the side. Everything was incredible. His sandwich was heavenly, served on thick bread, with the best housemate chips I've ever ever had. My breakfast was perfect, the chive potatoes living up to its reviews. My toast was served with a house strawberry jam that was so good it ended up all over my perfectly griddled pancake. All in all, it was a perfect perfect breakfast. Boyfriend and I wished we could have taken it all home, but it wouldn't have survived our day on the strip. 

Thank you eat! We both vowed to come back any time we visit Vegas. 

Trust me partiers, absolutely worth the 12 dollar can ride from the strip. ESPECIALLY if you're hungover.

After looking forward to a nice brunch we were extremely disappointed by the managers rude attitude today. We were a group of 10 and she tried to sit us on a table for 8 and when we asked the server if they can add the empty 2 person table to our table the server said let me ask the manager. She then came back & said ok but the manager immediately came to our table and said no no wait I cannot give you the table unless we don't have a waiting list. There was at least 3 empty tables.  I have never been in a restaurant that the manager was so rude with no customer service. However the severs were great & food was excellent despite the managers rude service.

My favorite ritual before leaving Las Vegas is finding a new breakfast spot. This time around we found "eat." just because it was near our hotel. The place is lively but not too long of a wait even on Sunday. They serve a New American style of food that is delicious and healthier than most places you'll find around here.

With a 15 minute wait for 2 people it wasn't too long of a wait. We came in just before noon and the place was bustling with life. With a hip yet eclectic vibe, the place consisted of Vegas locals and as well as their fair share of visiting food goers. 

I ordered the "Two Eggs Any Style" with Chicken Sausage instead of bacon and a cup of their hot coffee. The coffee was good but what you'd expect at most breakfast spots. The whole meal was more than enough for any one person but I wish I could've eaten it all. The eggs were great (Over Easy) and the chicken sausage was great too but the star of the meal were definitely the potatoes. The potatoes are cooked with rosemary and onions and has that delicious seared taste that you want in a good set of breakfast potatoes. The best part is that they give you a hefty serving and you'd probably be able to split it if you're thinking of a light start to your Vegas weekend! 

The service was fantastic and the one error I had with my meal was quickly resolved without a hitch. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the crowd that comes in ranges from young to old. If you're looking for a solid breakfast to start your day for just a moderate amount. You'll find your money's worth here.

Reminds me of many other hipster places you'd eat brunch at in LA (that's a good thing)

+Food: Brunch with a little twist.  Very good.
-Huevos Motulenos: This was my least favorite of the things we ordered.  It wasn't bad, it just wasn't very memorable.  Sauces were nice, eggs were cooked well, plaintain was a nice surprise but overall it was okay for me.
+Cinnamon Biscuits: Plated really beautifully with berries and warm strawberry compote.  The biscuits were fluffy and delicious and the compote had just the right amount of sweetness.
+Corned Beef Hash: If you're a corned beef type of person, it's the right dish for you.  It wasn't overly salty, it was cooked well and crispy, eggs were perfection.  Also the fluffy sourdough was just awesome to eat with it.

+Price: I think it was affordable (~$15+ a person)

+D√©cor: Very cute and hipster.  

+Wait: Wasn't too bad actually.  I expected a huge wait on a Sunday but for 8 people, it was about 30 minutes.  The food came out very quickly as well.

Overall, I'd definitely eat here again.  I like getting away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

All that's written about this place, is true. Lots of food. Lots of good food. I ordered the shrimp and grits, and I'm not a grits fan, but the description sounded so tasty, I took the plunge. Adding the pico de gallo raised the taste level from eh... to get in my mouth you little grit. Will order it again. My husband had the chicken fried steak. The biggest chicken fried steak I've ever seen. He could't eat it all. Stopping at Donut Bar across the street probably had something to do with that. The service is great. The atmosphere is refreshingly charming and unpretentious and clean. Go. Enjoy. Eat.
Great food & great service!! It's rare to find a place with food that is consistently good! Definitely a local gem of a restaurant!!

Really nice, homey ambience to the place, has very friendly and helpful staff w\/ great service, and wait wasn't to bad on a Monday morning especially with the Life is Beautiful festival finishing up the night before. I ended up getting the truffled egg sandwich, my friend got the eggs benedict special they had going on, & we shared a short stack pancake. The truffled egg sandwich looked like it'd be a bit heavy, but the eggs were fluffy, bacon crispy, feta creamy w\/ hints of truffle oil, & the skin of chive potatoes had a bit of a crunch that gave a good textural difference and made it a really good side. The pancakes we got were a pretty decent size with some powdered sugar on it. Surprisingly the pancakes had a bit of a crisp on the top layer and were almost cloud like w\/o that heavy butter taste. If you're staying Downtown or just want a change in location for brunch I'd definitely recommend this place.

I'm new to Las Vegas and I was in search of a new breakfast\/brunch spot and stumbled upon this place yesterday and decided to take my partner here for their birthday. Big mistake. The food was decent. The cinnamon biscuits were amazing as well as the killer grilled cheese with bacon. But the service was absolutely terrible. I work in the industry and if I performed like Gary did yesterday afternoon I would be fired immediately. He was rude, uninterested, he forgot to put in an order for an item and didn't even care. For the prices the service should be even a tiny bit better. If I ever go back I will definitely request a didn't server.
Large portions and laid-back atmosphere. Country Fried Steak and Grilled Cheese sandwich (where you can also add your breakfast meat of choice) were delicious.
Ate at Chow last night now at Eat this morning  Enjoyed my BLT with avocado   Staff was nice Coffee was good  wish I tried the biscuit with strawberry  we will come back

Everyone knows Las Vegas is all about horrible buffets and overpriced food on the strip. My friend and I were pleasantly surprised by this restaurant downtown, just a few blocks from the casinos on Fremont Street. It was so good, we went twice over the 3 days we were in Vegas. If this place was in my hometown of Seattle, I'd totally go for brunch or lunch any day. She's vegetarian, but we had plenty of options for both of us. Grilled cheese with a side of tomato salad? DO IT!
Best breakfast place to eat at so far! I've lived in Vegas 10 years.... I work at a hotel and when someone asks for a good breakfast place this is exactly where I send them :)

Awesome space and concept. The menu has lots of cool dishes and everything we ordered was very nice. There was a bit of a wait to get a table, so be prepared. The coffee was excellent and our server was super nice and gave me an excellent tip about adding jalape√±o to the corned beef hash!  Will definitely return with friends and out-of-town visitors!!!

It saddens me that this place is not in Sacramento Ca, because this place would be a hit in Sacramento, like it is in Vegas already. The atmosphere is lovely & the food... The food... Is awesome. The grits are the best grits I have ever had. The deep fried deviled eggs are crazy good. I never thought or seen anyone deep fry deviled eggs before. This is a place to checkout while you're in Vegas. This will be my breakfast spot for the next 3 days. Worth checking out.
I love "Eat". The only problem is that it can be difficult to get a table. The place is popular and the line, waiting to get in, can be long

Awesome breakfast\/brunch spot in Fremont district north of the Strip.  Makes me feel like I'm back home in Seattle.  Hipster vibe.  Had the traditional eggs, bacon, potato breakfast.  The potatoes were awesome!  Make sure to rub the potatoes on the sour cream powder on the sides of the dish, very tasty!  Forgot our beignets though :(

My husband and I came here for breakfast for the first time and got tofu scrambles w\/ toast and potatoes. The food was absolutely delicious. I loved that instead of traditional jelly they had a homemade tasting fruit puree. Their coffee is tasty as well. Overall our experience was decent except for our server Gary. It's really unfortunate that he left such a bad taste for the restaraunt because we enjoyed our breakfast. He spent a total of maybe 30 seconds at our table. He never asked if our food was ok, very unfriendly and unhelpful. It got to the point my husband had to get up and go back to the kitchen to ask for things that we needed (condiments, etc.) He dumped our bill off at our table without saying word. I've never had such bad service in the area and I've lived here for 4 years.

This place did not disappoint. I got the tofu scrambled eggs and my friend got the shrimp and grits and both were absolutely delicious! Wow. Usually I hate breakfast foods y they are greasy and leaves you feeling guilty but this place was amazing

I've heard really great things about this place and finally had the chance to make it downtown and try it. It was definitely worth the drive and wait. I had the two eggs any way and one pancake, the pancake was just like I like it kind of crispy on the outside but nice and fluffy on the inside. Will be back to try their sandwiches, everyone around us had them and they looked delicious! Is a bit noisy in there though, I felt like I had to yell to my friend across the table, only reason I'm not giving them a 5.

So I'm gonna be super cliche and give this place 5 stars. Well deserved of course! Arriving early is a must. We went right before 11am the Monday after SuperBowl and boy did that place fill up quick in the next 10 minutes. We were seated immediately but if we came any later, we would have been waiting for 45 minutes. 

I ordered the truffled egg sandwich and my buddy had the huevo motulenos, both of which were excellent. Perfect hangover food.

After seeing how many reviews this place  got, I thought "I had to try this place". After seeing the reviews we decided to try this place on a Monday morning for breakfast to avoid the crowds and long waits.

When we (7 adults, 3 kids and a baby) checked in for a table the people weren't friendly at all. No smiles, just a "How many you got" with a stone face. 

We get to the table, we're short a seat, and when we asked to add a small table, the guy seemed irked that he had to adjust the table because someone set it wrong. Even when the server arrived to get our order he didn't even crack a smile or from. Another stone face no expression person. 

We ordered the cinnamon biscuits, which was a HUGE mistake! It was so dry (yes, I know biscuits are suppose to be dry, but this was like, extra dry, gotta drink water sort of dry) and that gross thick strawberry cough syrup tasting nasty sauce was straight up disgusting! A short stack (2 pancakes), which was just OK. Corned beef hash which came with 2 poached eggs. When I thought of corned beef hash, I thought more of a hash patty type of hash, but it was the type of hash with the tiny cubed potatoes with the tiny cubed pieces of corned beef. We also ordered some Mexican breakfast thing which had a banana under all that Mexican yumminess. Eewww! Wth! So fricken gross! Mexican food with a banana in it! Who's stupid idea was that!?

Anyways, long story short, I would never recommend this place or ever go back again!

Totally worth going off the strip for.  The service is fast.  The portion sizes are huge.  I got the truffled egg sandwich for breakfast. It's a large sandwich and comes with roasted potatoes.  The potatoes aren't greasy and the truffle flavor definitely comes through.  I will definitely come back on my next visit.
Super cute, hidden place to eat. We ordered the BLT and it was amazing ! Really big portions and super nice servers .

eat... except for your limited seating and limited hours - you are 5 stars. 

Every daydreamer restaurateurs - wants to be you - except, you were first. 

Exactly as you are, exactly as you have set out to be...true, honest, no hipster can deny. Real poached eggs - with liquid centers, better than decent drip coffee, hollandaise not from a packet in sight, crispy, deep and crunchy waffles, good lunch\/brunch non-eggy offerings...thank you for your foray to the fringe, to the edge of the streets of revitalization. You - just rock.

More than once, the line...was too long, but more times than often - have just given ourselves over and said...we will just wait it out...to be amused by the back end street life that the the last tip of downtown offers. 

Should you be early..grab a seat, if you are late, and want an authentic real meal, one that just feels like there is luv and sweat (not in your food) delivered to the table, as what you would only want for a chef focused plates to be served, just -  don't scoff at the hours or wait (eat owners must have a life - beyond serving YOU!) and enjoy...this is, what it must feel like...to have a real chef in the family that finds the work\/balance we all strive to achieve. 

Much love, we will figure it out.

I'm two years late to the party, but I finally ate at Eat. A few weeks ago, my husband was downtown on business and called me up asking for a recommendation for lunch. I told him to try Eat. Afterward, he told me about the awesome blta w\/ egg sandwich he had. He took me to check it out the day of the Santa Run, but the santas kept us from getting to Carson and 7th so I'd have to wait to try Eat. Then, last week; success! 

If driving be prepared to feed the parking meter. The restaurant sits on the lower level of Park Avenue Apartments. This tired building is sure to experience a revitalization thanks to the Downtown Project. Carson Ave has become a hot spot for downtown dining and it began with Natalie Young's Eat. She was the first to partner with Tony Hsieh and see her dream to fruition. She is currently working on her next venture, Chow. 

Eat bustled on a late Saturday morning, while there was no line out the door. There was a wait for a table, but counter seating was available. We settled in and gazed over the menu. Our server asked, "Can I get cinnamon biscuits started for you?" Many might be duped by the question thinking they are complimentary, only to be surprised later by an $8 charge on the bill. It is a bit sneaky so be warned. Yet, we said, "yes, bring them on!" The tender biscuits swim in strawberry compote and are topped with berries. It reminds me very much of strawberry shortcake, add some fresh whipped cream and it'd be the perfect dessert. 

When it came to ordering we skipped right over the breakfast items and went straight for the sandwiches. I had to try the dwblta ($11) myself and the husband went for the killer grilled cheese with tomato soup ($9). During the week more sandwiches are available, they all sound fantastic. However, if I ever get a chance to dine on a weekday, the chilaquiles will be mine! 

I added cheese to my dwblta, I skipped the egg; I don't dig runny eggs, blasphemy, I know. This sandwich was great! All components married beautifully and the sourdough bread held it together without being too bready. It was a thing of beauty, truly. Sandwiches come with a side of house chips, potato or tomato salad. I really enjoyed the tomato salad. Despite my best efforts I could only devour half of the sandwich. I took the rest home. This sandwich could easily be shared. 

He added tomato, egg, and avocado to the killer grilled cheese. It was a tasty twist, especially when dipped in the soup. However, as good as it was we agreed we enjoyed the dwblta a bit more. In fact, it might just be the best damn sandwich in lv.

One of my favorite breakfast stops in Las Vegas! I don't know what all goes into those pancakes but they are amazing! 

Wish they would serve liquor here because I have a feeling they would make an awesome bloody mary!

Must haves;
Pancakes
Shrimp & Grits
Huevos Motulenos

Breakfast time and it's time to EAT! 

Huevos Motulenos: hard tortilla base with beans, feta cheese, bananas and topped with over easy eggs smothered in a tomato base sauce and accompanied by potatoes. A dish that has a good balance of sweet (bananas) and savory. 

Shrimp and Grits: pretty much self explanatory, served with bacon strips, butterflied shrimp, topped with over easy eggs and homemade sauce. The eggs were something different but a nice touch. 

Biscuits with strawberry compote: biscuits that seemed to be baked with sugar and cinnamon for the crispy top smothered in a strawberry compote and topped with strawberries and blackberries. This was the highlight of our meal and it's a must get! It's usually served before the meal arrives. 

Overall great place to satisfy your breakfast hunger.

I've been to this place three times in a year. So it's safe to say that this place is our go to Breakfast place in downtown. Parking sucks but that's downtown vegas for you.

Shrimp and grit is my personal favorite while my wife loves their chilaquiles. If only they have better brand of coffee. Not my liking. Service are decent but am not here for service. Am here for their great food and creativity. Go ahead try it!! I am pretty sure you will love it.

This review is for eat.'s occasional fried chicken dinner, which only happens so often and requires advance payment and reservation.

Always intriguing when a classically trained chef like Natalie takes on traditional food, and eat's fried chicken dinner is no exception.  A promised all-you-can-eat fried chicken meal with all the traditional fixings for $38 (cash only).

It begins with homemade biscuits and cornbread, both warm as if only recently taken from the oven.  The biscuits are hearty, the cornbread perhaps too fluffy as it came apart very easily.  Both are accompanied by butter and artisan honey, which was a great dip for the biscuits (and the chicken skin as well).

The entree is a mix of fried chicken served alongside mashed potatoes, collard greens, cheddar mac and cheese, and corn on the cob.  The chicken is well-cooked, with a batter of a unique blend of spices (guessing paprika, a touch of pepper, seasoned salt, and some oregano-like herb).  The collards are tasty with a hint of pepper kick, the mac and cheese is no-frills made with tasty cheddar, and the corn is seasoned with paprika.  The mashed potatoes weren't all too memorable, but skipping that at least leaves more room for the chicken.

The meal is capped off by warm peach cobbler with a dollop of fresh cream on top.  Fresh peaches, warm from the oven, and the cream supplied a satisfying note that helped temper the heat and sweetness of the cobbler.

The vibe for these dinners is a friendly one, people introduce themselves and experience the food alongside each other.  Natalie makes the rounds herself in her traditional plaid shirt and chuck taylors, making for a real communal ambiance that's in short supply in this town.

You have to either visit regularly or follow eat. on Facebook to find out when the next one is, but once it's announced, get tickets and plan the diet accordingly.  This has to be one of the more unique dining experiences the already vibrant Vegas' dining scene provides.

Nice spot in Downtown. Right behind Container park, you can find "eat", which is a fairly nice place for brunch. 

Overall the food was pretty good. Their egg Benedict (my first ever) was great and served with a side of potatoes and a plentiful single strawberry. I also had a bit of the Apple chicken sausage and cinnamon biscuits, which were also really good. The orange juice was good, but a bit pricey for me ($6), but it did have pulp, yum! 

Service was decent. It was a busy Saturday morning with the Color Run in town that Might have overwhelmed the employees here, but think they did a decent job. It did take us about 25-30 for 3 of us to get seated, which we were completely okay with. 

I love downtown and this place offers that uniqueness that every restaurant in downtown has. It has a lot of nice decor, seats are comfortable, and has a hipster-ish vibe to it. 

Overall, I would definitely come back for brunch and recommend to anyone coming out of Vegas. Just be aware that this place closes a lot earlier than other places do in Downtown.

Cute little spot with great food. Slightly snooty attitude from one of the servers when I asked a question but everyone else seemed fine. No wait since it was a weekday and late morning. Had the corned beef hash and a lemonade and both were great. Boyfriend had shrimp and grits and they were good but being from the South, I have high standards for shrimp and grits.

Being in Vegas and not wanting to eat at the Casino when we got in, I had bookmarked Eat after reading all the great reviews from LV Elite Yelpers and had to check this place out. Well I was truly glad that I got our group to let me choose the Saturday breakfast. (They actually had no choice I was driving)

Eat is roughly about a 5 minute drive from the California Hotel making it really convenient. Waiting only 10 minutes after we arrived at 9:00am we were seated in this nice trendy hipster place in downtown. The sound level was a little loud with the music and people chatting but it didn't deter us from enjoying the food and decor at Eat. 
Some of the items we ordered:

*Beignets http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/eat-las-vegas-2?select=FfSeubYzwJBP9R_YfkUcvQ#FfSeubYzwJBP9R_YfkUcvQ Great item to share, jam and mascarpone made this dish yums.
*Eggs Benedict with turkey bacon and spinach: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/eat-las-vegas-2?select=--TpWg7-6ctPuUbpzYUGvg#--TpWg7-6ctPuUbpzYUGvg  I swear the hollandaise sauce must be one of the best I ever had! 
*Pancakes with chicken apple sausage: My friend took one bite and busted out a huge smile. I got to sample the pancakes, melt in your mouth and a slight crunch on the edges of the pancakes made this dish a must.
*Eggs with smoked bacon and smashed potatoes: Smoked bacon was that standout of this dish.

*Outside seating available
*Street Parking
*Friendly Service

*Eat is a must for breakfast when staying in Downtown*

We arrived near the end of breakfast service and were told by our wait staff person that we would need to order from the brunch menu.  We moaned and told her that we were hoping to have breakfast.  Another person (the manager???) overhead our conversation and came over to tell us if we could order quickly that the kitchen would accomodate our order.  We asked what she would recommend; she suggested the Shrimp and Grits.  I had intended to have something really breakfast-like but since that dish was on my 'to-have' list, I thought, why not try it here.  My cousin ordered the steel cut oatmeal and the beignets.  

When the food was served, I split off some of the shrimp and grits to share.  What a mistake; I wish I could have eaten the whole order myself, after having the first bite.  I'm not sure if the restaurant's recipe was traditional, but it sure was gooooood.  Buttered grits on the base, perfectly cooked shrmp, sweet crispy bacon, sauteed pico de gallo, two eggs, and finely chopped red onion.  There was a great balance of flavors and texture.  I'm usually not good with raw onion, but these were cut very fine and were extra sweet so they added an unexpected flavor and texture.  My cousin was also happy with the oatmeal.  This review would have been a 5-star except that the beignets were pretty heavy (suspect that if we had ordered them in breakfast prime-time that they would have been lighter.  But the homemade jam that they were served with was very good so that made up alittle). 

Will definitely come back on my next visit and will recommend to my friends and family.

I was an early customer of Eat and thought it was an excellent addition to Downtown. Great food and great value. However our last visit was a little disappointing. The food was still excellent but the service seems to be a little hit or miss. I didn't look at my bill in detail until after we left and we were charged $4 for avacado because we asked for it on the side rather than in the sandwich. $4 for a tea bag with no refills also seems pretty steep. Still good though.

My wife rented my dream car (Tesla Model S) I found this restaurant on yelp and decided that we would come here for breakfast and charge up the ride at the supercharger station that is right around the corner. It wasn't until after we decided to eat here (no pun intended) that we looked into the reviews... All I have to say is WOW. So glad we decided to eat here (no pun intended...again) 

We started with the Deviled Eggs. They were delicious.

I had a three egg Californian omelet (added an egg because I am a big guy and this big guy likes eggs)  It was very delicious but even better was the bread. It is from a local bakery. The size of it puts Texas Toast to shame... It was HUGE! The potatoes that came with the eggs were fantastic. I am not really a breakfast potato guy but they were delectable. I also got the coffee which was pretty smooth. I liked it.

My wife got a BLT with avocado with an egg added  (For a tiny little thing, my wife likes eggs too) We could have easily shared the sandwich it was so big. She said she loved it but it was way too much for her to eat. (She ate half) She loved the bread!

Both dishes came with homemade chips that were really good.

We both would recommend EAT to a friend!

We usually eat breakfast at Egg & I but deciding to try this place.What lured us in were the pic of the beignets which we found out are actually no longer on the menu! WTF!..Talk about false advertising. ..Then what breakfast place worth its weight in gold doesn't serve freshly squeezed orange juice..Especially after a long night of dancing and drinking. THIS is essential. ..
Small yet quait with indoor\/outside seating and decent decor and ambiance but who really cares about that at breakfast. ..Good food, Freshly squeezed juice options and great service is how we judge our Breakfast  spots. Whats saves this joint is The Food...fresh ingredients and righteous spicing are key..
So if you're ok with decent service, no freshly squeezed oj but good food (without the beignets)
Definitely give this place a try, at least once..

I have been to eat multiple times.  The food is excellent.  You must try the cinnamon biscuits. A beautiful blend of biscuit, strawberry, blueberry, and cinnamon.   Also their homemade chips are great.  The only downsides are it is slightly overpriced, which is common with the new downtown boutique movement, and incredibly loud when busy as the space is not super large.

This place rocks!
My mom, grandma, and sister were all in Las Vegas recently and were heading toward downtown to get away from the Strip for a day. We were all starving and wanted something in the realm of breakfast\/brunch food. We were very satisfied when we stumbled upon eat. 
We only waited about 5 minutes to be sat and we all ordered coffees that came out very quickly. We spent some time browsing the menu because everything looked so good! I opted for the breakfast sandwich without the meat and subbed it for avocado. It was recommended by the waiter to do it that way and it was a great decision! My mom got the pancakes and they were amazing! I kept picking off her plate which wasn't a problem because the portions were huge. 
This is a great place to go if you are looking for a pre-exploring downtown Las Vegas meal!
Glad we choose this place great service. I had the truffle egg sandwich OH WOW! It was fantastic

I stopped here during a layover on my way home to Portland after the holidays. In fact the food and atmosphere reminded me of home...it was delicious and well worth the wait. The tomato soup was amazing, along with the Truffled Egg breakfast sandwich I ordered. The staff were friendly and efficient. 

Highly recommended.
