Tomato salad is refreshing and light. Might just change your mind about the flavor tomatoes can posses. 

Other items to check out-Corned beef hash, biscuits with fresh strawberry compote\/ fresh fruit.

My only con would be that some menu items aren't available from time to time, maybe due to acquiring fresh product? (Paper & clipboard menu) I've also tried some other items that often miss the mark on just flavor.  

Service from the lady's is great. Always on point and genuinely attentive. Nice, knowledgeable, caring. 

Parking may be a little ways away and most often, pay to park.

I had bookmarked this spot because I saw some rave reviews about it a while back. Finally got around to eating here on my last trip and now I'm wondering what all the fuss was about. It's good, but nothing I had made it rise to greatness. Although, to be fair I didn't exactly order the most exciting thing on the menu. 

I got eggs. Two scrambled eggs, to be exact. And they came with smoked bacon and chive potatoes and toast, which was of the rye variety. All of the above was sufficiently cooked and tasty. None of it was particularly noteworthy, though I will point out that I give props to any place serving rye bread. If they really wanted to get on my good side, they'd serve pumpernickel or squaw. 

My gf ordered something called a "skinny jenny" which was pretty damn good. I don't know why they give it a girly, low-cal name that makes it sound like a dish catering to women. I would have ordered one, too, if it had a moniker that sounded more unisex. My eyes wandered right over it because it sounded like some health food thing tailored for girls trying to keep off the pounds.

Brunch -Sunday Morning -no wait-live music and GREAT FOOD !!! 
If you stay downtown-Fremont Street it is easy to get to- lots of street parking.. but we had a great walk just about a block or so away from Fremont East

I ordered the PANCAKES-super light and the best part-REAL MAPLE SYRUP.. and not in some mystery container either- your own little jar! Sausage and a couple eggs I added on the side-

Coffee is great-no after taste-very balanced and refilled often!

My other dining companions got- the Grilled cheese w. tomato basil soup-the soup was excellent-little bit of a spicy taste which was great- the bread on the cheese sandwich was super thick but looked very yummy!!

The whole place looked very CLEAN- servers were very friendly up beat and the tables were very comfortable size wise.. not too small and not too big... 

I can't wait to go back for Breakfast in Vegas- off the strip-HIP and Good EATS !!

OK, this place would normally be 5 stars easily, but I have to be honest.  Lets start with location.  Good luck finding it and when you do, expect to pay for parking.  Not used to that in Vegas.  OK, now inside, pleasantly greeted, seated promptly, got coffee and water quickly.  Perfect!  I really had no idea what I ordered by its name, but it was pretty good.  It had beans, corn tortillas, red and green sauce, sausage and salsa on it.  To be fair, it was ok, honestly, there was a little too much flavor on the plate, my taste buds were kinds confused.  Presentation and quickness of service was perfect.  Waitress was amazing!  Its almost at 5 stars!  Will definitely be back next time in Vegas!

We decided to eat here while in Vegas since we wanted something off strip that was fabulous - the yelp reviews led us here and boy were we thrilled! We ended up sitting at the bar, which we really love cause we can see everything going on in the kitchen. We had the deviled eggs to start which were OMG FAB and i honestly can't remember the 2 main course breakfasts we ate but it and the COFFEE was amazing. We loved everything we at - the food lived up to the yelp reviews. We loved coming here for breakfast and we'll be back :)

Went to eat. for breakfast. The food was excellent as well as the customer service. The menu is small, which works well for me as I do not like huge overwhelming menu options. I had purchased a latte prior to going and was asked to throw it away before I could be seated as they do not allow outside drinks. The place is small with limited seating so depending on how busy it is you may have a wait...however it is worth the wait.
Love this restaurant! Fast, friendly and food is consistently delicious! Chef Natalie you are the best and so happy for your 3 restaurants in Vegas!
This place. Ohmygoodness. Delicious. Hip. It's my favorite place to bring out of town guests for brunch!

I forgot to take a picture  of the Golden pancakes  and bowl of grits.  The food is always  good here ,never had a issue. I pretty muck explored  the whole menu of food all of it is good. As far as the service  good there has been a turn around  of staff and kitchen  from when it 1st open up, which is a good thing and bad thing  . THE OWNER Natalie  has done a very good job for her, employees  and people that like to eat.

I went in with my mom and we were seated at a small two table seating. However, the ambiance was very loud and I could not hear her during the meal. I ordered the truffle egg sandwich and it was delicious! I also added the potato chips and it tasted just like Glazier's homemade potato chips! I was amazed! I will definitely go back her but probably with a larger group of people so we can get a more secluded table!

Of all the new places I tried (9!) during my nearly 3 week jury duty stint, eat is the one that has stayed on my brain the most.  At least once a day since I visited there I've envisioned that wonderful chicken banh mi.   You've already seen my rating so you should know that this is not an unpleasant thought whatsoever.   As a matter of fact I wish I could get some sort of chip implanted in my head that would push out anything negative that entered my mindspace and replace it with the deliciousness that is this sandwich.  This is an idea I'm fairly certain I can convince at least Mark Cuban of on Shark Tank.  

When I went to eat. to eat. (ha!), I was not surprised to see it jam packed full of people.  That was one of the more disheartening things about downtown in general: it seems that most of the really good places to eat like eat. require a short wait to be seated or require social interaction to a level I'm generally not comfortable with.  Thankfully I tended to venture out to lunch on my own and its much easier to get a table or seat when you're by yourself than otherwise.  If there was ever a case to be made for not having any friends whatsoever, it's that you can get a chicken banh mi sandwich from eat. approximately 10 minutes faster than if you bring a friend.  I got seated at the bar relatively quickly after I arrived, and after perusing the menu I decided pretty quickly on the chicken banh mi because it sounded good combined with the fact I didn't think it'd offend my lactose intolerant sensibilities.

There's not much more I can add to what's probably already been said about the chicken banh mi, and allow me to steal another members perfect picture of it http:\/\/s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com\/bphoto\/dPrha-ksEnqLVmTFMc5vsQ\/l.jpg.   The flavors popped, and each and every component of it was welcomed into my mouth.   One thing I'll say is that it's not denoted with two asterisks on the menu which is code for "spicy", but the slaw on it did contain jalapenos and I actually found myself drinking quite a bit of their wonderful iced tea to counter this.   I LOVE spicy food and still thought it had quite a kick, so something to consider.  

Service was extremely fast and efficient, and my iced tea never came close to being empty.  Price was extremely reasonable for what I considered to be an excellent meal.

Bonus: On my walk from the courthouse to eat. (which turned out longer than I expected), I got to see a screaming match between a pedestrian and a driver which provided me a few minutes of voyeuristic entertainment.  It's the little things in life.

Excellent breakfast! My first time to Vegas with my boyfriend who grew up here; neither of us had ever had Eat. before. 

We had the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote--2 biscuit halves for each of us, plenty of compote, plenty fresh blueberries. Delicious. For entrees we had the corned beef hash (comes with super buttery toast and poached eggs) and chilaquiles. Chilaquiles was perfectly spicy, but the hash was my favorite of the 2. 

Service was perfect. Thank you, Eat.!
God frokost, men mye br√•k..

Stylish, open decor, cozy but not crowded.  Quick breakfast service with water and coffee quickly, taken black full of flavor and not at all bitter, a great cup o' joe.  Huevos montulenos (I'm close but not exactly right) a variation on Huevos Rancheros, filling with black beans and eggs over easy, ranchero and verde sauces side by side.  My dining partner completely ordered a la carte, fluffy egg whites, a lone pancake fluffy and thick dusted with powdered sugar and accompanied by a classy single serving of maple syrup in a small sealed bottle, and chicken apple sausage.  Want to go back, the entirety of the menu seemed appetizing.  Quick coffee service kept my cup full until I said stop. :)

Strangely large tables. Hard to talk to the person across from you at a 2-top. Understaffed table waiting. Tragically weak coffee. Sad corned beef hash with boiled potatoes and a complete lack of crispy bits. Bland and extremely runny shrimp and grits, with cooked bacon swimming in liquid. Did not come with much needed soaking bread.
Always fresh & great.  Be prepared to wait and have all patrons in your party present or you won't get sat down.
I recently tried their Reuben and homemade potato chips. Amazing!! I highly recommend :).

Sometimes, Yelpers can miss and the four star ratings that drew me here is a disappointment.  

First it's a breakfast and brunch place and they stop serving brunch\/breakfast items at at lunchtime?  Say what?  How difficult would it be to keep your grill open to cook breakfast items?  

Second, the waiter appeared annoyed after he was told I ordered coffee (my friend even heard me) and he didn't hear that I wanted coffee and water.  

Third, the food was marginal at best.  Maybe because I didn't have any appetite having spent the night and day before at EDC but man, the black bean soup tasted like sea water.  They salted the heck outta that beans till it flew outta the cuckoos nest.  

Two of my friends, didn't like the Tomato Soup, which looked like they put some care into it's presentation, but the taste buds don't lie.  Unfortunately, I can only recommend that you don't Eat at Eat.

Loved this place. We are local to Vegas and always looking for new spots at reasonable prices.
We had the green chile chicken posole. It was amazing. *warning*-if you don't like cilantro you may want to skip this dish... But it's one of the reasons I loved it.
I had the Bleu cheese Roost Beef which was delicious and the chips are made fresh and a great crunchy accompaniment to the meal.
Staff was great and service was speedy despite it being packed for a Thursday morning!
Will def become one of our regular places

I came here on a recommendation and was not disappointed. We were lucky to be seated right away, as we understand there is always a wait because the place is that good. Loved the deviled eggs and the cinnamon biscuits.

OMG! I wish j could rate this establishment better than a 5 star. Everything about this restaurant was incredible. From staff, to service to the finished products set before us in the table. Hats off to the chef, WOW! Everything that touched my lips was sent from heaven. I was savor in everything on my plate. The bread, the bacon, the spinach and asparagus! Wonderful and highly recommend this place to everyone!

Cute little place downtown.  Good, quick service.  I ordered the eggs Benedict with turkey bacon and it was absolutely delicious.  Love that they have freshly squeezed orange juice. My boyfriend ordered the huevos motulenos and said it was just ok.  Pancakes were also pretty good but nothing spectacular.  

It's a good place to try once but I wouldn't drive more than 10 minutes out of my way just to come back.

I have returned to Memories of a great restaurant with great food. This time I tried the deviled eggs with just a side of the chicken sausage and a bowl of grits for breakfast with a large glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. The deviled eggs were a warm creamy and spicy which gave me a bit of a shock but a thrill  I ate every last one looking  the sauce off my fingers.  I will definitely be dreaming about this one! The service was great the food was even better just like I always remembered. This breakfast was taken place on a Tuesday at 10 o'clock and the restaurant was full with buzzing locals. This will always be one of my favorite breakfast spots everything that I have tried here is very good so please, eat up!
Wish every breakfast and lunch spot were this yummy. The cinnamon strawberry biscuits were amazing. Share it to start!

I love everything about this place. Service was great. Staffs always check up on us and filling up our glasses all the time. The food came out on time. Their pancakes was fluffy and big. The best pancakes I've had so far. Their cornbeef hash was amazing as well. I can't wait to go back to this place

I got the corn beef hash.
Very very very delicious!!!! Friendly staff, super cool interior, great food \/ food choices.

A friend and I went there for lunch on a weekday and arrived shortly after opening.  Service was very slow and we were at the point of giving up and walking out when someone finally took our order.  

The food was very good but too expensive for what we got.  Lunch for two ran over $40 minus tip.  I don't mind paying that much when the food and service are very good, but that wasn't our experience.  I doubt I will go back.

Went to Vegas for 3 days and tried to eat here twice. I went the first day for a something quick and simple. Service was fast and attentive. The food was exactly what I was looking for and well priced. We couldn't get in the 2nd time because of the wait, but that's expected at 11am on a Saturday.

Deviled eggs.  Omg!! Not in the menu but delicious! Also, freshly squeezed oj was so refreshing.  Shrimp and grits was super tasty but shrimp could use a bit more seasoning. Had to salt the grits a bit but the bacon set them off nicely! Love that they have an electric guitar up front in the waiting area.  My friend sat down and played while we waited for our table. Would go back, for sure!

HUGE portions. I got the special egg benedict with fresh squeezed OJ, and the fiance got his breakfast with iced coffee. Mine came with a side of potatoes, and it was so filling, that I gave one of my benedicts to the fiance. I came in on a Sunday around 10am and the wait was about 15 minutes. The server served us fairly quickly. I loved the fresh squeeze!

Highly recommend the small eatery off the strip. Flavorful, good portion, great service. Breakfast of eggs potatoes and bacon simple but super flavorful. The Rye bread was very unexpected. Fluffy and very good. The biscuits with fresh strawberries was delicious. Not too sweet, this outs were not dense just the right consistency. Very good. Overall I would highly recommend coming to eat at Eat. It's pretty crowded on a Monday late morning so I can imagine the weekends quite a wait. Make sure to get here early they close at three.

The only thing that ruined our experience at 'eat' was the view from my seat of some big guy showing off his hairy ass crack. Along with that view, was a not-so-attractive woman at a different  table showing off her crack too. Despite the horrid visuals around me (and slightly throwing up in my mouth as I saw the dude's ass) the food was great. The BLT was as good as you'll find and the same can be said about the pancakes. With slightly crispy edges and a fluffy texture, it can easily be billed as one of the better pancakes in town. Syrup is available, but isn't needed. The chicken apple sausage on top was great, as well. It wasn't a cheap breakfast, but the quality is well worth it. The brunch menu on weekends is fairly small, much more so than the usual breakfast or lunch menu on weekdays. So, plan your visit accordingly.
Go there now.  That is all.

It's a shame that everyone doesn't get an automatic tweet when in Vegas to check this place out. Thanks for a recommendation from a fellow tweeter I found my way to eat. Skip the buffet and try this out. Had the poached eggs on hash with sourdough. Perfectly seasoned, usually reach for salt and pepper at these places but not this time. Good portion size not too much and not too little. Friendly staff, clean and quaint atmosphere.
As good as you've heard.  Bloody noisy though.

Eat is a great brunch spot in downtown Vegas. I found parking easily on the street on a Sunday morning. The girl told me there was a 25 minute wait for 4, but we were seated within 5 minutes. Score!

I tried the cinnamon biscuits with jam and they were delicious! Smaller and thinner than I expected but they had a nice crunch and the jam wasn't too sweet. I also ordered the shrimp and grits. It was my first time having this dish and it was pretty good.  It was topped with an over easy egg and served with some salsa.My bf ordered the chicken fried steak and it was so good! I really liked the chunky gravity that went with it! My friend had the benedict of the day and he really liked his dish as well.

The coffee here is Amazeballs....the service was great! The food was the icing on the cake....I had the egg sandwich....such scrumptious  flavor and I have no idea how they made the potatoes. ...from heaven!!

Loved the decor and the vibe. Great breakfast\/brunch spot downtown. It's fantastic to have a place in Vegas that isn't a touristy breakfast spot and it made me think of breakfasting in other cities I have visited like San Diego. It's great to have a unique little culinary treat to add some culture that isn't a gut-busting breakfast buffet or a greasy spoon (nothing wrong with those if that is what you are looking for). 

The coffee was amazing. It was one of the best cups of coffee I have had in a while. I ravenously consumed the shrimp and grits and it did not disappoint. The flavor combination hit the spot.

I'm still dreaming about fried deviled eggs.... why has no one else thought of this? They are incredible. A must order. I also loved the truffled egg sandwich..it wasn't too truffle-y, just the right amount of flavor. The addition of avocado made it even better. Coffee is good, service is fast, and atmosphere is clean and comfortable. Fried deviled eggs will be my first breakfast stop next time I'm in Vegas.

I gave this place a try twice with a coworker before leaving this review. We were seated right away both times (yay) but waited at least 10-15 minutes before the server acknowledge our presence. The place isn't big at all so even if you're busy you can at least say hello to your table!

The first time, I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with potato salad. The sandwich is ginormous and 90% bread and 10% cheese. While the cheese was yummy, you could barely taste it with all that frikkin bread. Should be more cheesy in my opinion. Shrug. But to each his own. And the server gave me chips instead of potato salad. When I asked her to bring me the salad, she seemed perturbed. Geez! It was your mistake, not mine.

The second time, we waited 15 minutes to order, very frustrating. Especially when you only have an hour for lunch. I ordered the two eggs over easy with chive potatoes and bacon. For $11 I expected something goooood. WRONG. My eggs arrived well over medium (no gooey yolk to dip my bacon in, booooo.) The potatoes were overcooked and maybe four bites worth, and the bacon way too crispy. Guess the cook forgot about my breakfast and just let it sit there overdone. 

When I asked for jam for my toast, again the server seemed hassled by my request. Is it just me? Do I have a booger on my face? I didn't ask for new eggs because I don't like to complain (nor do I risk saliva or snot in my food). Very disappointed at both of my visits.

This place has let me down twice in guest experience and food. I will never go again. Overrated.

Delish! I ordered the tomato soup and grilled cheese which tasted like a reimagined version of my childhood favorite :) my taste buds were in heaven. The only downside was the wait but because of the size of the restaurant it's pretty understandable I waited 30 min without a reservation.

After seeing Anthony Bourdain dine here I drove directly to Eat after landing from So Cal. It was during a workday and found metered parking for a hour\/$1.00.

I was solo and sat at the counter which gave me a view of the chefs in action. Started off with a tasty satisfying cup of Joe. For my main entry, I had the pancakes, chicken sausage and added two poached eggs. The pancakes were some of the yummiest I've ever had. The chicken sausage went nicely with my medium poached eggs and the service from my waiter was friendly and spot on. Overall satisfied!

The menu is southern influenced so I'm looking forward to returning and trying the  shrimp & grits or beignets.
Great food. Great service. Egg truffle sandwich was amazing. Definitely coming back when we're in Vegas.

Thank goodness I don't live in Vegas or I would add more inches to my waistline. Can't get over how many good food choices there are here.  This establishment needs some signage outside. It's barely noticeable. I guess word of mouth is good enough because this place is really delicious. The breakfast menu is simple with just the bare essentials. I loved the truffle egg sandwich. The ciabatta bread was perfect. The huevos motulenos are excellent as well. Service was great!
Excellent taste and savory menu.  My favorite is the pancake.  Crunchy on the outside and soft and most inside.

Drove to Vegas this weekend and pulled in to this place for breakfast. The service was fast, the restaurant was quaint and clean and the staff was super friendly. To top it off the food was awesome. I had the scotch eggs on pancakes (odd over pancakes but it worked!) it tasted awesome! As a Brit, I'm skeptical about getting scotch eggs anywhere but back home, but this place nailed it by putting their own spin on it. The rest of my party had the truffle egg sandwich with potatoes and that was awesome. You really can't go wrong with truffle. The hubs also (yes also this man is a bottomless pit when it comes to food) got the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The grilled cheese is huge. Wow! But very good. Awesome breakfast place. Will definitely go back!!

We've been here a bunch. I'm a fan. I really love the coffee. I stepped out of my "normal" and got the shrimp and grits on my last visit. It was really good. I was a bit worried...but I'm going to have to add this to my rotation from now on. You got to try this place...and afterward....step on over to the container park and check that place out.

Downtown Las Vegas keeps getting better and better. I really enjoyed breakfast at eat. with my parents over the holidays. They usually stay way "out there" in Henderson and I'm usually north. Finding a safe, "meet in the middle" restaurant that's not inside a casino and with street parking is harder than one might think. 

We shared an order of biscuits with jam - which was more like dessert than an appetizer. For some reason, starting breakfast with something sugary seems to be socially acceptable. Why isn't this the case for dinner?

For my main course I had to try the shrimp 'n' grits. It's my new thing, and I've been told that the chef has some history with NOLA. As expected, the grits were buttery and bacon laden. Just how I like 'em. A very rich start to the day, indeed!

No mimosas, wine or Bloody Mary's this time around. Yes, we were in Vegas but still... my parents are wild and it was like, a Tuesday morning around 9 am. We save our drinking for later at night. 

Breakfast for four people was about $75. Not bad. I'm always blown away by prices of food in Vegas vs. San Francisco. I'd be much fatter if I lived in Sin City for sure.
Went there for a relaxed breakfast with the Mrs.  The food had good flavor, the service was above average and the owner was nice and attentive.

Tried out Eat. because we saw it on Anthony Bourdain's Parts Unknown Vegas episode and we were there on Wed morning early so it was easy to get a table.  Street parking in the front is meter, but around the corner where we parked is residential apartments.

It's a hipster kind of place, people are friendly and they give good service.

We got:

Tap water - FREE

1 coffee $3 - she kept asking if we wanted it refilled and even if we wanted a cup to go.

B. got a full size bowl of green chile chicken posole $9 - it's a huge bowl we shared.  Soup was tasty enough, chicken dry.

I got Arugula salad $10 - even at 9am you can get salad.  I wanted it for fiber since when we travel we don't eat enough greens.  It was tasty enough.

Our total with tax $23.78 but before tip.

Separate bathrooms available.

Loved this place. It reminds me of the restaurants in Astoria, NY. I got the corn beef sandwich, which comes with your choice of a side. I got the tomato soup side, which I thought was watery and not very good. But the corn beef sandwich was perfect. It's huge, so I got to take half of it for dinner. Friend got the grilled cheese sandwich, which was huge and out of this world. Service was very friendly. Eat is a hidden gem in downtown. They close early so go for brunch!

Trip 2 to eat.  Just as ahhh-amazing as last time.  I had the Downtown Benedict.  Their hollandaise is super creamy and just the right balance of flavors.  I'm not a fan of cooked tomatoes so next time I'll order it without it but the spinach is a great addition to the classic Benedict.  

Sat at the counter this time and had a blast watching the kitchen.  We couldn't believe how efficiently they pump out such delicious food.  Young blonde expeditor was great to watch her control the kitchen! Super job! 

Oh we'll be back....soon!

Place is amazing. No better breakfast\/brunch in town-- the Huevos Motulenos were out of this world. Good coffee, great service, and awesome space right in the heart of downtown. I hope they expand to offer dinner at some point! Give it a try.

Great find for us.  So, so tired of the hotel food, if I have to go to another buffet I think I'll croak. 
Great food, fun atmosphere.  Cost in the $10-12 range. Definitely a do again

The food is amazing. The service not so much. I have been multiple time being a local and a foodie its like wait please tell me you know that we locals are your sound board. The waitress and prices was ridiculous. Charging for honey and syrup is just nuts. Its breakfast ... I am happy for the owner success but the whole customer service thing gotta get better

3 stars for most of the food. Extra star for the fried deviled eggs.

We stopped by here on the way out of town on a recommendation from friends. 

Hubby got the truffled egg sandwich and I got the shrimp po boy. We started with the fried deviled eggs on the suggestion from the server. 

So the deviled eggs set the bar high. They were super yummy. If you are asking how you fry a deviled egg...they bread the hard boiled egg white and fry it and top it with yummy yolky filling. Drizzle a lil sriracha on top and BAM!

The truffled egg sandwich was good but nothing amazing. It comes with mushrooms which were pretty much non existent.Truffle flavor?? Bacon was on the chewier side which can be troublesome in a sandwich.  A decent breakfast sandwich but not worth the $12. 

Shrimp Po Boy was also alright. The best part was probably the slaw. Shrimp were fresh. The ciabatta was on the chewier side and probably could of been toasted more. Potato salad on the side was nothing special. 

Service was on point. We were greeted and sat immediately. Food, drinks and check were timely.

Eat is located a block away from Container Park, and if you're in the neighborhood then I highly suggest you give it a try.

It is only open from 8am - 3pm and I suggest not waiting until the last minute to go because they're usually busy before closing. 

I ordered the enormous pancake breakfast with a yummy side of potatoes. The pancakes are huge and if you don't eat a like myself, then I suggest just ordering one pancake and a side of potatoes. My pancakes were delicious and I love the crispy edges. I also loved the delicious maple syrup that come with your pancakes. My fianc√© order the fried steak and he raved all day about how good it was and how he can't wait to go back.

We also received outstanding customer service. 

I also love the sign as you exit on the door it spells out ate.

Wow I would highly recommend this place.  My friends and I started with the cinnamon strawberry biscuits and I never would've thought cinnamon and strawberry went together but they were amazing.  I then moved on to the pancakes. I can't tell you how amazing these pancakes are. They were so thick yet fluffy and they had a crunchy outside just like at home, amazing.  My friend has a BLT and it was fantastic it had avocado and the bread was thick and delicious.  It's a wait but it's worth the wait.

Ohhhhhhh brother...where do I start....really... really bacon that was pre cooked before...SMH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I can stop but !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! No No No CHEWY!!!! for upscale foo foo restaurant who yuppies say greatness don't know breakfast.  With sooooooooo many great breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas this one is leading the back of the pack right under omelette house in Summerlin.  I really wanted to like it but at $50.00 for breakfast I expected AWESOME but the award winning huevos motule√±os I can strongly say the judges were paid off banana really??? The deviled eggs were good the coffee was strong...I quess that was it...the service was great and I say the pancake was good not spectacular but ok.  Sorry but I had to write this up...with all these downtown revamped restaurants...I haven't found anything more than you are paying for Foo Foo food

Good food, good service, big price tag.

Based on waiter's recommendation I had the corned beef hash with cheddar cheese this morning. It was simply delicious and the added cheddar cheese was a good recommendation. The two poached eggs were of differing doneness though: one was a little runny and the other boiled hard. I am not sure how that happens unless they were prepared separately or the eggs were of different age. Coffee was good and constantly topped off. I am just not entirely sure that a single breakfast dish and coffee should run $20+ with tip.

Parking on the street is $1\/hr by parking space number at the automatic meters.
Food was not even good! The girls were nice however this guy server if your going to try to flirt with my dude don't make it obvious and plus he's team vagina so back off end of rant won't be back

Two of us went here for breakfast and although the food was good, it was just too expensive for this town and for that neighborhood. We walked there from The D. We should have got breakfast at the D or in one of the casinos.
One of us got a dish they called Chilaquiles. Basically it was corn chips with a small amount of melted cheese, scrambled egg and a split sausage link of some kind. Ok but not really good by any means. I had the Huevos Motulenos. It is basically a tortilla with black beans, feta (which you cannot taste as it is overpowered by everything else), banana,two eggs and salsa. It was good, not great. I had water, friend had a cup of coffee. It was $29 and change BEFORE the tip. Just too much, folks. Wasn't worth the cost.

Went here for lunch and was blown away by their sandwiches. I must admit while roaming the area looking for the restaurant, the neighborhood had a "character" that almost made me turn around. I mean I like your average barefoot, toothless, bearded guy as much as the next gal, but maybe not joining me to grab a bite.
My friends tenacity prevailed and we found eat, once inside we were glad we had stayed on course. The ambiance is great! Think modern, casual, and fun. Service was prompt and knowledgable. We ordered the posole soup to share as a starter. It was great, the broth was flavorful and it came with all the traditional garnishes and was chock full of yummy hominy. For lunch he had the grilled cheese and tomato soup and I had the arugula salad. The salad was meh, but I ordered wrong. If you come here you MUST get a sandwich! Let me repeat MUST.  The grilled bread is insane, like you take a moment before you devour because it is so perfect. Get any sandwich, any, and you will be happy.
Needless to say, I'll be back, and order like a pro.

The food was really, really good
The service was okay
We are the cinnamon biscuits and the truffle egg sandwich 
Food was A+
Service was maybe 6 or 7 out of 10
I recommend it

Decided to eat some breakfast and Yelp led us here. I decided to go with the shrimp and grits since I had this dish at Brenda's in SF. The shrimp and grits at Brenda's was more creamy whereas this version is a bit watered down but still very flavorful. There was shrimp, bacon, grits and salsa which some how made the perfect combination of flavors. It wasn't too heavy but really tasty. 

I also got to try the biscuits with strawberry compote which was a flop to me. The biscuits were not warm or flaky and felt like eating dry bread with strawberry compote. I don' t really care for biscuits unless I'm eating them with fried chicken so maybe I'm biased but I'd rather have a pancake, waffle or crepe.

This has quickly became one of my favorite spots in town. If you're going to do breakfast, do it right by eating here. 

The service is typical and nothing out of the ordinary. 

The only thing that didn't meet up to my expectations when I came here for the first time was the menu. The menu is about three pages long with the last page being just of sides and drink selections. But I shouldn't have expected much since the place is smaller than average. 

I really love ordering the golden-brown pancakes, one egg, and bacon all from the sides menu. The golden-brown pancakes are PHENOMENAL!! The best pancakes I have ever had!! They are so filling and so delicious. What I ordered is seriously a great combination and I wish it was a combo that I could order from the menu. The killer grilled cheese ordered with tomato soup is fantastic. I've never liked tomato soup until I came to eat. The grilled cheese is delicious on its own as well and I think about it occasionally... LOL 

I'll definitely be coming back to eat. time and time again.
This place is so good! Wanted to try something off the strip before going back home. The truffle egg sandwich is amazing. Definitely will be back on our next trip out to Vegas!

My husband and I came here on a Monday morning, and the breakfast was the best I've ever had. I had the tofu scramble and it was perfect. It's also a super cute restaurant with a VERY friendly staff. If we didn't live in Texas, we'd come here every day.

It's fine. I had the Shrimp and Grits which was fine, nothing spectacular. A regular diner with a nice interior. Staff is friendly, but they won't make any substitutions or requests to their menu which is surprising because it's really just so basic to begin with. They won't let you use their wifi but suggest that you connect to the apartments upstairs. Wow.

25 minutes wait to be seated but you don't feel it's that long..Robert our server has good suggestion my daughter ordered Truffle egg sandwich & requested a side of their homemade potato chips he suggested to just substitute the potato salad to the chips if she doesn't want the potato salad. Servings are good for 2 people. Price is reasonable ranges fr $8-$15.Defitinely going back w\/ out of town visitors!!

I went here for Sunday Brunch (which f.y.i. is a slightly different menu). 
Prepare to wait a bit, a sign of any good restaurant. 

They were out of the corned beef hash so I got the pancakes instead with a chicken apple sausage. I'm not usually a sweet breakfast type of person ....rather savory instead. However, these pancakes were AMAZING! I hold pancakes at a high standard because of a place back home that's been around before my grandmother dined there (Liliha Bakery, Hawaii).  The three pancakes are thick and fluffy,  have a golden crust on the outside and a very soft, moistness on the inside. Big bonus: they serve them with real maple syrup.....not that imitation fake corn syrup stuff. I will be coming back for these again!

I woke up hungry with a sudden craving for beignets. Realizing I was in Vegas and not NOLA I want expecting to find anything but I stumbled upon Eat in downtown. 

We were seated quickly during a holiday weekend. I like the decor with the modern lights and the greenery inside. There was a lot of personality like a typewriter in the waiting space and a wall that says, "I'll see you in the flowers." I appreciate the open kitchen layout. 

We shared the biscuits which came slathered in very sauce and topped with a generous portion of whole fruit: strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries. We also ordered the corn beef hash. Surprisingly flavorful, it came with two perfectly poached eggs and four pieces of sourdough. The two dishes were the perfect pairing of savory and sweet. 

My only qualm: Drinks are a little pricey. $3 for coffee & $3 for an Arnold Palmer? I'm used to only paying a dollar or two for drinks, especially coffee.  The coffee here wasn't anything special but my fiance pointed out there were free refills on both drinks. 

I was happy with the service. One of the waiters (who wasn't even our waiter) came over and told me he was worried about someone stealing my camera. I appreciate the gesture & I'd totally return to give business to kind-hearted people.

A few weeks ago, I had the pleasure of eating at Eat. And I have to say it was a very enjoyable off-the-strip little joint! The seating is intimate. The location might come off a tad bit gritty compared to the glitzy strip. But the food was a good mid-range brunch price ($8-$14). And the service was warm, expedient, and attentive! I had a flight to catch and they got me in and out in 35 minutes--which I have to say is quite commendable being they were probably 75% full on a Thursday morning. 

I ordered the corned beef hash which was quite delicious and a offered a big portion. Side note: as far as hashes go, I've been mostly neutral on hash dishes in general but I did enjoy the hearty meal and the poached eggs were cooked to perfection, rightly runny as a good poached egg should be. And I ordered one golden brown pancake and I have to say...that was one of the best unadulterated, simple, just-how-your-G Ma-made-it-but-better pancakes that I've had in a long while. Definitely recommend a stopover--if not for the pancakes alone.
Had brunch here on a whim. It was amazing. Good service in an eclectic atmosphere and most importantly the food was amazing. Definitely recommend.

Oh my goodness. When I go back to Vegas this will be a definite stop. The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great. We were seated right away and we got our food quickly. The servers didn't really hassle us about taking pictures in front of things, which we did for quite a while. Lol They were very polite. The syrup they gave us was like from heaven or something. I can't wait to go back. This spot is so good.

I came to eat, I ate...and you should too! It takes an epic "Buzz" factor to divert my attention from the glitz glamour and opulence of the Las Vegas strip. After  several locals suggested this eatery, our brunch venue decision was unanimous. The location\/building is quaint at first glance however the dining room is lofty, modern, and quite comfortable. My friend and I both ordered the 2 eggs brunch (I debated between that and the shrimp & grits). My meal included 2 eggs, country potatoes, bacon, and toast all of which I devoured within minutes. The portion size was perfect and while my selection may be quite comon in most American diners, eat quickly earned the #1 spot in areas of taste, value, and individuality. Our server (thin girl w\/nose ring) was extremely friendly and warm, she offered suggestions and took care of us throughout our brunch hour. Will I be back, YES. Would I suggest eat to others, Yes! Enjoy!

1 star because my friend and I walked in and wanted to sit inside, there was a table for 4 available right infront of us, and the female at the door told us that the 4 top was not available for us, the only other option was to go sit outside where it was cold. Sorry but that is horrible customer service. 

When a customer walks in and is hungry and you tell them NO you can not sit there, you have to sit outside, you better believe I will never come back to this place. 

If I recall correctly this was one of  Tony Hsieh 1st investments in the DT project. Great way to earn customers. 

Oh and one last thing, the owner Natalie was just sitting back watching...

Do you ever wonder as an owner when 2 people walk into your establishment, and then walk out...why did they leave? Why didn't the hostess sit them down? 

Why didn't you as an owner stand up, and say "Hello, why did these people leave"

Well now you know. #epicfail
One of the most incredible restaurants downtown. Not only is the food amazing, but the environment and the staff are perfect. I wish I could give a rating higher than a five!

Great option for brunch\/lunch in the downtown area!

I first learned about Eat after taking a Downtown Project tour.  After hearing Natalie's story, I was sold on having to check out her restaurant!

So our team (a group of 5) showed up around 1pm for lunch.  We weren't in the heat of the lunch rush, but there were no tables available, so we waited about 10 minutes for a table to open up for us.

Everything on their menu looked great, and I was debating between the Grilled Cheese\/Tomato Soup and Chicken Pot Pie.  I ended going for the Chicken Pot Pie, which was amazing!  The crust was flaky, and the filling wasn't too liquidy.  The portion was great, and even came with a large side salad.  I finished most of the pot pie because it was so good, but I felt a bit guilty after (but I guess that's why it's comfort food, right?)  I probably should have eaten more of my salad to balance out my meal...oh well...

Can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu!

Really enjoyed our meal here: I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy and my companion had the Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup. The Po Boy was extremely delicious; the Grilled Cheese likewise (and Texas toast thick), with a flavorful soup that tasted like the essence of tomatoes. The interior is a nicely-dressed industrial space, well-decorated with greenery throughout. It was a bit crowded when we arrived and so it took a little while to get a seat... but once we did, the service was fine & friendly.
I loved the truffle egg sandwich...bomb! Server was nice as well. I would definitely go again when I come to visit!
Food was So So good!!! Definitely worth leaving the strip to eat here! Hostess was not great though

My boyfriend and I came to eat some delicious food and we were definitely not let down. I had looked up the menu earlier to make sure they had vegetarian options and I saw a few that sounded awesome, so we went. 

My boyfriend ordered the shrimp and grits and said "it was my first time ever trying shrimp and grits and I'm glad I tried it at E.A.T." They were butterflied shrimp that looked gorgeous!

I ordered the Huevos Motulenos and I am so flippin happy I did. Seriously, I could eat this dish every day. They use bananas instead of plantains so it's a bit sweeter but it works well with the spice of the salsas on top. The potatoes that came on the side were massive and so yummy. I devoured the huge breakfast and would do it again and again and againnnn. I am actually salivating thinking about it right now.

The only reason I gave a 4 star rating was because our server didn't check on us as much as I'd like. I understand not bothering people while eating, but there was a little while that we went without drinks. Nothing too major, I would definitely come back! I plan to soon... :}

Service was excellent and very friendly. The manager, Red, had a very strong presence and even opened the door for us as we were leaving. We had the country fried steak, truffle egg sandwich, and fried deviled eggs (these are not on the menu but I would come back for these alone).  The food was tasty and serving sizes were large.  This is not a spacious location, and not a quiet and romantic atmosphere...more like fun and hip. 

The only complaint:  the chicken fried steak was a little overcooked and some of the potatoes served on the side were burned.

My boyfriend and I come basically every weekend. It's our absolute favorite place for brunch! Yes, there is usually a long line but SO worth the wait. I normally get the 2 eggs scrambled and trust me is much better then you can get elsewhere! My boyfriend usually gets the truffled egg sandwich and he love it! Sometimes when we're feeling extra hungry we will get the strawberry compote biscuits 

Ambiance is great! Cool nice people there and the wait staff is always nice! 

A must!

Awesome food, exceptional service. Have eaten here multiple times.
Breakfast is usually my meal, but I had lunch here a few times.
Wife always orders shrimp & grits with a poached egg.
Always busy so be prepared to wait for a table.
Brought numerous people to this place and everyone loves it.
Sit outside if you can.  Chicken fried steak is some of the best.  Bread is also very good.   Go hungry, leave happy.

I've been dying to eat here since they opened up, but opened away and never had the chance. On my most recent visit, though, I took that opportunity and I'm glad I did.
Everything tasted fresh and well seasoned. The tomato soup was out of this world. 
I had the truffle egg sandwich and I can't wait to try more on my next visit. 

There is only one drawback to this place (which is totally not a deal breaker btw-just personal wish), so I can't recommend this enough to the establishment if it is in their power...please get booze! I know getting a liquor license in Nevada is obscene, but a mimosa was the only thing missing from my meal. You're already popular, I can't image how much more so you'd be with it.

Go down and eat at Eat. :)

Came here a little before 9am and got a table right away! The restaurant had a nice, fresh feel to it. My boyfriend said that the environment reminded him of Skinny Fats. I ordered the eggs Benedict - super flavorful and delicious! My bf got the country fried steak and really enjoyed it as well.

What a great place. I had the chicken fried and eggs. It was far better then any I have had before. The service was great. And the best part, the owner\/chef sits out front and talks to everyone as if they were family.
Shrimp and grits OMG! Awesome.  Noise level is high, not good for quiet conversation, but food and service were great.

Believe the reviews, the food coming out of the kitchen is top notch. Sour dough bread, best I've had anywhere.  The wait staff is friendly and efficient. I would give it 5 but it gets loud, the interior echoes sound, but that's most places, that seems to be consistently overlooked in most restaurants. Just one of my pet peeves, don't let it stop u from going here. U won't be disappointed if u do.

Really disappointed.... I ordered the shrimp and grits and am going to say that I should have asked more about this.  This came with bacon, eggs, pico, and shrimp and grits. Everything was piled into a bowl which left it like I was eating soup cuz there was so much liquid in the bowl. The bacon was at the bottom and gross cuz it was so soggy. I ate the shrimp and some grits and left everything else. My hubby got the chicken fried steak. This had good flavor and the batter on the steak was good but we couldn't even cut through it, it was so dry and chewy.... Spent $40 on this and won't be returning. The two stars is because it was a nice atmosphere.

Echoing the great service.  We were seated immediately.  Had 3 kids with us.  Not a problem.

Food was great!  All of their bread uses these huge slices.  Very fresh and tasty.  

Grilled Cheese Sandwich: Love the big bread!
Corned beef hash with poached eggs: Well done!
Reuben Sandwich: Very good, also with that big bread!
Tomato Salad: Tangy with small tasty tomatos.  
Kick-ass Tomato Soup: Like a tomato bisque.  Amazing! 
Cinnamon Bisquits: Not a favorite of mine.  Felt like it was dry even with the sauce and the fruit toppings.

Also got a cold brew coffee which was from stumptown.  Good stuff.

Overall a great experience.  Walking distance to container park as well where you can let the kids run around in the playground to burn off some energy.

The food was really good. The service was amazing. Best part? Real coffee. Not that awful instant stuff you find at diners and most breakfast places. They actually use decent beans and free refills. The waitress even gave us to go cups when we were finished. It's the little things that restaurants do that male me happy. That and the adorable wooden cat on one of the light fixtures.

I like the atmosphere . I like the food and I like the service. My truffle egg sandwich was good. I would have gone with a different bread or a little less toasted but the truffle added good flavor the sandwich. The Benedict special was good too we ordered the chicken feta.

While staying in Vegas for a 4 day birthday trip, we wanted to get out of town a little and experience some of the other great restaurants with 4 and 5 star Yelp reviews.  So we took an Uber from our hotel and landed at this very fun breakfast and lunch spot.  The service is very friendly and swift.  Although, we were there in between breakfast and lunch and didn't experience the huge crowds as so many other reviewers had.  The food is very fresh and cooked perfectly.  I had a standard 2 eggs poached with smoked bacon and their house potatoes.  The poached eggs were cooked perfectly.  The bacon was slightly greasy, but the potatoes helped with that.  They were spiced and cooked crispy, just the way I like them.  A bit pricey I thought, but overall a great meal.

We went to meet a friend downtown for lunch at eat.  It is a happening little spot tucked away in the midst of exciting new forward thinking projects.  It is definitely picking up on the new vitality rought to downtown.  Chef Natalie Young had a vision to bring new energy just off the Fremont Street Experience and she nailed it.  Hunting for the restaurant at Carson and 7th Streets is part of the allure.  Just look for the shipping containers and there you are!

When you walk into the restaurant you feel this upbeat vibrancy and it makes you feel like you have found a very cool lunch spot that only the "in" crowd knows about.  It has a simple, no frills, down home kind of everydayness about it.  The emphasis is on the food and the great service.  

Our friend is a regular at eat and excitedly told us about all the tasty options available for our lunch choices.  I decided on the Shrimp Po Boy with chips and passion fruit tea.  The shrimp was good sized shrimp, which seemed to be grilled and seasoned to perfection.  And yes, I ate the whole thing.  Yum.  Our server was very attentive and kept our drinks filled while we enjoyed our time visiting and eating. 

I can't wait to come back and try the other items.  The mac and cheese is calling......

Very bad service. Sat 4 parties after they told me we were next.  Which is OK, but no apology. Sat at our table for 5 minutes before someone acknowledge us. She even checked on the table next to us twice. When it finally came time to order, no decaf coffee and no beignets. Very disappointing after hearing such good things about the place. Won't be back.

Update. 5 minutes after I order the chicken fried steak they tell me they are out of that!!!  Ridiculous!!!!!!

Food, great. Service, leaves something to be desired.

Food: I got the biscuits and turkey sausage, and both were great. The others I went with ordered a combination of breakfast and lunch foods, and all agreed their dishes tasted delicious.

Service: Came on a Friday, mid morning. Took about 40 minutes to be seated. Initial drink orders were taken pretty quickly, but everything after was slow. My friend got coffee served in a cup that had lipstick on it. Took forever to flag down the waitress, who took it away and then forgot to bring more. Even though the place is small, finding and getting the attention of our waitress was a challenge. I know the restaurant hasn't been around long, and it still has some kinks to work out.

Went for lunch and this place never disappoints when to food!  Had the grilled cheese with bacon and avocado! Delicious x10!  Our server suggested we try the fried deviled egg. He said it was a life changing moment.  We tried and WOW!  Let me tell you my life has changed as I will gain a few extra pounds because I want to eat those over and over again.They are for sure a must!  Just remember show up early because the place is busy and sometimes you have to wait for a table a little long. However worth the wait!
I live around the corner and LOVE this place. Pancakes from heaven and great specials too. They have vegetarian options and lots of sides to choose from.

Awesome food. Saw the Amex commercial and thought I would check it out. Glad I did. Roast beef sandwich was awesome.  Get the chips with the lunch made fresh daily.  They said the pancakes are really good   Will be back staff was very friendly. The area is a it seedy but that is a plus in my book.

Buzz, buzz, buzz about Eat for a while now.  I wanted to see what the buzz was about, too, so myself and a friend showed up last Friday at 7:00am, eager to get our breakfast Eat on and....it was closed.  Both the Eat website and Yelp have the hours as opening at 7:00am Monday through Fridays, but that is no longer true as we discovered.  The new opening time is 8:00am.  Disappointed to say the least, we settled on DuPar's for pancakes--it's nice to have a backup downtown!  Round 2:  we showed up today at 8:00am and they were open for business--yes!  Both the beignets and the pancakes looked tempting, but I wanted to try something not sweet for once, so I went with the Shrimp and Grits with bacon.  Our waitress described it as being served in a big bowl with the bacon strips, then the grits, 3 big shrimp, topped by pico de gallo--that's what I got and it was GOOD!  I never eat something so heavy for breakfast, but I liked the combination, being sure to get each part of the dish in each spoonful--very creative and delicious.  I tried my friend's dish, the Huevos Motulenos, which I didn't order only because I don't do spicy food.  If you have the spicy gene, you should order it; I had a bite and it was also delish.  Service was excellent and the space itself is very comfy and clean.  I love having places like this springing up Downtown.  I'll definitely be back for lunch and to try the beignets--just please update the business hours so others don't show up at 7:00am and walk away, sad and hungry.

Eat is a great breakfast spot off the Strip.  If we lived nearby, it would certainly be a place we'd frequently regularly and I really like the neighborhood feel of the place.  The exterior may not impress you.  It is housed on the first floor of an apartment complex, but they've done charming things to the insides.  Eat has a retro but modern feel and a dividing wall lush with greenery.  

We started off with the Beignets, which are served with seasonal jam (here, strawberry) and a vanilla mascarpone.  The beignets themselves visibly oily and tough but the vanilla marscapone is wonderful.  The creamy texture and deep vanilla flavor matched really well with the strawberry jam. 

I'm a fan of Mexican breakfasts so I was drawn to the Juevos Montelunos.  Two over easy eggs lay atop a fried corn tortilla and an unexpected but delicious mixture of peas, fetas, and bananas with a yin\/yang coverage of a salsa roja and salsa verde.  Roasted potatoes rounded everything off.  This dish isn't truly Mexican - peas? feta instead of cotija? bananas instead of plaintain? But oddly, it does work and it's filling for a vegetarian dish.  

John's shrimp and grits with bacon was a stunner.  It was a generous portion with thick strips of bacon and plump shrimp.  The sauce on the plate was heavenly, with a spicy, savory kick and creamy grits.  He nursed a cup of the Colorado roasters coffee.  

It's a breakfast and lunch only place so the mornings are lively.  They brought in a very talented guitar player, with his spin on contemporary songs and really excellent picking skills.

This place is the best if you're in the area early or afternoon. It's always soo good. May be a wait to be seated, but so worth it! Unique food pairings and the bacon is the best. Make sure you try the deviled eggs!
I thought it was just ok.  The owner is wonderful.  I don't know if I'd rush back, however.

Great food! I really enjoyed my truffled egg sandwich. My husband had the dish that was kind of like breakfast nachos and wasn't wowed, but liked it. The service was good, although our server was replaced by someone else with no explanation (her shift was over??). But both servers were very nice and friendly. I liked the decor which has a very trendy\/industrial feel. 
With two dishes and one coffee it was probably the most expensive breakfast I've ever had at $40 (including tip).

Among the buffets and restaurants that serve up greasy (delicious) foods in Downtown, there is Eat: a new restaurant serving up tasty, healthy meals to help jump start your day or revive you from the morning grind at mid-day. 

RESTAURANT
Located a few blocks away from the Fremont Street Experience, Eat is located on Carson Street. Inside you'll notice the urban-industrial decor and potted greenery, which is always nice to see especially if you're so used to seeing brown dirt all the time. The floors are concrete and the ceiling has an unfinished appearance with its exposed pipes. I mention this because the restaurant was very noisy when I visited, so the sound was bouncing off the floor and ceiling.

FOOD
Free Range Chicken Cibatta Sandwich: Does free range chicken taste better than ones that are pumped up with steroids? I can't say for sure, but I guess I feel less guilty.  The sandwich was delicious with its melted mozzarella cheese, pesto mayo, and mixed greens. 

The sandwich can be paired with your choice of homemade potato chips or potato salad. You'll also receive  a "really good pickle", as stated on the menu. The potato chips were crunchy and not greasy. Both my friend and I didn't receive pickles with our meals since they were all out of them. Unfortunate since we were really looking forward to trying this supposed, "really good pickle" which I imagine would complement our sandwiches. 

SERVICE
Even though it was busy when my friend and I arrived, the service didn't disappoint. We received our orders fairly quickly, and if we needed anything our waiter wasn't too far from our table. 

TIPS
+ Seems like this place can get packed during lunchtime hours, so it might be best heading down here right when lunch is being served at 11:00 a.m.

+There's meter parking across the street from the restaurant, although you could just park at one of the nearby casino parking garages. 

OVERALL
I think Eat is on to something here with its fresh, delicious, healthy food that leaves you feeling good without any of the, "I hate my life! I shouldn't have eaten that" regrets.
Tried to call to make a reservation, no go. We arrived with our big party and it was an hour and a half to two hour wait. It makes no sense to not offer big parties a reservation option.

Killer Cheese with thick-cut applewood smoked bacon and avocado, with a Bruce Cost Ginger Ale Unfiltered is probably one of the best meals here in Las Vegas. Everything felt fresh and wholesome. Staff is also quite friendly!

When you're visiting a new city, you want to find the places that speak best to you. In the Fremont Arts District, we found Eat. It sounded like a foodie brunch paradise in the middle of the Vegas hipstertown. 

That type of description usually means we waited an hour for mediocre food and meh service. We waited ten minutes for amazing food and ridiculously on point service. I had the short stack hot cakes (beautifully done with crunchy edges and real maple syrup!), a side of bacon and chicken Apple sausage, and a bowl of grits (!) to round it out. To say it was great is an understatement. My partner had the truffle egg sandwich and it was amazing! The place is great and the best reason to come downtown that we've found.

Had no clue what "The Eat" was, but I figured I would give it a try after my lunch partners today suggested it.  While on the way down I checked out the trusty Yelp and saw it had very good reviews so my anticipation grew.  

Upon entering,  this place was small to average in size, but had several tables to accommodate the lunch crowd.  As such this made it very loud and very hard to hear the conversation I was having, but the staff was amazing and the food looked very good as the staff was hustling it out.

It took  a few minutes for us to be seated, but our waitress was spot on.  The drinks and food were out very quickly.  Our waitress was happy and up beat all while dealing with a busy lunch crowd, and never missed a beat.  

I went with a chicken sandwich, (added avocado) and the green chili pesole soup.  I was not ready for the flavor explosion that happened with each bite.  The portions size was amazing and for the price could not have been happier.  Both my lunch partners that day agreed.

This place is another fine Downtown eat spot.  Only draw back is the noise level and crowds, but it's worth the possible slight hearing loss for the food.  Will be back again, and will try non peak hours.  Well done!!!!

Everything from the food to the environment screams trendy coffee house... but wait! The food is actually awesome. Juices are fresh, kitchen is clean, lots of interesting things on the menu... this is done very well. 
The place is memorable, I stumbled on it a year ago and couldn't wait to bring friends here during my current visit. 
I would love to have given them five stars, but our waitress was more interested in seating new clients than dropping our check. We literally waited with empty glasses and plates while finally standing up and leaving for us to checkout. 
I wouldn't let that discourage you from visiting. When in vegas, this is a must to visit and enjoy. 
Shrimp and grits were a very cool change, but pancakes and fresh orange juice is awesome too!

Long wait for a large group on a Sunday for brunch but we'll worth the wait. Excellent service by the staff once seated. The shrimp and grits is a must try. The apple sausage with pancakes is also worth it. Pleasure Palate rated.

Holy Cow YUM! It's so hard for my husband and I to find a place that is unbelievably delicious with amazing service! This place literally knocked out socks off. Went here on a Monday morning. It was busy! But was sat in no time. 

Food: OMG...mouth is watering just thinking I've the sandwiches. Husband got the farm fresh chicken sandwich with house made chips. Probably one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had. Everything about it was great, the bread, condiments, aioli and chicken were amazing. I got the roast beef, I'm a sucker for picked onions so I got so excited! Wasn't as good as I was hoping, but man that chicken sandwich I'll never forget. Chef - you absolutely know what your doin. Keep it up, fantastic! Will recommend your restaurant to anyone. 

Service: fantastic! Got a couple recommendations from another foodie server. We were only in town for one night so we had to make everything count. Absolutely amazing! We just chit chatted with a couple of servers for a couple minutes. 

By far one of the best brunch places in Vegas. Just a couple minutes from freemont street. If your down there and hungry, GO!

The crew is friendly and provides great service.  This is a wonderful breakfast\/brunch venue! We ordered deviled eggs, truffle egg sandwich and their special for the day. You have to park on the streets so get to the venue early! Get here before 10am if you don't want to wait.

Awesome band of talented culinary pirates. Great vibe. Indoor n outdoor seating. Fun. Hip. Cool. Tantalizing. Memorable. Yummy. Delectable.  Is your interest peeked?  What are you waiting for.. Go experience!
Wow! What an amazing place. This is a hidden Gem! Best food I ever had. No Lie!! Service was excellent as well. Thanks!!

Holy crap this place was good.  My friends and I took a walk here from Fremont Street during our guy's trip to Vegas because of the great Yelp reviews.  It did not disappoint.  We sat at the common table and were immediately greeted by the friendly staff.  Shortly after we sat down, a woman over-heard us talking about appetizers and immediately interrupted us to tell us we had to order the deviled-eggs.  Wow was she spot on.  The egg whites were deep-fried while the yokes were mixed with amazing-ness and put back onto the newly deep-fried egg whites.  We found out later that the woman who suggested it was the owner of the restaurant.  Turns out she knows what she's talking about.

After that I had the veggieburger which was by far the best I ever had.  I don't even know what else to say about it, just get it, or anything else on their menu.

I would definitely come back here.  It's also conveniently located next to container park which is always fun to walk through.  Bring your llama.

Not affiliated with the EAT in Los Angeles, this place was still very good.  I had the Chicken Fried Steak.  It wasn't the best I ever had, but it was seasoned good and was presented good with scratch gravy on top with steaming hot potatoes.  The beef is chuck very well tenderized and it's a thick steak.  Tenderizing a thick steak does require a lot of pounding and I felt that the fat was pounded out of this steak, so it ended up being a bit lean and dry.  More gravy would have fixed this issue.  Sister had the truffled egg croissant.  I tried some of it and didn't get much of the truffle oil.  Bacon was crispy good and the croissant had a good flaky texture. Good service too.

I'm almost glad that I don't live in Las Vegas because I would "Eat" here every single weekend!! LV certainly has it's fair share of memorable restaurants in the hotels and on the strip, but Eat. is one of the best breakfast\/brunch spots I've ever laid my palate on...period! 

Thanks Chef Natalie for the awesome recommendations. The roast beef sandwich was simple yet complex...full of flavor and texture. My friend loves shrimp & grits more than life itself, and she raved about it the rest of the afternoon! 

Next time I'm going to try those amazing pancakes that I hear so many good things about. 

Enjoy!

If you're looking for organic, high end fusion food, then eat. is your place.  It has a lot of great reviews.  Don't get me wrong, the food was good.  I had a chicken sandwich with free range chicken and you could taste the difference.  Plus, they make their own potato chips which were delightful.  But, my wife was looking for plain breakfast food, and eat. doesn't have your typical breakfast fare.  So, she was not happy with the experience.  When you combine my high rating with her low rating, eat. gets a solid 3 (really more for those looking for a unique experience).  So, this is not a comfort food spot.  It is instead a food experience (whether this will be one time or a frequent spot).

Awesome service, awesome food. Love the  TRUFFLED EGG SANDWICH and the GOLDEN BROWN PANCAKES. Will come back again. 

Note: Parking is on the street for 2 hours.

Great restaurant. I went for brunch with friends and will definitely be back. The portions were large, the staff was friendly, and the food was really good. Try the deep fried deviled eggs! The only downside was no alcohol but we totally forgot about that once we started eating.

My husband and I have wanted to try this place F O R E V E R!!! But they always looked busy from the outside.  This past Sunday we were in need of some delicious breakfast and decided to pop in, regardless of how busy they seemed to be.  ABSOLUTLY NO REGRETS, in fact, we questioned why in the world it took us sooo long to try them! 

It's far more spacious inside than it appears to be from the outside.

We ordered the Truffled Egg Sandwich & Kick Ass Tomato Soup to share and they did not disappoint!  Portions are good sizes; we took 1\/3 of the sandwich and about half the soup home for later :)   The cibatta bread for the sandwich was so soft and wonderful.  The soup was hearty and great left over. The wait staff was attentive, refilling our waters and bringing the check without us even asking! 

We will definitely be back to try more of their other offerings!! Thanks EAT for such a great experience!!
Christina the server was amazing. Suggested a delicious sandwich since I was undecided. Place is super close to to where I love. With the fun, cute atmosphere I'll definitely be back to try more.

Crowded but why??? I had skinny jenny salad--pounded chicken breast and arugala.  Toughest chicken ever.  Tiny @ $11 bucks.  Cheap.  Friend had reuban. Plate was 95% carb. Little bit of of corned beef w some unknown melted cheese.  Big bread and lotta chips. In a word lousy.

Came here for brunch on a Sunday! It was already packed at 10 AM so that tells you something. It was a 5-10 min wait for three people. 

I ordered the Huevos Motulenos, but I got to try the beignets, chicken fried steak, the housemade chips and the benedifct. 

I personally didn't enjoy the Huevos Motulenos. I found the flavors and consistencies to be contrasting. Black beans and peas were too hard, salsa didn't complement the dish, there was hardly any egg, the tortilla was soggy, and the bananas confused the entire dish. 

The beignets were really fluffy, but they would have been better if made and served fresh. They were barely warm when they got to our table. The strawberry jam was really good, though. 

The Benedict was decent. Not bad, but nothing to write home about. 

The Chicken Fried Steak was definitely the best plate. The gravy was seasoned deliciously, I just wish there was more of it. A little too much breading but it added good crunch and flavor. 

Prices ranged from $11-14 for entrees, so I wouldn't come here on a regular basis. But when I do I'll be sure to order the CFS or Shrimp n Grits.

A nice tucked away gem of Las Vegas goodness. 
Great iced tea, friendly employees. 
Only draw back, no refill on my husband's soft drink. 
BUT! THEE, Best BLT ever! 
Going back soon 
Lisa D

I was surprised by the small menu but was happy with our food once we got it. The eggs benedict was very good, with the combo of crunchy toasted English muffin, spinach, tomato and hollandaise sauce. Our waitress gave us fair warning about the smaller portion of this dish so no shocker there.  Free range chicken sandwich was also very yummy. Service was fast and staff was super friendly.

We ate at The Eat this Sunday for breakfast. The food is great, I loved every bite. The reason I am giving it two stars is because of the service. The hostess was rude and not accommodating. You have the feeling that you are being rushed. Our server rolled her eyes when she tried to take my husbands plate and he told her he was not finished yet. We were a group of eight but when we asked if we could be seated together the hostess said no even though there was clearly Seating available. So the food is great but the overall service was very poor and that matters to me.

In town for work for 1 day. My client suggested it for lunch, but we had too many for lunch rush.

I went for breakfast the next day by myself and sat at the bar.
Food: very tasty - just had eggs and bacon. All perfect, as was rye toast and potatoes
Service: Fantastic - they work as a team to check in. Very friendly.
Room - cool art. Good mood. Noisy, but not too bad

Basically, it started my day out in great way. I would come back for sure.

We felt so welcomed right off the bat. Such a comfortable place. We ordered the chicken fried steak and it was amazing. I never thought I could get excited about toast but it too was to die for. I have never given any restaurant 5 stars but would give EAT more if I could. Loved every bit of our experience here. Thank you!

Great quality food in a hip atmosphere with friendly helpful service.  I ordered the chicken sandwich with tomato soup. The chicken was moist, tender, delicious, not salty, & topped with mixed greens on a ciabatta bun.....perfect.  Tomato soup.....yummy.  We walked from the Cal Hotel in the middle of the afternoon.  Though, worth the walk, it's smarter to call Lyft or Uber.

Went here for brunch on a Saturday around 10:30 and was told it'd be a 25 minute wait for two. It ended up only being about 15 minutes though. There was a little bit of confusion throughout the meal with service (a random waiter tried to refill my BF's Sprite with water and we were brought the bill twice--once by our actual waiter and once by someone else). But I suppose it's better to be paid too much attention to than the opposite! My boyfriend had the corned beef hash, which was really great. Very flavorful. I had the traditional breakfast and it was fine. The bacon was good, potatoes weren't as flavorful as i'd hoped, and the jam was similarly blah. All in all, we'd go back but it might not be our first choice.
Delicious chicken sandwich. Wife loved the arugula chicken salad. Great staff and atmosphere for a 2 year old. Get more than 1 high chair though!

Very cool vibe. The menu for breakfast, brunch and lunch are quite different. But very eclectic. Whatever you do, do not order extra toast. Lol. Their toast is Texas sized toast. I had the brisket and eggs which were phenomenal and my wife had he mountain of pancakes. Wee seated very quickly by courteous and competent staff. 

The atmosphere is as eclectic as the menus. A must do those who crave good ol' fashioned eats. We will be back.

We stumbled upon this place this morning after we were heading home from our stay cation . This place is super cool inside and the waiter Gary was awesome! The menu is small which I appreciate I hate to have to choose from so many items . I had the pancakes and chicken sausage it was YUMMY! The pancakes were light and fluffy not sinkers in the tummy, the sausage was the bomb ! The coffee is excellent . They sell the coffee beans so it's there blend. I would definitely recommend this place .

The shrimp and grits here are a fan favorite but honestly everything is great. The food is great; the atmosphere, the customer service, the speed of service... I do not think I have ever given a 5-star rating anywhere but I do not believe I could even talk this place up enough. If you live in town and have not tried it A FEW TIMES then you are missing out, if you are headed anywhere in Las Vegas it is worth the trip. Today they are actually having some dishes professionally photographed so it is great to be able to see the presentation of so many dishes and the owner is giving them away to customers for free after the pictures are taken. Love, love, love this place.

Don't understand the high ratings. Atmosphere of the place is cool but the food is lacking. Mix flavors that should not be mixed and dishes lack the right type of flavor. I got the huevos with red and green salsas and both of the salsas themselves lacked flavor but then there were all kinds of random other things in the dish which just didn't fit. And I wouldn't be as disappointed if it was a cheap breakfast place by for the hefty price tag of this dish it is not worth what you get.

This place seemed to be recommended as a healthy spot downtown. Parking was difficult and it felt creepy walking in that neighborhood with the people in their apartments eyeing me. 
The people there were very attentive and nice even though it was the lunch rush and they were pretty crowded. Took my order efficiently and brought it out in the amount of time they said would take (due to parking I was in a rush and was doing takeout)
Got two sandwiches. I got the veggie burger. The burger was good with the avocado on top but oh my I couldn't find it underneath all that bread so it was quite messy as I took most of the bread off. He had the roast beef and he liked it but again not as much meat as salad components it seemed. Gave him my potato salad and he said it wasn't mayo but not sure what it was... Ranch based? He did like his potato chips. 
If they put the veggie burger on thinner bread as it said wheat but didn't look like wheat, and more meat on his it would have been better. Glad I tried it and would go if a group was going to get breakfast options but not somewhere I would seek out.

You know what? They say they prepare food with love and I believe it. Other wise can can eggs and potatoes taste so good? 
Cinnamon biscuits are amazing.
Sadly no gluten free options...Coffee was good. Everyone enjoyed their food some what the chips where old on the chiliqules

Out of this world flavor!! Hidden gem of Vegas strip on the old side of the strip. Minus all the hype of being in the center of the strip, hard to find but you will. Came here for breakfast after court and the place did not disappoint for a morning crave. Had the shrimp and grits because why not it's one of the sought after selection from foodies around. My date said it was out of this world! Hahaha. That bacon and melted cheese just topped the out of the world flavor of this dish.  I was craving for the eggs Benedict but only available on weekends. I came on a weekday to avoid the crowd and long lines. Got there when in opened and got seated right away but within minutes it was full.  I had the eggs mouloteno and it was s different flavor each bite! It was a combination of plantain, black beans, salsa, sweet sausage with eggs on top over easy. I finished the whole thing except for the potatoes with it. Also ordered the biscuits pancake, which was so so, just a bit of moist to it would have been perfect. The brew was so good I had to have two cups. 

The place was clean and server was friendly and came with great recommendations. They always came to check up on us which was great. Would highly recommend this place for great food and the location was definitely out of your ordinary Vegas strip. It was a bit of nostalgia of the Bugsy side of Vegas.

Delicious food and great portions. I ate the shrimp and grits, my daughter had the pancakes and we shared the cinnamon biscuits. I love the atmosphere. The food came out fast. We were in and out in less than 1 hour. It's a little pricey but in some respects worth it

So disappointed!!! Arrived at Eat today at 11:45. We were so excited to finally try this place and had high hopes. We were a party of 13 and were told it would be an hour and 1\/2. An hour and 1\/2 seemed long but based on our party we accepted it and agreed to wait. We asked the hostess to take our number as we had 7 kids and wanted to let them play at the Container Park.
